38934208.review:
Cinderella Phenomenon is a visual novel about a selfish and cold-hearted princess, whose life changes drastically because of the Fairytale Curse.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ The art is so beautiful. The character art, the CGs, the backgrounds, the menu, the interface, everything is just so pretty.
+ The characters are amazing. I have no more words for how much I like them.
+ Every route is well written. I found playing them really enjoyable.
+ The recommended playing order really makes the build-up of the plot stand out. 
+ The spinning diamonds in the top corner really saved me. I just couldn't reach any good end, no matter what I did. But thanks to this nice feature it all worked out :)

[b]Con:[/b]
- [spoiler]As much as I love all the characters, I feel so sad that there's no good end with Varg :( [/spoiler]

Words can not describe how much I love this game. I can't write a proper conclusion. It's just such a wonderful visual novel.

38923605.review:
I definitely recommend this game if you enjoy visual novels.
This was my first experience with a true visual novel (I had only played "Hatoful Boyfriend"...), and I really enjoyed it. The art style can only be described as gorgeous; it's full of color and detail, making the game a delight to look at. The music was alright, but it conveyed emotion very well, even if I don't remember any specifics. The story is absolutely fantastic! Even if you HATE this game, you will love the story; it's charming, original, and it truly plays with your heart, especially if you end up getting a bad end.
All in all, I say this game is a delight for your first visual novel experience. I would highly recommend it.

38897723.review:
[b] Tldr: [/b] Invest your time in playing this game all the way through (as well as in the order recommended by the developers) to fully understand and appreciate the depth of this free game. While free, the content is high quality in all aspects.

Honestly, there was a part of me that was reluctant to start the game. I initially couldn't connect with the character because of her coarseness, and I was more curious of the story. But once I got into it, there was no return. I was hooked. It's shockingly free even though the time and effort and love put into the game is apparent. Whether it be the CG images, the music, or even the dialogue, this is amazing in its entirety.

So initially for all the plots, there was something weird about each character that made me squint my eyes at following their plot (will mention each) and thinking "how am I going to like this plotline", bUT even though I mainly just did routes because I was really [i] really [/i] interested in the story, I ended up liking them all. Like I said before, I was really reluctant to play the game, but it grew on me so much to the point where I love the game.

[h1] Opinions/Insight On Each Storyline [/h1]
[list]

[*] [b] Rod: [/b] So I didn't realize until halfway through this plotline that oh sh-t this is an otome. Like the plot lines actually lead to love interests. So I started this route because I thought "Oh this route will definitely be [u] easy for my protagonist [/u] ." [i] *facepalm* [/i] So yeah, Rod was my first playthrough. Under normal circumstances, this plotline is highkey gross because half incest. BUT I actually really enjoyed this plot line because of Rod's character arc, his general awkwardness, and [spoiler] Sebby. Sebby's commentary is perfect. [/spoiler] Rod's awkwardness is utterly endearing and adorable. His arc is paced well and is believable. There are an abundance of fuzzy moments, and I loved it. If you're an achievement hunter, I recommend this plot for the Guided By Intuition achievement because Rod is quick to let you know you've done something wrong. Rod's was the second best for me.
[*] [b] Rumpel: [/b] I actually switched Karma and Rumpel with the recommendation order unknowingly, so through this experience, there were parts in the story that weren't quite gaps but weren't quite in flow with how the information from the previous story goes into the next story. From this, I learned, yes follow their recommended order to playthrough each storyline. After Rod, I was worried to start Rumpel's because his personality is a completely different spectrum from Rod's. Going from a cute, awkward boy to a flirtatious man was ooh scary. But of course, I found myself loving this one too. This one is definitely focuses more on the development of the protagonist in more than just kindness but opening up to people. While in Rod's, I was gushing at how adorable Rod was. For Rumpel, his was more romantic and swoon worthy. Unfortunately, he ranked fifth of them all, but please note, this is not because his story wasn't enjoyable. 
[*] [b] Karma: [/b] You get introduced to Karma as a female initially, so my squinting stemmed from that. The personalities of Rumpel and Karma are very similar, so he too had swoon worthy moments. They both had the same amount ,but I honestly liked Karma's a lot more than Rumpel's because the bonding between the protagonist and Karma were better than with Rumpel's in my opinion. Also, I felt his fairytale curse fit the story better than Rumpel's. Bonus points to Karma too for [spoiler] two shirtless CGs. He's the only one who gets them. [/spoiler] I swooned at Karma just as often as the romantic moments. Karma is third for me just because Rod was the first and of course, the first is always a smidge more special.
[*] [b] Fritz: [/b]: After playing through the first three storylines, you get some background on Fritz, and because of this, a lot of his story was more predictable when relating back to the story. What I did really like about Fritz that made him fourth and not fifth was that he had an initial relationship with your character. I really dug the guard and princess aspect because it added to making his motivations believable. Overall, Fritz is a sweetheart. His story was half sweetness and half uh/whoa moments just relating to his character, so this bumped him to at least fourth because of the tough competition. He's also not fifth because he had at least 3 heart wrenching moments. yEAH.
[*] [b] Waltz: [/b] There's a reason the developer's recommend choosing Waltz last because his storyline takes all the information you've learned from the previous stories and shows them all executed as you would imagine and then some. Because of this, his story is so fleshed out. My initial yikes was [spoiler] that you meet Waltz as a boy. Not Rod being a teenager with boyish charm, like an actual boy that's shorter than you. You do find out from one of the storylines that whoa he's a charmer that's actually taller than you and (and from his) older, but it takes a bit for sure. But once he's in his older form, [/spoiler] My God is he the most attractive love choice. #TallDarkAndHandsome Obviously, I swooned the most just from that. But plus the moments? My heart was a flutter with this romance. He also has a relationship with the protagonist before the storyline so everything he does and says is just yes. Nearly all your encounters are sweet or romantic, and because he's the last one, h-ll yeah he gets all the best CGs. You can tell Waltz is definitely the favorite of the developers because of the extensive endings for him.

[/list]

Long story short, see the unfolding of this story yourself because the love plots are barely the surface of the story. This story is also brimming with plot twists and is action.

38850799.review:
This is an absolutely incredible visual novel that I would gladly have paid money for.

The characters are so complex and they are all very likeable, making it impossible for me to pick a favourite or say which of the 5 boys' routes was the best! Each is afflicted by a different curse based on a classic fairytale, and you try to break their curse as they help you try to break your own curse, the Cinderella curse. You have gone from riches to rags in order to learn an important lesson, and the game doesn't just focus on your bachelor once you choose him - it has an amazing supporting cast as well who will make you feel every emotion, from anger to sorrow and everything in between.

While the story is the most important thing in visual novels, the graphics here are also of high standard, which really helps to immerse you in the story. The music isn't repetitive or distracting, and it changes throughout the story to suit the scenarios you are in, which just adds to the experience. Once you have seen a particular dialgoue, you can then fast forward through it, and even skip to the next unseen dialogue or choice, which is very useful for the replays as there are 10 chapters to each story and they are very long.

The replayability is fantastic - there are 5 pursuable male characters, each with a good and a bad ending. It took me 14 hours to read through everyone's story, but skipping the dialogue I had already seen during my second playthrough of that character. Everyone's story gives you more information about the world, and every bachelor has his own unique path due to them having different curses. Two of the characters' routes are locked to begin with, and I liked that because their routes wouldn't have made sense had I played them first, and it gives you something to aim for aside from the achievements.

This is an amazing game and I highly recommend it to any visual novel fan, but especially those who like a bit of fantasy and magic.

38817976.review:
Английский, мягко говоря, не мой конёк. А если и конёк, то весьма дефективный... "Но ведь новелла бесплатная!" - подумала я, сдувая пол кило пыли с англо-русского словарика. "Я ведь могу просто попытаться!" - подумала я, смутно вспоминая, что "London is the capital of Great Britain...". "Не смогу - просто не стану проходить." - подумала я, не осозновая, на что иду... Пролог был пролистан быстро, весело и звонко. Воспряв духом, с победоносной улыбкой, я приступила к первой главе. "Да не так уж и плохо я знаю английский (нет)" - решила я. Я еще никогда так не ошибалась... На один рут у меня ушло 9 (!) часоов. Оказалось, что кроме простых слов и неправильных глаголов , в тексте присутствовали и другие слова... В очередной раз открывая переводчик, я познала унижение, сравнимое с прохождением Sid Meier's Civilization V на уровне Божество... Особенно когда переводила то же слово в третий раз... Но даже это не заставило меня  бросить новеллу.
А если серьезно, то смысл реплик вполне понятен, пусть и интуитивно или ситуативно. Я рада, что нашла эту игру. Конечно на русском прохождение было бы в разы приятнее и проще, но это ведь исключительно моя проблема - знание английского языка. 
Новелла красивая, музыка приятная и весьма к месту, история любопытная. Если с английским проблем нет - рекомендую. Если проблемы есть - рекомендую, но с учетом наличия времени на "погуглить" и побиться головой об стену от осознания собственной недальновидности (говорили мама с папой - учи язык!!!11) и легкого флёра тупости.
Еще раз. Новелла классная. Правда. И она таки бесплатная =D Да и текст, по сути, не сложный)

38561356.review:
良くも悪くも普通すぎるノベルゲーです。
無料のなので、とりあえず遊んでみましょう。
すごいところはないけど、機能は十分で
遊びやすいです。
以下にネタバレはありません。

攻略対象のキャラは5人で、
１人攻略にだいたい8時間ほど。
共通ルート2章の後に、
好きなキャラを選んで、攻略できます。
しかし最初から選べるのは3人で、
残りの2人は実績の解除が必要。
早送りや会話ログなどがあり、
クリア後に既読スキップも解禁され、
必要なものは揃っています。
しかし、選んだ選択肢のチェックや
既読の文章は色は変化しないので自分で覚えている必要があります。
正しい選択肢は、音やグラフィックで教えてくれるので
ハッピーエンドは簡単に目指せます。
この機能は初期設定でOnになっていますが、
いつでもOffにもできます。
セーブ、ロードもいつでも可能です。
ギャラリーもあり、音楽や一枚絵は鑑賞できまが、
エンディングや背景はギャラリーにありません。
全実績の解除には、最初は飛ばさないで読むと30時間とはかかると思います。
自分は3人攻略で止まりました。

主人公は名前を変更でき、登場人物は20人くらいです。
ストーリーは単純なので、
たまにわからない文章や単語があっても困ることはないと思います。
主人公を含め、攻略対象のキャラクターは全員、
なにか童話にちなんだ呪いを受けており、それを解くのが目的です。

So, first the bad, and the good. 

The bad: Once you're going down a track with a character, making "wrong" choices doesn't really queer the storyline... until the end. It means you need to go all the way back to the start and make sure you make enough "right" choices even though there's no visible story effect, or at best a very subtle one, if you want a "good" ending.

The good: So, I'm a dude playing an otome visual novel for the first time. This game was so touching it made me question my heterosexuality (totally fell in love with Karma) and it made me stay up until 4am playing it, all the while bawling like your most sentimental auntie at a wedding. I had all the feels. And that's only with the Karma plotline. Can't wait to try out the others.

If you like romance, magic, and a female protagonist who is stubborn and strong yet vulnerable and blushes a lot, this is the game for you.

38353424.review:
Cinderella Phenomenon is an Otome game that centers around an 'Icy' princess that has been cursed and demoted (from riches to rags) in order for her to thaw her heart and learn kindness. At the start of the game, the princess can choose between five other cursed individuals in order for them to help each other lift their curse. The story in itself may seem simple enough, but as long as the routes are played IN ORDER, the plot of the story will get progressively thicker and at some points darker. 

The character routes that will need to be played in order will come as follows (based on the how plot driven the routes are) from least to most: 
-Rod
-Karma
-Rumpel
-Fritz
-Waltz

While personal character favorites from best to least come as follows (this is my opinion):
-Waltz
-Karma
-Fritz
-Rod
-Rumple

In all honesty, the game is so good that it is kind of shocking to see that it is a free game. The story is well written (favorite being Waltz), artwork is really beautiful with no visible flaws, and the music is nice and beautiful. A definite recommendation.

38343986.review: One of the best otome I've played so far. The artwork and music was especially stunning. Though this might be an unpopular opinion but I really loved Lucette (our main heroine) I loved her strong personality, sure she was annoying, rude and frustrating at first but I could personally relate and understood what she was feeling and why she acted the way she did. I've always loved fantasy based otomes so the storylines got me hooked up in less than 5 mins. But what I really loved was the deep routes, especially Waltz's (still regret not playing him last tbh) I got emotionally unstable. Despite that each and every route still has their own differences and that just makes me want to play more and more, not to mention the life lesson you can take from the stories (Karma's route made me cry rip). Overall this game is just amazing

38096387.review:
Visual Novel Lover must play this!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Now I got that out of my system…. This is a super wonderful Otome Choice Driven FREE Visual Novel. Like all otome Visual novel you start with a Girl that was overwhelm by great bitterness in life.

Over the course of the story by interaction with different character she gradually opens up and by story choice she will couple with 1 of the 5 boys she meet. Each unique and awkward in their own way. Though Trust, Love and choices you can either get a good ending or a bad ending. That makes up to a total of 10 different endings each route is very unique and interesting in their own ways.

Some heartwarming, some heartache, some inspiring, some Anger and lost… The mix of feeling just go on and on. 

Everyone in the story was under an influence of a Fairytale curse. The main protagonist was under Cinderella Curse and other character you interact with in the story have background in fairytale such as Beauty and Beast, Little Mermaid and Little Red Hood Etc. Though the connection with fairytale was a bit loose it still define each character very well and during the revealing of the fairytale identity it’s always “wow, I guessed it!”

Very good and smart story script with constant piano music and decent character design. 10 chapters in total and average 2-3 hours to read though each chapter. Once you go through the story once Skip and Fast Forward feature will be enabled so it would make things quicker.

9/10. This game got a boost in Rating since it’s FREE! Among all the free VN on steam I find this one the longest and most interesting. I would paid about 10$ for the game If I know it was this good. Don’t miss it if you like Otome VN.

38034261.review:
i didn't have high hopes for this but guess who's crying over Fritz at 1 AM?

hint: it's me

anyway, very nice concept and plot, with different character development in each route which i loved a lot because the main character grew differently in each route. They also kept the canon consistent and if played in the reccommended sequence, everything felt even more consistent and well thought. [spoiler] such as rumpel being a doctor [/spoiler] A few minor things that bothered me include the fact that i cant skip transistions to CGs (y'know, when they zoom in on the love interest for like a solid 5 seconds,) or when someone gives u an item. The art itself is sometimes a little wonky, (not that it matters, if you're a crybaby like me, you'll be crying half the time anyway) but if you can live with that, this is definitely a good game with an amazing plot, interesting characters and a well developped main character who isn't a normal helpless otoge heroine. Also it's a free anyway so you may as well give it a shot y'know...

Also another little and specific thing that irked me a little about this game is [spoiler] the fact that in Waltz's route, the main character changed a little too quickly compared to the other routes. As a result, the entire plot felt rushed and it generally felt underwhelming when compared to Fritz's, who is also a locked option. Too many things are also revealed in the previous routes, i.e Tinkerbell and Neverland. This bothered me because it's obvious that Waltz's route is meant to be [/spoiler] the "true" route. it felt difficult for me to feel attached [spoiler] to waltz [/spoiler] because we don't really see much of the character before the true route. The other locked route felt much more dramatic and kept me on edge instead...

But then again it may be my preference, but all in all, excellent game with a beautiful plot, music and loveable characters. 8/10

Really good story with pretty visuals with a main character that isn't annoying but also not perfect. Very engaging indeed. 

Edit: Read all stories. Rating from best to worse.

Plot
1. Fritz (too bad the romance kinda suffered)
2. Waltz (more complete story but less exciting pace than Fritz)
3. Karma
4. Rumpel (had more reveals than Karma's but less exciting plot overall)
5. Rod (a good place to start)

Romance
1. Karma (the most intense and fantastical, most fairy tale like story)
2. Rod
3. Fritz (had so much potential, could have been better than Karma's)
4. Waltz (too easy, no tension)
5. Rumpel (...)

It's weird cuz in most Otome games, its usually easy to know why the girl falls in love with the guys but I sometimes get confused what even draws them to her. But in this story, I completely understand why they would all fall in love with her. The main character has a really strong personality. But I can only clearly see her fall in love with Karma and Rod. Seems to me that she got seduced by Karma and felt bonded with Rod. With Fritz it almost happened but lacked development and the rest just suddenly happened... I felt it most absurd that she fell for Rumpel at all...

37913887.review:
One of the best Otome games I've ever played. The story had excellent set of characters, scripts, and the characters were completely fleshed out which made the story feel that much better.

You could really see and feel each characters perspective which made the game feel so unique not like other games that I have played that feel liek they have the same characters replayed.

 This game will also bring you to tears. This story will likely have you emotionally attached to the characters so be well prepared if you choose to play this game. 

The art and music add to the fable-like story and characters really well.  I was really surprised that the choices in the game such as the choices you need for the good endings weren't always the virtuous type of decisions and that the story wants you to know each characters way of thinking before you can get that good ending, but being the good ending seeking type of person I always saved before the big choices so I could always get the good ending, but when I finished and started doing the bad endings I found out that wasn't always the good way to go.  

The bad endings left me feeling really emotional because the good endings really made me feel attached to the characters personalities, but I won’t spoil any of the endings for you. 

 I have to admit that Delora and Parfait played two great roles in this game helping move the story forward.  (For those who don’t know those are two of the characters that you see in the game.)

I honestly can't wait to see more games from the Dicesuki and I really hope the sequel will be somewhat similar to this storyline because I would love to see how my past character choices affect the future of the game.

Pros.

•	Music placement, it felt in place during each scene, chapter, or act in the story.

•	Unique music, I loved the intro to the game and the songs throughout the game they made me happy, frightened, and sad.

•	Great script, I didn’t notice any errors during my play through and it had me laughing, teary, and unhappy during my play through the game.

•	Memorable characters, I can’t forget any of the characters I met during the story they were indeed very memorable. 

•	Memorable endings, both the good endings and the bad endings were so very memorable, but the bad endings that I have done actually had me tearing up.

Cons. 

•	Repetitive music.
(Although it wasn’t an issue to me, I know there is definitely someone out there who thinks the same music is too receptive and how they would much rather have a different song playing, but it I don’t think it will affect the story or game for you.)

•	Choice bug where if you clicked anywhere it would pick the top choice.  
(It stopped after I loaded my save thankfully, I just wanted to bring it up and also it only happened once for me so it shouldn’t be that big of a problem as long as you save.)  

•	Made me have sad feels.
(Warning if you are emotional you will get sad during the bad endings and in some parts in the story.)


Favorite character: The Main character was my favorite character. 

My rating on the game, 10/10, it made me feel a whirlwind of emotions which few games do.  I hope I was helpful and I didn't give you too much info that it would ruin the experience because it's much better to experience the game firsthand and hopefully I wasn't too long, I just had a lot of things to say about this game.

37699157.review:
First let me say that this is a very enjoyable set of stories.

Now that that is out of the way, what you should expect. This is not a choose your own adventure novel or one of those games with a large, dizzying array of choices. This is a visual novel with clearly defined paths that walk you down a story. The choices, while deciding the ending, don't really alter much. This is one of those Visual Novels that are more novel than game. That is not bad, in fact I quite enjoy such things, however, it is not for everyone. 

Criticism wise my biggest issue is the bad ends. They feel kinda tacked on. As stated above this could be more looked at as a series of short stories about the same characters where events play out differently. It feels to me as if the choices and the dual endings for each route were forced in to make it more game like. This is mostly because the bad ends could have been much more. I dearly wish they had done an epilogue for the bad ends. Even if Rod's curse failed to be broken in time, in his route Em and Lucette got closer so there could have been an epilogue about them seeking comfort from one another and becoming true sisters. Etc. Long story short, don't expect much from the bad ends. They could have been so much more, but instead they just end and leave you wondering about what would happen next.

The second criticism has been brought up in other reviews, but it can be a trick at times to tell when Lucette is thinking to herself or speaking aloud. Not a big deal since it can be easily figured out from the scene as a whole, but a bit annoying nevertheless.

What it does well is making Lucette a complex character. Boy, did I hate her during the prologue. If this were a longer game they likely could have made the prologue start earlier, during her childhood, to give you a better feel for her instead of doling out the relative bits as dream sequences through out. That said how they did it does work very well form a literary point of view, it is just that the first bit can be really offputting for some folks who don't want to read about someone like what Lucette was at the start.

Music is great. It is too bad the digital art book doesn't come with a nicely formatted OST for us. 

Artwork is. . . Ok. There are times when the art is just a bit wonky. For example during Rumpel's kiss scene his arm is going through Lucette's shoulder. However, the art does what it needs to do, even if the style may not be for everyone or if there are odd bits here and there. Plus, free game. The art is really good for that production value.

In the end I highly recommend this game. There are things I wish were done differently, but nothing is perfect or so they say. Still, I can't help but wonder what the result would have been if this were a true kinetic novel, a visual novel where you have no choices. Instead of choosing a partner we could follow Lucette as she sought help from all the members. It just always felt to me like each route here was missing something since it was so short. We skip so much time, time that could have displayed other interactions she had. Of course pure kinetic novels tend to get a poor rap at times, but they can be so beautiful and I think this had the potential to pull that off.

37646404.review:
I really like otomes and I have a bunch sitting in my library. So, I embarked into the quest of playing all of these free otome games on steam that I have been adding to my wishlist/downloading for the past... century, and with that I started Cinderella Phenomenon.
What can I say? I'm just... in love with this. With nearly 10 hours now, I finished Karma's good and bad routes and I'm trying to get everyone's as the story is FASCINATING. It's super well thought of, and each one of the routes give you more in depth view of the story and information. The guys seem to have very nice and distinct personalities according to their situation and they are not just shallow good looking puppets to make you choose the most handsome one and that's it. It amazes me how this is free to play while some other pretty bad otomes are paid for. The art, the music, the story, the characters, it's all lovely. Even the main character we play is good, when usually we just play a pretty face without a personality that's all lost and clueless in a world where a bunch of men want to court you.
I can't wait to finish all the routes and know everything, as I believe that I've read the whole story is not told from just one of the endings. There is also a suggested order in which you should play the routes, but at first I like to go in blind and do my own choices and see who and what I end up with.
Totally recommend, more than an otome is a pretty good read too!

37617327.review:
10/10 otome game, fam. You won't be disappointed. 

A lot of otome games focus on the art which really sells but what they haven't thought about are the story, the concept, the originality and the feelings evoked in the female (and male!) populace who play these games. The art is okay and I've seen better ones but boy, what it lacks in the refinement of art it more than makes up for the story. And the Fairytale idea! That was unique! I know and love fairytales growing up and it's a delight seeing them interpreted this way in Cinderella Phenomenon. I played this once and got a bad ending for Rod and it made me squeal in exasparation but I am willing to play this game over and over until I get all the 10 endings---that is how much I liked it. 

I don't want to name drop but this is a better otome than Amnesia tbh. Amnesia was too long, some guys if not narcissistic are just plain psychos and they do not care about the MC so much. CP is different. Will hit you right in the feels. 

Play it now. Enjoy. :')

I enjoyed this far more than I anticipated.  I also found it interesting that most of the choices you make are not of the typical moral type.  You make a choice to say or do something and it has an effect that is positive or neutral but the outcome or "rightness" is not always clear.  Each branch is also sufficiently unique to have made me WANT to know what was going to happen with each one.  This game seems to have been lovingly and attentively crafted and is about as close to "playing" a well-written story as I have ever gotten.  It touched me, made me smile and made me cry.  I decided to purchase the artbook for no other reason than to support these fine devs/storytellers.

I hope that there will be an epilogue for each branch because I would love to have the chance to experience what is teased at the end!

37095198.review:
This is probably one of the best romance VN's I've ever played and it's free. If for some reason you're not already playing it and you're an otome fan what are you even doing. Install it, get going. 

For real the only thing I can find it in me to complain about is the opening song, that's it. I just thought that was lackluster. And if a skippable song is the only thing I can complain about you're doing something right. 

As a summary, all the love interests and side characters are interesting. Each route stands out on its own and who you go for does have an effect on the story. It isn't just some lazy copy pasting. In fact, one character's route in particular really turns the tables. The art and writing is wonderful and despite my complaint about the opening theme, the rest of the score, is really really good, especially the main title music. 

For any newbies going into this I highly suggest not playing Fritz's route last. Just don't do it, save yourself the suffering and play literally any other character last. I played Fritz last and it was a mistake so don't be like me.

That's all I have to say about it, go have fun.

No sé por dónde empezar para recomendar este juego, la verdad, así que haré un listado (y no le he visto ningún contra, la verdad):

- La historia es fantástica. A mí, que me encantan los cuentos de hadas, me parece una trama muy fresca e innovadora, dentro de lo que los fairytales permiten. 
- ¡Es un otome! Así que eso significa que tienes varios intereses románticos (muy interesantes, cada uno con su historia personal y su maldición) con finales buenos y malos.
- Una vez pasada la ruta en la que estés, ¡puedes saltar directamente a la toma de decisiones para avanzar hacia las opciones y elegir directamente! Esto es la primera vez que lo veo (sin tener que hacer skip todo el rato) y me parece un ahorro importante de tiempo.
- El dibujo. Los personajes están muy bien, igual que los fondos. Si bien es cierto que las imágenes desbloqueables son un poco extrañas (parece que en ocasiones cambia el diseño, o falla la perspectiva o proporciones), en general no me desagrada.
- El opening, el menú y el diseño en general me encantan. Luce muy profesional. Lo que me lleva a...
- ¡ES GRATIS!

En serio, una muy grata sorpresa.

36688971.review:
[i]Cinderella Phenomenon[/i] is a fairly traditional kinetic otome visual novel in that it has the player choose options in order to gain a certain ending.  However, Dicesuki transforms the fairy tale, [i]Cinderella,[/i] into a beautiful and different take.  The characters appear as if they are real people with real emotions and it seems that the characters actually care about the player even though that is part of the script--this is a testament to how well-written [i]Cinderella Phenomenon[/i] is.  All of the love interests's plots are varried enough that playing through all of them doesn't feel repetative at all; although, they do all feel related, and each plotline yields more information about the world the player lives in.  The artwork is beautiful and time appears to have been taken into them, and the soundtrack is wonderful, but a little dull after playing the story at least two times.  For a free game, it has a significant amount of time one can play--I've played through two plotlines to get the good and bad endings and one plotline to get the good ending, resulting in a total of ten hours of playtime so far.

Overall: A

Idk maybe Im just greedy lol, I just wasn't a fan [/spoiler] But honestly that happens in a lot of these kinda games, so I wasn't too surprised.

36502758.review:
This game is made so well that it makes me wonder why it's free. Not that I'm complaining, but it is seriously that good. The story is well written, the characters are interesting and fun, and the entire premise of the game is very different from the typical 'you're a high school girl looking for love' story that so many visual novels like this are. The music and art are beautiful as well, so that's a major plus.

The only thing negative I have to say(which isn't really negavite, depending on your own perspective) is this game does have a "cannon route." If you are looking for a game where all of the characters live different lives and the stories don't tie into each other, you wouldn't like this one very much. All of the guys have questions come up in their routes that are answered by other routes, so playing a route out of order will leave you having answers to questions you haven't asked yet. Since I was SUPER in love with Waltz at the very beginning, as soon as I got his route I played it. That ruined a lot for me since I had yet to play Rumpel's or Fritz' routes yet.

In case you haven't read the About section, from playing the game I learned that the routes, according to the story, should be played in this order:

Rod > Karma > Rumpel > Fritz > Waltz

36492127.review:
I must say this is the first time I've played an Otome game that immersed me into its world so deeply that I feel the need to leave a review. 

The creators did a marvelous job in weaving an interesting story influenced by well-known fairytales and adding their own twist to them. The story itself drew me in, but what kept me glued to the screen, re-reading bits and pieces here and there, was the excellent writing that (in my opinion) is on par with some commercial games that huge development companies release. Each character - even the antagonists and the supporting cast - has something special to offer, which makes the journey all the more pleasant. 

The main character is complex and as she likes to emphasize every so often, she's no damsel in distress. Her development is well-paced and reasonable and I couldn't help admiring her confidence and elegance with which she held herself. She made even questionable morals and choices sound justified with her wit. She is flawed but that only makes her even more likeable and real as she learns from her own mistakes.

The gentlemen that our Lucette can romance are not ideal nor are they brooding over their "Difficult Past". Each one of them has a story to tell from which a player can learn a thing or two (I definitely did). What makes the playthrough even more enjoyable and different is the fact that depending on which route you're currently on, the general ending plot varies slightly and at the same time finishes the story. Every route uncovers different facts that others may lack and I personally think it is important to play through all of them to have the best experience (and love all of them, cause they definitely deserve it), leaving the most rewarding and satisfying one for last (Waltz's). The supporting characters were also very charming and made me want them to have seperate routes just to befriend or get to know them and their stories better, which only shows that they had depth and were very well-written.

The BGM was beautiful, well-suited to the current situation or mood and not disturbing at all, smoothly easing emotions from the pit of my hollow being. Personally I would've prefered the Opening song to be in piano version, but it was still really pretty and well-done. The Ending one stole my heart, not even once did I skip it after finishing a route with a good ending and I found myself searching for it in the music section of the gallery.

As for the art, it was breathtaking in all cases, be it the background, the CG's or the sprites. They were all very detailed, sometimes hilarious when it was needed, sometimes heartbreaking or full of happiness. Overall, my hungry eyes were satisfied, although sometimes the proportions or sharpness of certain features looked odd. However, the colours and designs made it all seem insignificant (I'm just picky about graphics, don't mind me).

Overall, I fell in love with this story, its various characters, from villains to brooms, and wise and beautiful morals that stuck with me until now. 

I applaud the team at Dicesuki, for they made a masterpiece. Some of the developers could learn a thing or two from you ;)

I look forward to the Fandisk and your future games. If I could, I would shower you with my nonexistent money.

Thank you for making it available to everyone <3

All the best,
Lemilia

36480360.review:
This game is so well made it suprised me. I thought that this was going to be another visual novel will little detail and thought into it but OH BOY was i wrong!

For the people who has not yet played this game:

This game is about a girl named Lucette ( you can change her name if you want to ). She is a princess who gets a curse called "the fairytale curse" this curse causes everyone to forget her and she goes from riches to rags. She gets the curse because she is cold hearted and horrible to her new family. To break her curse she has to do 3 good deeds. She decides to partner up with someone to try and break her curse ( you can choose from Rod,Karma,Waltz,Fritz & Rumpel ) after partnering up with one of those characters many things happen and you grow closer to that character. Then you either get a good ending or a bad ending.

Now back to the review! :D

The quality of this game is even better than a lot of visual novels that people have to pay for! I really think that this game deserves more recognition for how much love and effort this masterpeice took to make.

All the characters are super interesting and lovable, and the stories with these characters are breathtaking and it gets you hooked! ( for example ive been playing this game nonstop for the past week ) The characters make you think "why do these guys not exist in real life?". These boys are litteraly angels that has fallen from heaven! The bad endings are heartbreaking and i cried so much when i got them. Also the writing is specacular and while everything is happening you can feel their emotions!

Every single character is special in this game and they all have different personalities and backstories. All of them has their flaws and they learn grow and develop as a character. None of them are mary-sues and all of them has great character development and design.

Personally i love Rod's story the most because its very interesting to learn about him and its super fun to see how he starts to warm up to you through out the stoy and he is the most adorable thing in the world, he is like a tsudere which is super cute.

The artwork is something to die for! Being an artist myself im extremly pleased by the art style and i got inspired by it. The only problem i had with it was that sometimes they copy and pasted the eyes and it made the characters look like a goat with both eyes looking to different sides. Other than that the art was really detailed and beautiful!

I think that the creator did a AMAZING job and that they really outdid themselves! I give this game a 1000/10 because i really enjoyed it and i cant wait to see more works of this creator.

36476127.review:
Явление Золушки - Отомэ/Визуальная новелла: очень качественная в сюжетном и графическом плане ВН, в жанре отомэ (то бишь романтика, рассчитанная на женскую аудиторию), в сеттинге старых сказок.

[h1]Сюжет.[/h1]
Однажды давным-давно, в далеком-предалеком королевстве жили люди, ведьмы и феи. И было в королевстве том два кристалла, тёмный принадлежащий ведьмам, и светлый феям. Началась меж ними война, в результате которой обе стороны оказались ослаблены, носительница темного кристалла мертва, но перед смертью создала Сказочные проклятья (Fairy Tale Curse), которые накладывали на людей подпавших под них проклятья из старинных историй. Коснулось это проклятье и нашей героини, дочери короля. Проклятья из сказки про Золушку. По сюжету это Золушка наоборот, оказавшаяся в компании других бедолаг, чьи проклятия являются парафразом сюжетов сказок, от "Красавицы и Чудовища", до "Румпельштильцхена". Соответственно задача нашей героини, снять проклятья с себя, ну и с одного из 5 "принцев на выбор". Личности героев, да и сама история, прописаны подробно и прекрасно.

[h1]Геймплей.[/h1]
Читаем текст, делаем выборы. 5 "принцев", по 10 глав и 2 концовки на каждого (плохая и хорошая соответственно), 3 доступны сразу, остальные разблокируются по мере прохождения.

[h1]Графика и звуки.[/h1]
В новелле очень качественные арты, от задников и персонажей, до заставок. Есть начальное видео с музыкой. Музыка в новелле, мягкая и довольно приятная.

[h1]Как итог.[/h1]
Очень красивая и интересная новелла. Любителям\ницам сказок, девушкам поклонницам жанра отомэ (все же он для них изобретен ;), и просто любителям качественных новелл, прочесть её стоит.
8 сказок из 10
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1126011506

36317458.review:
This may be the first time I've ever felt the need to write a Steam review for anything but this otome/visual novel struck a chord with me. An overwhelmingly good one - enough so that I'm staying awake to write this when I really should be sleeping. I have done my best to keep spoilers out of this review.

Positives:

A whirlwind of emotions and compelling storytelling, this visual novel may very well rip your heart out in all the possible ways. I laughed, I cried (both in sadness and in joy), and I grinned ear to ear whenever something happened not just to the main character, but the characters around her. You see, with Cincerella Phenomenon, you don't realize you've fallen, not just for the main and her romantic interests, but also every single side character until you're cheering them on whenever they come on screen. I absolutely loved the characters - even the unpleasant ones - and that is a testiment to fantastic writing.

The writing itself, characters aside, was glorious. About halfway through the game (3/5 good endings unlocked) I spent an hour telling a friend about the lore of the story. Had I not spoiled it for them, they said they would have played simply for the story - and they do not play visual novels, much less otome games. Anyway, the story is so rich with bits of lore scattered throughout. You simply cannot only play one route - you have to do them all in order to understand everything. Typically when I play otome games I pick the guy I like best and only do one playthrough with him before tossing the game aside.

Not this game. I binge-played it in 20 hours, unlocked all of the good endings (and one bad - the others I'm still working on), and am even planning to buy the digital artbook just to support the creators because this- was- fantastic. I literally could not stop playing this game because the story is so rich that I felt like I was reading a book.

Negatives:

My negatives will likely not be too similar to those of the comments here that I have read. Cinderella Phenomenon touches on close to taboo topic(s) in certain areas (you will understand if you play it) but that wasn't what bothered me - if anything, I found the topic(s) interesting and would likely shove that up there in my positives section. No, what bothered me about Cinderella Phenomenon was a particular route that I will not go into too much detail with. I am trying to keep this spoiler-free, after all.

Anyway... I enjoyed all of the routes, do not get me wrong, but there was one in particular that felt a little... "mish-mashed." It is simultaneously my least favorite and favorite route. This route is not like the others and is messy, complicated, and feels ridiculously long in comparison to the other ones but it is the one that has the most feels (good or bad, I will leave that a mystery). As such I'm not sure if I can actually make this a true negative of the game, but it's the best I have got.

Cinderella Phenomenon was phenomenal and I eagerly look forward to more by this company.

36239542.review:
What secrets is everyone hiding? Can someone who has closed off her heart be able to do good deeds? Can we trust others? Lucette or our protagonist faces these questions and more.

It's a masterpiece of storytelling. The five story routes tie in together. Even the side characters are well fleshed out - most of them are dynamic and round characters. There are lots of surprises in store.

Unlike other Otomes games, Lucette or our protagonist (you can change her first name), has a personality. Instead of wish fulfillment, the game tells a story as we join Lucette on her and her friends' journey.

Play this for the story. The game play is the usual for a Ren'Py visual novel. There's even a right choice indicator to show you which choice scores a point with the character. Outside of getting the Guided by Intuition achievement once, with the right choice indicator, this is a pretty easy game if you invest time in it.

The programming and execution is top-notch. There are barely any bugs and the game is gorgeous. 

Rather than a translation of Japanese, this is a full blown English language and culture story. It's so satisfying to see them do curtsies and English mannerisms and values. (I've read too many Chinese Imperial Court stories and Japanese stories by then). Finally, a good Otome game in English based on English culture.

This is THE English language Otome/Visual Novel I never realized I was waiting for. How is this free?! I'm surprised this is only Dicesuki's 2nd published game. Thank you too to the Kickstarter backers that made the game even more gorgeous! I can't wait for Dicesuki's next game.


___________________________________________________

For the order of routes, here are my recommendations:
> Whichever excites you most between Karma, Rumpel, and Rod. I really enjoyed Karma's route. I would have quit the story if I played Rod's route first. I suggest getting the guided by intuition achievement in Rod's route. [spoiler] Karma and Rumpel hate being flirted at. So if it's your first time at otomes or if you use common sense, you'll only get a bad ending on their routes.[/spoiler]

> Play Fritz's route fourth. It's got a lot of drama/revelations that may make the other three routes pale. But it can get depressing. You do NOT want to play this route last.

> Play Waltz's route last. I suggest getting the good ending first. Once the good ending chapter starts, save, don't finish it yet. Go get the bad ending and watch it. Only after then, watch the good ending. May it satisfy you ^_~

The route you pick also fleshes out certain side characters. It's a fun bonus
[spoiler]
Rod -> Emelaigne, Viorica - I dub this the Emelaigne route! Care for Emelaigne, and you'll have the key to Rod's heart ^_~

Karma -> Jurien and Garlan, plus crossdressing and sword fighting

Rumpel -> Parfait, Bria, plus healing and the fastest way to kill a person

Fritz -> Delora, Varg, Mythros -> You'll get to see all the suffering Hildyr wants to unleash. You'll really get to know Delora in this story.

Waltz -> I dub this the Lucette route. She'll finally know the truth about her father and mother in this route. Care for Lucette's development, and Waltz will open up to you. We finally get to see her use magic! Can she bloom to be the brightest queen or fall and be lost?

[/spoiler]

36188792.review:
I absolutely love this game, and this might be my favorite English Visual Novel/Otome game yet. Each route is very well-written, and it's fun to see how Lucette gets along with her chosen partner. The central theme of the game is also very original, seeing curses that are based off of Fairytales.

I also love the fact that Lucette is not your typical Otome protagonist. Instead of being a blank slate, Lucette has personality and starts out with a frigid heart. As you progress through each route, you get to see her character develop to a warmer personality. The reactions of all the guys when they see her smile for the first time is always fun to see, and you'd likely have a similar reaction when you see it; it's a very nice smile.

Every guy has a unique personality, from your tsundere stepbrother, to a crossdressing and secretive man, to a nearly shameless flirt, to your personal knight, to the mysterious child street magician. I must say that I really like Waltz' route in particular for several reasons. He's enjoys giving puppet shows to children, is very protective of Lucette, knows how to do magic [spoiler]due to him being a witch trained under Lucette's mother, the Tenebrarum Bearer, and is Lucette's childhood friend.[/spoiler] Let's not forget how adorable he is while he's cursed, as well as when he blushes.

I've already finished all the routes, and I just can't stop replaying each one. Although I've already seen all the good endings, I'm reluctant to get the bad ones. I purchased the digital artbook recently, and the bad end CGs are rather heart-wrenching. I will warn anyone who plays this game to watch out for such moments, because when you reach them, you'll likely have to reach for a box of tissues.

Overall, Cinderella Phenomenon is a very nice Visual Novel/Otome game to pick up if you have never done so before. It's completely free, so there's no harm is trying it out. Also, I heard a fandisk will be released sometime soon, either by the end of the year or early next year, so keep a lookout for that. I'm extremely excited to get it, and hope to get closure for the routes then. I recommend that you head to Dicesuki's official tumblr account after playing, since they sometimes give answers to little bits of trivia and some further insight into the personalites of the main cast. I don't usually get this excited for these kind of games, but I'm glad to say that this one has rekindled my interest. I hope that when you play this, you'll feel the same way. Happy playing!

It is a little wordy at times, a few inner thoughts of the MC dragging on with no point --- but this game is creative and engaging. This is worth playing and pressumably any sequel this team does will be worth a follow up. 

The game is high quality. I wish that there was at least one female romance option because that's always fun,  but the love interests were varied enough that I wanted to do more than just one play through and see what happens.

My only real complain is that IF you make more than I believe one wrong choice, out of maybe 15 or 20 choices (?) you automatically do not get your path's good ending. So you play and play and everything is going great, then all of a sudden, a bad ending. Not sure if that was the best employment of the interaction system. Essentially, there is no indication you are going to get a bad ending other than that crystal that flashes, because the entire game plays along the same path, without the flexibility of you expressing your choices through your character. You kind of have to just obsessively make sure you always pick the right option and be vigilant for the choice crystal, reloading if wrong.

Let me just start out by saying that after finishing the first route, I could not believe the game was free. It has the quality and heart and detail to it that I'd expect from similar games that cost way more money and aren't even half as interesting. 

I used to play a lot of visual novels, and I'd often lose interest about halfway through and not bother trying to get all the routes completed. I'd just play my favorite character and be done with it. In Cinderella Phenomenon, I have a legitimate drive to want to complete each route for all the available bachelors, not only because all of the stories are very well connected and intertwined, but because each one of them has something unique to offer. The fairy tale theme lends itself extremely well to this. All of the characters, main characters and side characters, were likeable, well rounded, and interesting. The game gives you the opportunity to get to know several who otherwise might have simply blended into the background.

What I really appreciated about this game was also the writing of the main character/heroine, who is extremely effective in the story the game is trying to tell. There's nothing shallow or empty about her, you honestly feel connected to the character while playing her. She manages to be a strong female lead who doesn't have to compromise her feelings or personality for the sake of pleasing any of the bachelors. That was incredibly refreshing to see. 

Overall, I definitely would recommend this game to anyone looking for a sweet, interesting little story (with a price that's unbelievable-- you can't really beat it, haha). It has nice artwork, a lovely soundtrack, and very good writing. 100% recommended.

36066167.review:
This has to be one of my favourite visual novels. The storyline is well written and gets you gripped so quickly, the characters and their development throughout the story makes you love them all so quickly (even one of the antagonists, if you can call him that in the end). 
Here's my pros and cons of the game and my overall thoughts and feelings:

[b] Pros: [/b]
- Storyline is well written, it's an intriguing story which develops well and clears everything up at the end of Waltz' route so there's no confusion. The recommended route order is on their store page (Rod, Karma, Rumpel, Fritz then Waltz). This order is best as you learn the entire story with no gaps by the end. Plus you can't do Fritz or Waltz' routes without doing 2 endings first.
- Character development was on point in my opinion. I loved Waltz the moment I first spotted him reading this story, I knew his route would be my favourite and it was, closely followed by Rod! You learn everything about the characters and even a considerate amount of their backstory to understand them better as a person, it makes you feel like you're part of the story developing with them.
- Art design, I personally think the design is beautiful although there are minimual background changes and they're repetitive but that didn't matter much to me as the story had me gripped more than the backgrounds. Each character is unique with their own style, they're beautifully drawn.
- Music. The music used in the visual novel really set the mood for what was happening or what was about to happen or simply for how your character is feeling. They set the moods perfectly for me.
- Routes, however only having 2 endings, good and bad. They don't fail on the emotional side of them, Rod's and Karma's bad endings had me crying like a baby but I enjoyed them nonetheless

[b] Cons: [/b]
- Lack of choices. There is only 3 choices per chapter (chapters 1-9) there is a chapter 10 however that's just the finale so it's pure reading until the credits.
- Routes, as it is a pro it is also a con in my opinion. Simply because the bad endings aren't very long, they're short and simple which kinda sucks. The longest bad ending is Waltz' but it's still very short in comparison to the good ending.

[b] Overall: [/b]
I loved the reading, it was fun and enjoyable. I honestly couldn't put it down, I was stuck at my laptop reading it non-stop until I'd finished everybody's endings. It was happy and sad, gets the waterworks going when the worst happens but it's still so amazing. It's free so why not give it a go? For a free read it sure will leave you pleased and if you're not, well you didn't waste cash, just your time so don't complain too much (it could be a lot worse).
If you do decide to give this a go then I do recommend following the route recommendation on the store page: [b] Rod, Karma, Rumpel, Fritz then Waltz [/b] because it will fill in ALL the blanks by the end of Waltz' route.
Enjoy and happy reading!

36003848.review:
I must admit, this is a tough one. The things I liked, I really liked. The things I didn't like, I really didn't. Would I recommend this VN? Absolutely. At its current price (free), you really couldn't ask for a better VN. Its sheer length alone, minimum twelve hours gameplay, is admirable for a free VN - and it isn't long, nor wordy, for the sake of extending the experience.

What did I like?

The protagonist is really likeable and relatable. Her situation is very much exaggerated, but I think there exists a little bit of Lucette in everyone. Even in the beginning, when her character is very one-dimensional, you instinctively know that there's more to her than meets the eye and you want to learn more. I think one of the things the writers did best with this our Cinderella is how she matures DIFFERENTLY on each route, based on the things she's experienced. 

The love interests are varied and there's something for everyone here. Can't go into too much details without spoilers, but every route is unique.

The choices aren't obvious; it isn't painfully obvious what is the "right" choice. This VN actually offers a right choice indicator, which I did not use for my first playthrough, as I play a lot of VNs and figured I could easily trigger the good ending. I failed three consecutive times before turning it on. Telling your love interest what you think they want to hear isn't always the best choice; sounds like real life, doesn't it?

The amount of work put into the aesthetics of this game is praiseworthy. The game has a full soundtrack, which I believe was composed for the game, and at no point during the story does the music not step up to match it. Most of the songs are short instrumental clips, but they do the job properly. The art is plentiful: each character route has 10+ CGs, and there are 20+ common CGs. And, more importantly, the art is gorgeous--this goes for characters as well as backgrounds, which to me is often overlooked in VNs.

The different routes tie into one another very well. Just because you picked romantic interest A does not mean that B, C, D, and E disappear. They're all interwoven into one another's fairytale journeys. This is also very important to me, as I believe it makes the game much more believable and submersive.

What didn't I like?

This is the only free VN I know of to include a theme song and theme song animation. The animation is nothing to write home about (features very little original art not already seen in the VN), which is fine; but the song is HORRIBLE. The singer sounds like he was recovering from a loss of voice when he recorded it. It's scratchy, off-key, flat (in the musical sense). It would have been much better to omit it completely than to include it in the game.

The writing isn't very balanced. I feel like some routes got way more attention than others. There's one route in particular where the romantic interest is literally absent for half of the entire route. In certain routes, I could feel our Cinderella falling in love and I was falling in love too. In others, I had to go "What?" as dramatic changes just kind of occurred without rhyme or reason.

The writing is a bit too formulaic. Every route has a set number of chapters, with a set number of choices in each chapter. It was also a little bothersome that you needed to make no more than two wrong choices, out of 27-30 total, to trigger the good ending for each character. And even this seems to be somewhat random: I tested it with three different romantic interests, and made exactly three wrong choices in each of their routes. I triggered the bad ending in only two out of the three. So not too balanced. 

Certain characters are far too cliche. I understand that fairytales are a fundamental theme to this VN, and thus it makes sense for a love interest's route to align with their particular fairytale. However, just because a person is put under a curse that relates to a fairytale does not mean that person automatically transforms into the one-dimensional character from said fairtyale. Also, I found that only certain curses required the one cursed to reflect and grow as a person (for example, there's one curse that's broken by finding an object). It's impossible to discuss this in detail without irreparably spoiling the story, and probably some people will disagree with me on this point. That's fine. Play for yourself, and see.

Asymmetrical character development - relates to my last point as well. Certain characters have their past shown in great detail whereas others barely get a one sentence mention. Certain characters are flawed, but are redeemed or at least are given an explanation, and are given a chance at sympathy. But other characters (the most important being the primary antagonist) stay the same the entire time, and it really destroyed the story for me as I completed more routes and got a better understanding of the overall world and situation. It's not up to the writers how their audience feels about the characters, but every character should at least have a chance at making the audience feel something. And especially when someone as important as the primary antagonist is sidelined, it sucks. In fact, most of the antagonists suffer from this. In a game that is literally about fairytales misleading and corrupting people into thinking good is only good and bad is only bad, it's horrible to not give the antagonists a fair representation. It undermines the whole story.

Conclusion:

I did thoroughly enjoy Cinderella Phenomenon, and I will be remembering it for a long time to come. It's definitely one of the best VNs I've ever experienced - in certain areas. However, I do feel that this game has certain flaws that cannot be ignored, and that keep it from being as good as it could be. I would love to see more from the developers, and I hope their next project is more well rounded.

I could not get over how annoying, spoiled, and mean Lucettex is. It was cool to see her grow, but I feel like there was so much time in the beginning showing how cruel of a person she is that made me NOT want to help break her curse. That in itself didn't really encourage me to continue playing the game, but I did because a friend recommended the game to me.

I played through Rod's route, because Rumpel is an annoying womanizer, and Karma ... I wanted to play through Karma's route, but I disliked their art. We're introduced to Karma as a Beautiful Woman, but I thought Karma was easily the least attractive character. So I played Rod's route, because honestly he was cute. I couldn't really believe that I could win Rod over, and I sort of didn't even want to. Rod comes in saying that life is better without Lucettex. Of course it is! She's a binch! Rod's family deserves to be happy without her. I didn't want to disrupt that, but I wanted to get to Waltz' route, so I went ahead with Rod's story.

Rod's route didn't make sense to me. There were some choices that seemed pretty similar, but you only got points if you chose one of them. Sometimes the choices were inconsistent: Sometimes you don't get points if you choose the option that's more confrontational; sometimes you DO get points if you choose the option that's more confrontational. I found myself saying, "What!" when I chose the nicer option and didn't get a diamond; then loaded a save and chose the more confrontational option and then Rod would blush and the diamond would appear. You started off not liking when I was more brash; and now you like it? What do you want from me!

[SPOILERS] I was very dissatisfied with Rod's ending. I thought it was going to end with Delora giving Lucettex an option to be a princess again but she wouldn't be able to be with Rod; or stay as a maid and be with Rod. And the best ending is to choose to stay a maid because you realize that Rod's family is happier without you, and now you get to be with Rod. But?? Instead you become a princess and sneak out with Rod every once in a while to be with him? And Rod's sister and mom are OK with that? That doesn't make sense. Also that's not an ending to a story; that's a beginning of another one. They can't possibly be satisfied with living a life in secret... again! Also there was no resolution to Lucettex's relationship with her father or the commonfolk. And what happened to Fritz? He turns into Varg, doesn't he? But what happens to Varg? The last we saw of Mythros was that he's stuck in an ice sculpture, but ... what happens after that?? Did I miss some text somewhere? If so, then that's totally my bad. But if those loose ends were never tied up, then... [END SPOILERS]

After I was done with Rod's route, I said OK, now I can finally do Waltz' route. He's cute. And nice. So I started going through it again. The new Fast Forward feature I unlocked brought me into a debug mode of the game or something? A weird screen where I had the option to ignore the problem and continue forward... so I did? And instead of hitting Fast Forward this time, I just sped up the text. And that's when I realized just how much text there was just setting up the story and grounding me into hating Lucettex. I don't think there should be [i]this much[/i] exposition. I also realized that Lucettex is a janitor for such a short period of time if you chose Rod's route? So short a time that it really didn't even need to be included in Rod's route.

Then I realized that I needed to complete SOMEONE ELSE'S ROUTE BEFORE UNLOCKING WALTZ' ROUTE! At this point, I gave up. I don't really want to look at Karma, and I think I'd be too annoyed at Rumpel's route. And I'd just be annoyed at Lucettex the entire time. All of this is not worth playing Waltz' route, which might be just as disappointing as Rod's route anyway.

OK. So that's all the narrative stuff.

In terms of art, I like the cutscene art, but the in-game art during dialogue looks flat and is considrerably not as pretty as the cutscene art. 

The music is good! I found it stuck in my head after hours of playing the game. I did catch it stop its loop once, though, if you let the game sit there for a bit, so I know it's not an [i]actual[/i] loop. I'm not a programmer so I don't know how hard it is to loop audio, but the programmer might want to change that.

I do want to end this with saying that it is cool that pretty much one person made the whole game, the art, music, story, etc. That's very respectable!

35783556.review:
Rating: 8/10 ("Very good")

Recommended for: People who enjoy VNs, people who enjoy romance. I would recommend this for a first time VN-reader.

My route order: Rod > Karma > Rumpel > Fritz > Waltz. I can’t choose a favourite!

Cinderella Phenomenon is a 100 percent free visual novel with a female protagonist. It took me approximately 19 hours to complete all the routes, keeping in mind that I skipped content I had already read and didn’t start from the beginning for every route. This leaves approximately 4 hours for each route, which seems accurate.

The novel has a pretty interesting and original take on the concept of fairytales, witches, and fairies. The good endings aren’t truly one hundred percent “good” and not quite a happily ever after – good people unavoidably die, no matter what you do, or perhaps [i]because[/i] of what you do. Nonetheless, the VN has a good storyline with an endearing message and competently written characters. The main heroine has a real personality as opposed to simply being a self-insert doormat, and she has her own agency. All the other characters, including the male love interests, have varying amounts of depth to them that make them thoughtfully crafted.

There are 5 love interests and 10 endings: one bad and one good ending for each guy. Every route is told in 10 chapters, wherein only the final chapter actually changes based on whether or not you have a good or a bad ending. Overall, the biggest problem with Cinderella Phenomenon is that in the end, choices don’t feel like they truly matter. The VN would benefit from a couple more bad endings earlier in the storyline. In addition, there are no true branching paths. You will do the same things and achieve the same overall outcome no matter what choice you make, which begs the question of, why are there choices in the first place?

The requirements for achieving a good ending are a little too strict. If you deviate even one answer from the guide, you will obtain a bad ending, no matter what choice it was. Case in point: I played the game blind for Rod’s playthrough, and obtained the bad ending even though, after looking at the guide, I could see only two or three of my choices deviated from the given path. You are shoehorned in a particular role and personality – telling Rod off or being honest with him at certain parts of the story is apparently the bad thing to do and will give you a ticket to the bad ending. That being said, it seems that making the wrong choices in chapter 9 doesn’t matter – you need to go back a couple chapters in the storyline if you want to snag a bad ending without skipping through the entire novel from the very beginning. Starting the novel from the beginning isn’t all that necessary, since, as stated, there are no branching paths and no matter your choice you will ultimately have the same outcome. Only a few lines of dialogue change here and there.

But don’t let this dissuade you whatsoever. For a free product, Cinderella Phenomenon is honestly outstanding. Each route tells an [i]entirely[/i] different story. They were all enjoyable – I really cannot choose which route I liked the most, as they were all interesting and never felt boring or bloated with filler. The writing was competent and hardly ever came across as too amateurish, though there were scenes where I felt more appropriate words could have been selected. Cinderella Phenomenon’s artwork is also rather high quality; despite some CGs being a little awkward looking, it’s quite obvious the artist spent a lot of time and work on the art. The sprites are all fantastic, backgrounds are detailed, and most of the CGs are very pretty. There were a few scenes that I felt could have used a CG to bolster the impact of what was happening, but since this is a free work, I think that can be forgiven. Really, almost 20 hours of reading, depending on your speed, for [i]free[/i]…

Overall, Cinderella Phenomenon is definitely worth a look. It’s free and has an interesting storyline…you can't possibly go wrong with picking this VN up. I'll definitely take a look at anything else this developer chooses to create.
