I decided to try this game a week ago since it's free, and then I found it is far more beyond my expectation. I can't stop playing it and already get 4 good endings at this point. Now I can say that this one is definitely my favorite one in this genre, and I feel I just have to write a positive review for this game to express my appreciation.
The graphics is overall fair, the music is great, and the plot, OMG, it's simply amazing and genuinely heart warming.
Every character has their own unique background, plot and dialogue, both the main ones and the supporting ones, and the player character, the princess herself, is also a very unique and intersting character, she has her full personality yet it  still feels natural to play the game through her, it's easy to understand her and to feel for her. 
I see some complaints about some of the characters not being someone's cup of tea, well, I guess it's a matter of personal preferences/tastes. Lucky for me, three out of five available bachelors in the game are exactly my type, my cup of tea... I GENUINELY fell in love for Rod, Fritz, and Waltz, and even feel sad when realizing the romance is only whihin the game and that I could not have more interactions with them after their endings is achivied... 
So far, my favorite route is Rod and Waltz. Both are happy and heart warming endings. For Fritz, though I love him as a character, I do agree that his plot is not that good... it's kind of sad, heavy and tragic, and the romace part is sort of weak, but I guess it does fit the big picture, shows a typical ending when the princess choose to trust her mother's follower and revive her mother.
Anyway, I certainly enjoy this game, A LOT, and I think I will always remember and cherish the great moments that I've experienced in this game...

35646030.review:
I recommend Cinderella Phenomenon to anyone that likes visual novels, which blends cuteness, magic, family, tragedy, and love. The game isn't really for those that want a big interactive experience. The meat of the game is you experiencing our little "Cinderella" (Called Cinderella in this review, you get to choose her name) going through the story, and occasionally you get to pick between a few dialogue options, some so similar you will have no clue why one leads to a bad ending and one to a good.

I did very much enjoy the stories, and it did leave me both feeling awwww and at other times teary eyed. I still have some criticism, but because the game is overwhelmingly story-heavy, I will use spoiler for most of this review... So yeah, like visual novels you might like this game. If you want to read my rant about silly parts of the game read the spoiler parts.

[u]Negatives[/u]
[spoiler]So, the negatives out of the way first. It kind of hurts some of the stories, that Cinderella must have a romantic partner… I get that generally these kinds of games have a romantic subplot, but with the possibility of five storylines we could have some without the romance. Especially since it is (for me at least) is the weakest part of the story in some cases. I am not opposed to romance as a central point of some of the storylines. With Karma it felt like the core of the story and natural given the situation. Rampel and Waltz’ weren’t as necessary, but it added more than it took away to their stories. 
However, with Rod… I was far more interested in Cinderella’s relationship with her step-sister and step-mother. I feel a step-family dynamic should have been the sole character focus of that story. I was also interested in her relationship with Rod as her step-brother… But then it got weird. I know that they are not blood related so they have a right to have feelings for each other, but it is still creepy that it is a happy ending that she “romance” her brother in secret. I mean really? Couldn’t they just end up as friends? I felt it was much more interesting exploring the concept of a melded family.
Fritz’… Okay, as a character (pre-curse) I actually think he was a good fit for Cinderella. But his whole romance plot coupled with his curse was WEIRD! Plus, here we got some of the best scenes (in my opinion) between Cinderella and Delora (witch who cursed Cinderella) and they had such a good dynamic. I’m not sure what you would call it daughter-guardian? I want to see that! I want a happy mommy-daughter ending for those at the end of that story! Funny enough Fritz’ storyline was the one where I cared the least about him, because the romance plot just turned out so bizarre. [/spoiler]

[spoiler] Now onto the king. I had a massive problem with this character. Not because of him directly, but because everyone talks about him like is a good king. Look, he is a great person, a good step-father, a bad father, but a horrible king. He married an evil tyrant because a she threatened to kill the woman he loved. The action of a good person, but the action of a truly incompetent king. You can’t put the life of one person over your kingdom. Then his incompetence leads him to surround himself with scheming advisors, one of which he was directly warned about. This man has no intuition or judge of character. A good king obvious can’t know everything, but he needs to make sure his top advisors are competent in their field and loyal… 
Then the fact that he is a bad father… Seriously dude? Seventeen years and you have not once told your daughter you loved her? Her mother has been gone for four years, so you can’t use her as an excuse. Even if she was distant (because you ignored her throughout childhood and didn’t give obvious secret hints that you cared) would it have been so hard to just once pull her aside and say “Cinderella… you know that I love you right?” Sure, it would be awkward, but seriously you literally look at beggars kindlier than her. That is not “her being distant” that is you being an a-hole. 
Then the multiple “choices that matter”, sometimes they make sense other times it is just different words “I want to help” versus “Is there anything I can do to help?” How are you supposed to know which leads to a bad 10th chapter and which doesn’t? Personally, I’d say since the focus is mostly on the story and it is a more reading, just use one of the steam-guides if you want to be sure to see the happy ending(s). The focus is more on the story than the choices, and I don’t feel like it takes anything away. 

I find it odd that some of the storylines sees the removal of ALL fairy tale curses as a good thing. Don’t get me wrong some were cruel and underserved (Waltz and Fritz), but others lead to character growth including our Cinderella. Removing all the curses would prevent some from learning valuable lessons and grow as human beings. Cinderella, Karma, and Rumpel all leads to them becoming better versions of themselves. I am not sure where Rod fits, but he is certainly on the deserved it spectrum, since he did make a deal to get his curse, but I am not sure prince friendzone learned anything. (Which is also a reason his romance was weird even if it helped with breaking his curse) [/spoiler]

[u]Positives:[/u]
[spoiler]And with the negativity done for we go to the positives. It is nice to have five separate storylines, and it not simply being your romance partner that is different but the entire storyline that ends up diverging, even to the point of a different bad guy being on top at the climax of the story. 

I like that Cinderella wasn’t cursed because she was evil or cruel. Even if Delora kind of says that at first. It is not so black and white. She was cursed because the witch believed she could break it, and that she could grow to be better and see the world as better, than what her mother taught her, and some of the humans taught her. Even if her mother is portraited as evil and removed some of her memories, it isn’t stated that she implanted her with false memories, just took out certain good ones… So yeah, she hasn’t always been the luckiest girl. Other girls no longer wanting to play with her because she didn’t want to “share” her toys, after they didn’t return the last ones she borrows them… Maids in her palace mocking her behind her back, because she talks more to her dolls than other people…  Her dad never openly showing affection to her while the mother is still alive (and barely showing it four years after) … Whenever she goes into town everyone sends her dirty looks and judge her based on her mother’s actions. I mean it is horrible, but it is nice that even though the story is about thawing her heart, it isn’t like the people around her were always nice. 

Her stepsister was genuinely nice, but there we have some dynamics of her not trusting her intentions. Which is also part of other nobles being very secretive and wearing fake smiles in the kingdom, and despising her father showing more open affection towards the “fake daughter” than his real one. Adding more complexity to Cinderella rather than just being mean. And it is nice that it is first when she starts seeing her stepsister at her worst (or at least more flawed than usual) that she starts to open up to her and relate to her.

The negative rants are a lot longer than the positives, but it is just generally easier to rant about negative points, especially with an overall positive experience. I could list off many more great moments with Mr. Broom, Doll-Delora, some of the more memorable and/or adorable good deeds that Cinderella performs, but I bet you would rather experience those, as well as some of the sad moment, for yourself. [/spoiler]

So yeah, hope you will enjoy the game, and end up thinking way too hard on some of the elements. Like I did.

[u]Edit Note:[/u]
Nomination: "Choices Matter" I nominated it for this 2017 award because all the different romance options alter the story.

35510526.review:
I honestly cannot even believe that this is a free to play game...it is unbelievable that I even feel bad for playing it without having paid for it. The makers have put in their heart and soul into every aspect of this visual novel that it is really hard to point out any faults with it. 

PROS
~ The art/graphics is really beautiful 
~ The music is magical and really makes me feel like I am a part of that world
~ Every route and story is so good that I can't even decide on which is my favourite
~ I really love how other than the main love stories, you also develop relationships with the side characters as well, for example I loved the friendship that the protagonist made with Rod's sister
~ There is a balance between action, drama, adventure, love and more.
~ This novel is really romantic that I had to pause it for a moment and giggle to myself because I just had sooo many fuzzy/butterfly feels <3
~ The stories are SO WELL WRITTEN...AGAIN, I CAN'T BELIEVE THIS IS FREE...
~ I just really love every character soooo much in this visual novel, they each go through tremendous character development...if I honestly had to pick a favourite? ...nope, it's impossible. 
~ The main girl....You don't even know how much I love her, I am so sick of a lot of visual novels just sexualising their main female protagonist and having her being some damsel in distress, it's just not right. Wheras here, she is strong and can take care of herself, she dosen't let people use her and she stands up for herself if one of the love interests are being inappropriate towards her. I just love how every relationship in this novel has the man and the woman respect each other and both are EQUAL to each other. 
~ Every single choice you make determins the route you ultimately end up with which I love. Not to mention there are also twists that are both positive and negative. 
~ I love how each love interest's curse is based upon a fairy tale, including the main protagonist as I grew up with them. 

CONS
....Honestly there are non for me personally....if I really had to well, maybe in some moments the story tends to drag on a bit and the bad endings really break my heart but other than that, it's perfect. Maybe if you don't like romance, fairy tales, visual novels or drama then obviously this isn't for you.

I rate this a 9.5/10....What are you waiting for? Go read! :-)

Okay, other than Otomate or major otome game company, I don't play any other VNs from small groups and such other than Zeiva but I have to say, this was really well done. I enjoyed each and single route. The writing is good, each route differs and it's a whole new experience, I really admire Icesuki for this work. Even in otomate there has been games where different character routes are just Ctrl C + Ctrl V or routes that has been just plain boring. However Cinderella Phenomenon really had me focusing on each and every route despite them not being my favourite.

The only issue I have is how the CG differs a lot from the sprite, I understand that art requires a lot of effort and beside, it is a free game so I should not complain, however I feel that the game will be much more remarkably stunning if the artwork remains constant.

Furthermore, some writing seem slightly iffy. I was not able to feel much for Mythos, Hildyr or Ophelis and her family. The game did not go in depth into their backstory. It was really iffy how the King is still able to love Lucette despite everything, it was not really well-explained. Same goes for Ophelis, her love was seperated from her for so long, and yet she is able to just put on a smile and accept everything.

I really feel that the game will be a much more touching and wonderful experience if they add in various detailed backstory.

Overall, I feel that Cinderella Phenomenon is a really really good game. I was very surprised that it is free to play. I am more than willing to pay for such a wonderful game, honestly.
The writing is good, the art is good, the ending and route differs from each other.

34885804.review:
In a genre filled with trite tropes and predictable plots, [b][i]Cinderella Phenomenon[/i][/b] is a refreshing breath of fresh air.

The game is striking and intriguing from the get go, made evident not just from the setting (it's a world where witches retaliated to the witch hunts by bestowing curses based on various fairytales) but also by our protagonist, Lucette. Now usually in otome/harem games the main character is disappointingly bland. Maybe they'll have particular trait or quirk if you're lucky, but usually they're kept as more or less a blank state so that the player can fully project himself/herself on them. Not here! Lucette has her very own concrete, dinstinct personality, and the game is not concerned about making it a palatable one. In fact she starts the game as an ice cold, condescending and distant princess, and yet despite how off-putting that sounds it's actually not that hard to feel sympathy for her. She has reasons reasons for acting the way she does, with a background of emotional abuse that is slowly revealed, and her struggle to become a better person is a genuine one.

And it's precisely Lucette's character development through the game that made this such a unique experience for me. Again, in these kind of games I'm used to making choices based solely on whether the character I'm romancing will approve or not. Who cares if it's not something I agree with, or if it makes the main character ping pong through radically different opinions like a crazy person? The goal is to achieve romance, and by god I will ruthlessly and pragmatically manipulate emotions and situations like a freaking sociopath to achieve that goal! 

But in [b][i]Cinderella Phenomenon[/i][/b], my motive was placed not on other characters but on Lucette herself.  Each choice was for her benefit, to see how she would react and what she would think, to see if she could truly change her ways. It's easy to get invested in her and understand her, since we're privy to her inner thoughts and chains of logic, and there's something very heartwarming about witnessing her slow but true growth as a person. In the end she turns out to be a very remarkable character, with a surprising amount of agency and drive, and she is by far my favourite part of the game.

Of course this is still an otome game, so there's got to be some romance. And the available Love Interests are indeed well-crafted and fun to interact with [spoiler](tho some are much more fun than others *cough*Karma*cough*)[/spoiler] but thankfully there's equal attention paid to the plot too. LIke in all good visual novels the routes are interconnected, with each playthrough adding more and more details to the bigger picture, and there's quite a bit of action and suspense too. By the time I finished all routes I was blown away by how much fun and excitment I ended up having!

I was also impressed by the production values, which were excellent. The art, while a step below professional, was very nice to look at, and I particularly loved the character designs as well as their various expressions. The UI was also slick and pretty, and the music beautiful and appropriate to each scene. The writing was of course top-notch. As for the playtime, I clocked a very respectable 15 hours playing all five routes, and spent a few extra hours replaying and getting all endings/achievements. Not bad for a free game!

And it's honestly unbelieavable to me that [b][i]Cinderella Phenomenon[/i][/b] is available for free. The game is brimming with quality, and it definitely deserves to be noticed for it. It was a joy to play, and I for one am eagerly awaiting whatever new games this developer team will bring us in the future.

34690322.review:
[h1]Somewhere between a visual novel and a kinetic novel.[/h1]

The biggest difference I noticed in playing this game is that it really doesn't set out to give you the ability to do everything in a single playthrough. Unlike other games, where you will either be railroaded along one and only one path with minute deviations which serve mostly as illusions of choice, or where you will be given a heavily branched tree of possibilities with great influence over it and the ability to achieve all the available goals of the game, this one takes a completely different approach.

Near the very beginning of the game, you are required to choose between 5 possible paths (2 are locked until you have completed 2 of the first 3 paths open to you). Any choices you make are still contained within the path you've chosen, and each of these 5 paths rolls out a completely different development of the same story.

What's interesting about this is that, because of that, you do not really find out all the information you need to piece the entire story (though you might guess some of it yourself along the way, with the foreshadowing provided here and there) unless you take more than one of these paths. This really brings plenty of reasons to the table to replay the game, moreso because each different development also means the end differs significantly. Besides whom you may end up with,
 [spoiler]some characters will die in some of these paths that survive in other paths.[/spoiler]

All the same, I must admit it's a little bit sad that you can't achieve all of the good goals in the game; some of the endings are brighter than others, but that's also part of the way fairytales go, so I guess it's still good.

Definitely recommended, especially since it's free. Worth checking out!

34589500.review:
I genuinely feel guilty I got this game for free! It's so good I would have been glad to throw money at it. 

The title of the game, art style and premise intruiged me - it certainly did not look or feel like your typical otome/visual novel game. From what I have seen and experienced of this genre, as well as the opposite )whatever the name is - male lead with lots of females, usually in a school) everybody and everything is shallow or annoying, or even outright disturbing and creepy (or all three at once).

Not this. This is beautiful, damn interesting and heartfelt. I never expected the plot to be so intruiging, deep or mysterious as it became (very quickly). It keeps you guessing and even wracking your brains at points trying to figure out the issues plaguing the male love interest you choose before your character does. You have to really pay attention to what's being said along with the narration by your character in order to slowly but surely piece the puzzles together, and even then the story will almost definitely pull a very interesting twist you weren't expecting. It's brilliant.

I love how the characters' stories are woven into one another, so that you're never just stuck with your character and the chosen love interest the whole time if you have chosen to see their story through, and so where you are and who you pick as your lover (and your choices) will impact others as well as your couple. It really gives a great deal more layers to the overarching story.

As far as the characters go, I love them all so far, even the ones I was sure I wasn't going to like. Testament to how clever and great the writing of this game is. They might rub you the wrong way at first, but when you get closer to them, you end up loving them and really get invested in them. That's why it broke my heart a little to get Rod's bad ending first (Rod's was the first route I played through) because I had gotten so invested in his story and I desperately wanted to save him and for him and my character to get together and Jesus the feels!

Not going to ramble anymore - PLAY THIS GAME IT'S AMAZING!

34537439.review:
Краткая версия: я, тот еще любитель халявы, готова за это платить. Одна из лучших новелл на моей памяти. 300р отдала бы спокойно, а я за любимые игры столько не отдавала.

Чуть более длинная версия:
Сюжет. казалась бы, никого из героинь сказок так не мучили, как Золушку. Во что бедную сказку только не превращали. Причем и взрослую (оригинальную) версию и детскую сказку. Особо нас уже не удивишь... Ан нет, легкий налет философии, отсутствие у "Золушки" феи-крестной (или наличие аж двух, тут как посмотреть) и появляется другая история. Это не детектив, опознать злодея (по крайней мере мне) удалось с первой картинки. Да и намекали там по ходу сюжета так, что с пролога догадаешься, но! это же новелла про любовь. И тут, как говорится, возможны варианты.
А вот что необычно для подобной игры - история самой героини. Вроде как по логике она должна быть везде. но чем больше читаешь, тем понимаешь как редкость подобная проработанность.
Рисовка и персонажи. Нарисованы все красиво и... я бы сказала вхарактерно. Злодеям лично мне хотелось поправить нос деревенским методом взгляда со второго. С картинок с парнями млею. Атмосферно. Но среди героев "особенных" нет. Все характеры ранее встречала. Справедливости ради - никогда в одной игре и никогда мне не было так наплевать на то кто на что похож. Захватило.
Музыку выключила сразу. Не по мне, ездила по ушам.
Что там еще в плюсы написали? А. Индикатор. Штука полезная, если гайды, по вашему мнению, для слабаков или вы хотите пройти в рекомендованном автором порядке. Вы сразу (+- 10 пара фраз) видите верен ли был ваш ответ. Но это дополнение можно отключить (вот тут плюс в карму), что я счита полезным для первого прохождения - интересно же чего вы стоите без подсказок :)
В общем, я рекомендую. История(и) интересная. Золушка наоборот не новинка. Но чтобы "ведьма" (характер) стала Золушкой - вижу впервые :)

I just finished the game and regret that I didn't throw money at this. Bless the souls who made this and especially making it free to play and spread otome love to all. Quick review of the game:

I loved all the routes. All the guys were loveable. The only thing I would ask to make this perfect is a Varg route. The big bad wolf deserves love :(


The music fits the mood. My favorite track would be Forgotten. I would actually like to grab some of them.


I have mixed feelings for the art. The character portraits are very appealing but some of the CGs can be a miss. Like, I really really REALLY like Rod's character portrait, but he didn't look as good in his CGs :( The only guy I think that looked good both in portrait and all of his CGs is Waltz. I still love the art, just hope that some of the guys good looks were translated better in their CGs.



The story, especially for a free game, is very very good. I like the spin it gave to fairytales and it's also not afraid to break your heart. 


And last would be about Lucette. I really, really love her character. It was enjoyable to see her growth in every route. She's now in my best MC list :D


Overall it's a great game. Can't wait for the fandisk. And if Dicesuki releases their next title as a paid title, I would be glad to throw all my money at them.

34454257.review:
Nous incarnons Lucette, une princesse froide détestée par tout le monde. Maudite par une sorcière, elle se retrouve pauvre et méconnue de (presque) tous. Les sorts jeté sur les humains correspondent tous à des contes  qui sont adaptés en fonction de l’histoire de sa victime. L’héroïne se retrouve avec celui de Cendrillon. Notre héroïne va alors tout faire pour rompre son sortilège à l’aide d’un partenaire (qui a lui aussi été victime d’un mauvais sort). 

Les graphismes sont beaux, les musiques nombreuses et superbes, le scénario est original. Il y a un total de 5 partenaires qui offrent chacun 2 fins différentes (une mauvaise et une bonne). Bien qu’il y ait un scénario défini, chaque personnage apporte une part en plus à l’histoire, d’où l’importance de tous les jouer, même si il est clair que Waltz est la véritable suite. 
Aussi, certains personnages sont bloqués au début du jeu, il faut donc finir une première fin pour pouvoir débloquer les autres. La possibilité de passer plus rapidement les dialogues jusqu’aux prochains choix est un vrai plus dans le jeu, lorsque l’on rejoue avec un partenaire pour obtenir la seconde fin. Il était vraiment plaisant de voir la personnalité de l’héroïne évolué au fil du temps. [Spoiler] Un peu triste que Varg n’est pas véritablement de good ending. Par ailleurs, son personnage était beaucoup plus complexe et plus attachant que celui de Fritz.[/spoiler]J’ai été agréablement surprise par la petite histoire « bonus » que l’on nous offre à la fin, lorsqu’on obtient le succès « happily ever after », [spoiler] et c’était vraiment étonnant de voir que la mauvaise fin de Waltz ne le touchait pas directement, mais visait Lucette elle-même, à l’instar des autres personnages qui mourraient systématiquement.[/spoiler]

J’ai passé de fantastiques moments sur ce jeu, les personnages vont tous terriblement me manquer.

 #TeamRod
 #TeamWaltz

34447735.review:
I can't believe this a free game... The quality and writing is unbelievable, not to mention the art is stunning. Each route unraveled differently, so it didn't feel like you were learning the same things each time you replayed the game. All the bachelors are lovable in their own way, and I'm sure that at least one of them will appeal to everyone.

Once again, the writing is absolutely amazing. You can sympathize with the characters, and they feel and act real, and not like some scripted code. I'd recommend this game to any otome fans, new and old.

If I had to complain about anything, it'd probably be that it was a bit hard to get the good ending first-try, without the aid of guides. I felt that I got the majority of the choices correct, but I would still end up with a bad ending. However, this didn't make the experience any worse. I still loved every minute spent on this game, and I was completely immersed in its world.

34429506.review: I'm giving this a thumbs up reluctantly. I do so because if this is your thing you'll love it. I love Visual Novels, but I HATE arbirary bad endings. AMAZINGLY well written. It's a simple story but with enough little twists to keep you guessing and hooked. The characters are uniquely quirky and well written. I got up to the end having played it everyday after work for 3 days and then BAM a bad ending so abrupt I was literally taken aback. There is no clear sign I did anything wrong, or that the decisions I made were wrong. It's a great game with bad arbritrary endings. This was going to be the first Visual Novel that I ever replayed to see what differant romance options would get me... but if they're going to make me play through 4 times, guessing which answers get me the elusive single good ending for ONE character. I'm out. You get a thumbs up, for a great story... but I'm not playing it again...

34427542.review:
Absolutely one of the best indie otome games I've ever played.

PROS:

- storyline:  it's fascinating and makes you want to keep reading
- characters:  interesting and each mysterious or flawed or both
- art: the colours are gorgeous and everything is good quality and consistent
- main character:  outstanding; she has a personality and while it's not a great one to begin with you eventually come to realize that although there's a lot to improve, there are also some key qualities to love (for me, it's honesty, directnes and courage)
- world: this story makes the whole world at least moderately important to the plot, which is unusual
- gorgeous music

CONS:  The game delivers in full on what it promises, so that's a 10/10. (I backed on Kickstarter and I'm proud of it!)
- with a bigger budget the story, characters and art could be developed even further
- some extremely minor typos (I do a lot of editing so I notice)

~ImpracticalOni (impracticaldemon on tumblr)

34285431.review:
This is a really great game, unbelievable that it's free to play.  I've yet to play Waltz's storyline, but completed 8 out of the 10 possible endings so far.  I found the order that was suggested by the gamemakers to be a very good one and would suggest newcomers follow it for the most plot enjoyment.  

I want to emphasize that every good review given here by the many other people who played this game is pretty much spot on accurate, and I agree with most of them.  So rather than rehash what's already been praised about this game, I'll go straight to the hopefully constructive critique I have.  That in no way means I did not enjoy this game very much, even more than the stories packed in some extremely popular paid games by major developers (why hello there, Square-Enix).

I personally thought the Rumple storyline was a bit weak compared to the others; it seemed to exist more to give background information on the world and other characters than to develop Rumple in a truly meaningful way.  I also would have liked to see some "normal" friendship-style endings thrown in between the extremes of "Happily Ever After" and "Shakespearian Tragedy."  That's really just splitting hairs, because the overall worldbuilding and plot was very strong in this game and I suppose I'd have loved to see even more of it!  Lastly, some of the romance tropes were very clichéd - nearly every guy had a scene which involved trapping our lovely leading lady between his arms, against some sort of flat surface, while sticking his face into the heroine's in a suave way.  Not that the pulp romance fan in me doesn't love those tropes, but they were very static, almost predictable "love cut scenes" in an otherwise refreshing and engaging writing style.

I'm both looking forward to and dreading playing the last bachelor's route in this game, if just because I know it will bring me that much closer to "completing" it.  It truly has been an enjoyable experience and I want to thank the developers from the bottom of my heart for having the creative energy and drive to build a game this great from the ground up for the rest of us, and not even charge us for the pleasure.  Wonderful work, and chapeau to your studio!

34264814.review:
I've been following Dicesuki for awhile now, and I've been really excited for this game! A part of me was kind of disappointed when I heard their next project was a fairytale game, a concept that has been beaten to death. A pleasant surprise for me, I got to see a VERY new twist on the concept! The world was rich and the characters were appealing. I adored the writing and I cried on multiple occasions. I definitely was sucked into the world and I would love to see another game set in the same universe.

I'd have to say some of it's best aspects were the art and CGs. I was also pleased by the actual difficulty of decisions, like most Otome games I find are very easy to tell what the right path is. I really enjoyed watching the protagonist grow while still ending up realistically like the same person. You can't go from cold-hearted bitch to saint, so there's a lovely in-between there I loved.

The best route was naturally Waltz's, which I thought had the best romantic buildup as well as storytelling. 10/10 muah!

My biggest disappointments were the opening song (which had poor lyric-writing and unpolished vocals) and the fact that the Fritz route did not really have much Fritz in it. I understand that there was storytelling to do in Fritz's route, but he was nigh nonexistant. I feel like an additional chapter or two of story in his route would have solved the problem. A real shame, since he was my favorite character and I loved the take on his curse.

Recommended playing order: Karma -> Rod/Rumpel (I feel these two can be interchanged) -> Fritz -> Waltz

34253199.review:
I've played a lot of visual novels but I believe that Cinderella Phenomenon is in a league of its own. There is so much to love. 

All the characters are fully fleshed out (even the background characters) with their own unique traits and storylines, so that starting a new route with a new guy is always exciting - not all visual novels are sophisticated enough to be able to work around the tedium and repetition that often exists when playing alternative routes. 

The focus isn't all on the romance either, which I personally believe adds more complexity to the story - we aren't just relentless pursuing romance for the sake of romance (in fact, all guys will end up falling in love with you regardless of what choices you make). There are elements of compelling mystery, intrigue, and action interwoven into the plot. This visual novel keeps players guessing up until the very end of the route, but even then, not all the pieces of the overarching plot will fall into place until all routes have been completed, adding to the replayability again.

34253034.review: I wasn't sure what to think of this game going in as it was free and that made me skeptical but I was very quickly shown that there was no need to be. Every route was a whirlwind of emotions that connected but remained seperate and unique. On top of that it has features that I wish more otome games had such as a "right choice indicator" and the ability to skip to the selections when trying to get all of the endings. Not only do I highly recommend this game but I've already told friends to start playing just so I can share this experience with them. 10/10 would highly recommend.

34169373.review:
[h1]CINDERELLA PHENOMENON – OTOME/VISUAL[/h1]


[h1]L’HISTOIRE[/h1]
Quatre ans après la fin de la Grande Guerre et la perte de sa mère, la Princesse Héritière Lucette d'Angielle lutte toujours pour assumer avec sa nouvelle vie et famille. Insensible et amer, la vie de Lucette est encore une fois tournée à l'envers par la Malédiction de Conte de fées, elle est jetée dans une bataille pour regagner sa couronne dans un royaume fracturé où rien n'est comme il semble.

[h1]PERSONNAGE[/h1]
Pas foule de personnage mais chacun d’entre eux est travaillé pour donné de la profondeur a chacun/chacune d’entre eux. Trahison, amitié ............. les rebondissements sont la pour tenir le joueur éveillé.

[h1]Décors[/h1]
Déception je trouve ........ les mêmes en boucle, et pas spécialement travaillé ...
Les décors ne sont pas a la hauteur du scénario du jeu ......... dommage.

[h1]Bande son[/h1]
Les musiques font passer le temps on va dire ^^
Ce n’est pas mon style du tout mais c’est pas horrible ............. bon après faut avoué que du Metal Hardcore ou Deathcore dans ce type de jeu ça serai un tantinet bizarre ^^

34131859.review:
the background music in the main menu already gave me sort of a mysterious and attractive vibe that leads you to the world of fairytales and magic, which already gave me a positive outlook on the overall game. 

Never expected that a free visual novel/otome game could have such deep, heartfelt, imaginative and creative content that are scattered in the five routes with a few plot twists here and there AND not to mention the overwhelming feels. some CGs could be drawn a bit better, but other than that, the overall artstyle (especially the backgrounds like i legit thought they're photos??? omg??) and the plot are just superb.

Oh and I just wanted to say that I never expect that the main character actually having a very realistic character development, unlike a few otome games that put most of the spotlight into the character you chose, thus feeling like the MC is just 'lucky' and a general kind person, which therefore gets all the love by resolving some issues with the character. I really really like Lucette and Rod's route is just too cute to handle!!!  

I couldn't be more glad that I got to 'discover' an awesome otome/visual novel game like this. I normally never used Steam until Dream Daddy came out, so being able to join the fandom this early is just too lucky.

PLEASE PLAY THIS and i cant wait tor more future fanfiction for this game if this actually gets recognised in the western otome fandom sooner or later.

33978876.review:
With how good this game is, I would have happily paid $15-$20 for it without question, because Cinderella Phenomenon is (in my opinion) worth it.

I won't ramble on in-depth about the game's plot, because people more articulate than I have laid it all out already. Instead I'll just emphasize how great it is as a story and concept, regardless of it being free or not.
I normally don't like the idea of a "recommended route" because it seemingly takes away the element of 'choice' in a dating sim -- why wouldn't I want to date the boy I think is the cutest first? And yet, with Cinderella Phenomenon, it's so rewarding to do it in their order. Another review said that the game is boring after you finish one route, but I personally disagree. The story unfolds more and more with every romance, clueing you into what the endgame will be, and making the final romance, Waltz's route, all the more enjoyable.

And while the love interests are great, it's refreshing that I found myself loving all of the side characters as well. From King Genaro to Delora to Annice, I adored them all so dearly. 
I loved the way the fairytales were utilized, it was fun to wrack my brain trying to remember how a story went in its original tale and how it would manifest in this game. Even when I thought I understood how a curse would work, I found myself pleasantly surprised with the twists! 

Honestly, tl;dr if you like visual novels (particularly otomes/games with romance), good character development, and/or fairytales you should give this one a shot. It's free so you have nothing to lose and everything to gain.

33978467.review:
For a free game, Cinderella Phenomenon really is good.

There are five playable bachelors, but the last two can only be unlocked once you've finished at least two of the three routes first made available to you.

The developers recommend you play Rod's route first, but that's not really necessary. Rod's route does explain some things, but frankly, he's such a boring and snotty character that it's difficult to get through. Also, he looks about twelve years old, which is so unappealing. Rod fits into the archetypical Serious Otome Boy trope, and it gets real old, real quick.

I liked Rumpel's and Karma's routes (though I do admit I liked Karma's a bit better). They do get repetitive purely because the plot is practically the same, and you have to read the same explanations about the MC's true self and what makes her so special, blah blah blah.

When you finally get to unlock Fritz and Waltz, the game actually becomes interesting.

Fritz's route, for me, was easily the best and most enjoyable. The plot is completely different than the rest of them, so it's actually refreshing, and more things are explained, including certain relationships between characters. Fritz's route makes the entire world and the dynamic between the MC and others more believable. (For example, before Fritz's route I wanted to strangle Delora and could not understand why the MC did not! Fritz's route cleared some things up for me.)

Finally, Waltz's route seems to wrap the entire story of the game up nicely, and his good ending is probably the "ideal" conclusion to the game, if there is one. I did not enjoy it as much as Fritz's, but the story was still better than the first three and Waltz was pretty endearing at times. (Also, adult!Waltz is hot. Good character design, guys.)

To wrap this review up:

Pros
- The game is free, so even if it were crap it'd be worth a shot.

- The writing is above average, especially for an otome game.

- The message of the plot/game is good!

- The MC is not just a pushover, though I did not agree with her reasoning a lot of the time.

- It's a lot of play-time for a free game.

- The art style can be really nice sometimes.

Cons
- The first three routes are really repetitive.

- It seems as if the men fall in love with the MC out of nowhere. Even if you make the wrong choices, the men still fall in love with the MC!

- In the same vein, the bad routes are genuinely just...bad. Not interesting or thrilling or exciting or horrifying. They're repetitive and boring and, frankly, they don't make sense. Seriously, why would these guys fall in love with a girl who keeps doing everything they dislike? (Especially if you're trying to get the bad routes on purpose and just end up insulting the bachelors more often than not...) Only Waltz's bad route was somewhat interesting, and the rest were...blah.

- Most of the time, the art style is just decent (why is every VN anime style anyway?), so if you care about that, it's something to consider.

- Until you play all of the routes, some things are incomprehensible, and the dynamics between the characters change rapidly and seemingly without purpose. This does get better as more things are explained.

- I *hate* how some characters (namely Delora) treat the MC at the beginning of each route. MC was horribly abused by her mother and pretty much everyone is aware of this, but it's almost never mentioned. Seriously, the girl deserves sympathy, not villification.

- No female romance options, no people of color (or, at least, no one who is overtly brown/black). It's 2017, folks. The least you can do is make an inclusive *fantasy* setting. (Karma does dress up like a woman sometimes, so there's that, I guess.)

- Some typos exist, but they're rare and unbothersome for the most part.

In conclusion, I would recommend this game. It's not perfect, but it's good, and Waltz's and Fritz's good routes are worth checking it out.

33962461.review:
[b]Do *not* dismiss this VN because it's free-- it's actually among the best VN's I've ever played![/b]
 
No joke, this is astonishingly good. Most pleasantly surprising of all is that the story, the characters, and the development of both in all routes are *fantastic.* Let me count the ways:
 
[b]*[/b] Everyone (the player character Lucette, the 5 guys, and even the minor/side characters! O.O ) actually feel like real, complete people, with real lives and histories. (Indeed, it's not much of a spoiler to say that the player character is essentially a *villain* at the start, and has to learn how to really live throughout the course of her journey; and all the rest of the characters have great journeys of their own as well.)
 
[b]*[/b] The world and magic system are well-developed.
 
[b]*[/b] The fairy tales (which are *not* the Disney-fied versions!) and the resulting curses are *very* cleverly implemented, relating to the characters' personalities/issues/etc. in uniquely appropriate ways (and given brilliant twists, to boot).
 
[b]*[/b] Every route is completely different in both relationship and plot (and even though there are certain events that are always being planned by the baddies no matter what, they get implemented-- or not-- in quite different ways depending on the circumstances of each route).
 
[b]*[/b] The bad ends are downright brutal O_O , and the good ends feel earned and are satisfyingly sweet, yet are often a bit more realistic than fluffy (though the soon-to-be-released fandisc should give us all the fluffy epilogues we could want ;D , and I can't wait for that! <3 ), yet everything that happens in either ending of each route is perfectly logical given each circumstance/choice.
 
[b]*[/b] And the way everything builds and unfolds if you go through it in the recommended (really required, IMO) order-- that is, Rod first, then Karma, then Rumpel, then Fritz, and then finishing with Waltz-- is just perfect.
 
This is *so* good, in fact, that I'd not only willingly have paid full price for it had it not been free, but I actually went and donated to the indie developers because I wanted to thank them and support more of their amazing work.
 
TL;DR: I cannot recommend this highly enough-- and there's literally nothing to lose, so what are you waiting for? Download it now! :)

33932279.review:
I've played my fair share of visual novel games, downloaded and deleted a bunch of them, including here on Steam, and let me just say this is [b] [i] one of the best [/i] [/b] I've ever played. 

Not only is the music superb (I couldn't stop playing them in my head), the art of the game is also very beautiful and extremely pleasant to look at. Games like these are called visual novels for a reason, so having wonderfully drawn art like this is sort of necessary for a great experience.


Not to mention, every storyline (especially the two you unlock later) are just so well written in general and completely different from each other. I'm not talking about the whole 'courting' part of the storyline because the dates the MC goes on with each person is always different. But the fact that each character's storyline not only gives you relationships with different supporting characters, but also a different main villain and crisis for you to deal with? This, I really appreciate since I've played visual novel games where the overall storylines don't change much between characters.

I honestly have no idea why this game is free to play, I would definitely pay for a game like this.

33927444.review:
TL'DR
Hunky bishy guys
Main character that feels like a character and not a stand-in
Suceeds in actually feeling like a fairy tale romance
Non-Blood Related Brother/Sister Incest
It's free, but unlike Dies Irae, it actually feels like the plot is progressing when you press Enter, and not like you're being bombarded by walls of bloated prose.
7.5/10

Real review

The premise is interesting, the main character has their own agency and character development, the cast can be charming, and like a fairy tale, the story does dip into being legitimately romantic (at least if you're like me and are a suker for that kind of thing). It's a little short for my tastes, but at least it never felt boring. No scene felt pointless, and every segment felt like it added progression to the plot, which can't be said for some other Visual Novels. I cannot stress enough how refreshing it felt to read through something that didn't feel the need to drag through every stray thought that visited the main character in every conversation. The counterpoint is that some of the elements (especially some of the romance) seems lacking. Not for every route, but it's there for some of them.

Overall, a very solid Visual Novel. As far as it compares to other Otome games, I can't really say. But in the grand scheme of things, you could do a lot worse than this.

 7.5/10

And it's free.

33925205.review:
This is, by far, one of the best otome games I have ever played (and I've played a lot!). The store is so interesting with a unique twist on all the cliches of childhood fairytales, fairies, and witches. It's mechanics are easy to use (Ren'Py is wonderful), it's art is pleasing to look at, it's characters are varied (for the most part) in personality and diverse in appearance, the Princess is a dynamic protagnist that genuinely develops as story progresses, the music is not grating, and the dialogue is interesting (a couple parts of the story drag, if you've done multiple routes in a row, but it's in such short amounts that it's barely a bother). Cinderella Phenomenon made a wonderful romance story, and with no fan service, which is something that is REALLY hard to avoid in this genre of games.

By far, my favorite part of this game is that the story is not rinse, wash and repeat with each romance route. Each difference in choice and each romance results in a different ending (whether it's some minor details changing, or the story itself being turned inside out), which BOOSTS replayability. I am STILL playing through a couple of the endings, just because I am so interested in seeing the difference that will occur!

Highly recommend this game! I will remain hopeful for a future installment!

33811524.review:
[b]“There is the great lesson of 'Beauty and the Beast,' that a thing must be loved before it is lovable.” ― G.K. Chesterton[/b]

As a preliminary declaration, I am astonished that an Otome VN with this caliber being a freeware, and it also being the first ever project of Dicesuki development team. I mean, it is surprisingly good for a first trial in the Otome genre, even better compared to products of some veteran developers. Let's take a closer look at the game and discuss its various other qualities aside being free, huh? Because there are many.

Once upon a time, there was a not so sweet little princess named Lucette. Sure she was fair and pretty as most princesses, but she was also cold, rude and mean; taking no interest in any other's feelings or needs whatsoever. She was selfish and cruel also, to a degree that even her own family were wary of her. So... what to do with this little meanie? Why, curse her of course: put a spell on her so everyone would forget that she is royalty, thus living as an ordinary person would teach her some humility, kindness or maybe even compassion in the long run. In her challenge to break her own curse, the princess must accomplish three good deeds. It may sound plain and simple, but not so much for someone who has never committed a single good deed in all her life. For her trial to learn goodness, Lucette choses one of the five fine gentlemen who are also cursed, to serve as a partner and a companion. In trying to help each other breaking their curses, romance arises, but that is not the center of Lucette's story. Things may start simple or even comedic, but given time, Lucette is to find herself in a conspiracy concerning the crown and the fate of the kingdom.

There are five romance paths concerning some really well-written gentlemen here, but I'll get there. In each path, aside the relationship build, you gather different nuances, anecdotes or clues concerning the grand picture. Answers to some questions may lie in different paths, so even though you wouldn’t be interested romantically, I advise playing all paths. When they all are played and their good endings are acquired, the full picture is revealed. Events prior to the story, backgrounds of different romance options, NPCs’ own interrelation and the story consistency itself are gradually revealed and all are imaginative, interesting and attractive. All characters - whether they be main romance options or ordinary NPCs - harbor well thought stories of their own with distinct personalities. I am happy to declare that I didn't encounter any stereotypes in this game. If someone looks like a stereotype, it means that there are things to be revealed about him/her yet. That, I can assure.

What we were saying? Ah, romance options! Sure, this is an Otome in the end, huh? Well, all boys are mostly interesting with well written paths, both their personalities and curses that make their path worthy to play. Rod is our step brother and the current crown prince who lost his voice thanks to the Mermaid's curse. He is stubborn and disinterested mostly, but he has a golden heart. Karma is the pretty, reckless and bohemian creature that no one knows anything about - aside him/her being a master swordsman and a grade A slacker. He bears the Beauty and the Beast curse, and he is one of my favorites in the game. Rumpel was my least favorite, considering his route was mostly slow pacing and his involvement lacks anything related to the main character to begin with. He seems like a womanizer who forgot his own name and throws cheesy compliments around like its wedding confetti, who actually harbors a deep trauma concerning the value of life. Well, then comes Fritz... It's hard to explain about Fritz without giving spoilers but it should be suffice to say that he is our knight, who genuinely likes us and wishes to protect us without any apparent ulterior motive. He is solely a good guy. Huh, who would have thought? Then, my favorite ever - and the last of the routes that should be played: Waltz. He is a street magician by the age of 12 - or is he? Well, telling anything else would spoil the magic. Let’s just say he is older than he looks to be.

The game is made in classical Ren'Py engine. You have 30 or so choices to make in each playthrough to see what happens. Your choices do change the end game, and alter the pace of the main story in some small amount but whatever you do or say, the boy of your choice will love you. Your choices only affect the end game circumstances, which would create either a happy ending or an uncontrollable tragedy. According to the amount of correct choice, you either grab a happy ending by the side of your love, or fail to reach happiness due to a dire mishap. Btw, it might be useful to note that whatever you do, some bloodshed is unavoidable, befitting to any crown conspiracy - especially in a world involving magic.

Art works are not miraculous, but they are beautiful and elegant with an anime style. Background artwork is pretty much run of the mill, but character artworks are especially fetching. I must say that the diversity of expressions used for each character is more than satisfying too. No voice acting present, but CG scenes are plenty and they are plenty pretty. The game soundtrack is more than fitting, and sound effects are well timed with appropriate mood influences. Oh, there are also Steam achievements involved, and all this game has to offer - which is 30 hours or so gameplay - is free.

If you are even remotely interested in the Otome genre or would like to try one without anything to lose, this is one of the better options for you. It doesn't contain any fan service - which is a huge pro for me - and it harbors an elaborate setting that packs a good amount of story. So... go ahead… I bet you'll get a favorite path of your own in no time. As a side note, I would recommend getting the DLC that contains game art to support the developer for a measly 5 dollars. The game itself actually deserves far more, and I hope that it would encourage the developer to bring us other beautiful games like this in the future.

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

While Cinderella Phenomenon has a great story and interesting characters, I feel that the endings- particularly the bad ends- fell flat and just were simply nonsensical. I'll say why exactly, but it will be at the bottom of the review so as to not be a spoiler.

It also suffered from a mild lack of believability in terms of character action. Despite what your "guide" characters are saying, I feel that the protagonists views that she gets from her mother are very practical.

Overall, it was a lovely story that brought some new charm to the table, but conceptually it gets tangled in itself. It is free to play though, and there are games that cost money that are much worse than this one. 
















Spoiler: They need the protagonist's help in order to resurrect Hildyr, yet somehow on a bad end after they slay the love interest or the love interest dies, they manage to win apparently. It may just be me, but I wouldn't be very prone to helping someone who just had slain my crush, and if I was suddenly inheritting massive power I'm fairly sure I wouldn't eradicate them first thing, yet we're forced to believe that this doesnt happen for some reason?

Also, Dolora preaches about balance, but she's trying to make you good. Therefore upsetting the balance, and turning the whole concept upside-down. It makes more sense conceptually to stick to what Hildyr taught the protagonist in order to restore balance.

For the amount of content that this game has and it being free, there's no reason not to play this game. Pretty much all the routes are good (even the bad routes are well-written and not haphazardly inserted). Only exception is Rumpel's route, but that's only because I found it difficult to relate to him. Only thing I could really critique about this game was the fact that even though the MC was portrayed as a misunderstood villain, the other villains were painted as pure evil. One of the main themes of this game is that no one is completely good nor evil. There's always a balance. And yet, villains like [spoiler]Mythros and Alcaster[/spoiler] seemed to be displayed as your typical evil villains. It would have been nice if the game gave the player more insight as to why these characters acted as evil as they did. Even [spoiler]Varg and Hildyr[/spoiler] had reasons for acting evil.

33614415.review:
UAO.
Altra perla gratuita per chi ama le visual novel.
Storia lunga e interessante.
Non solo: il gioco ha più ramificazioni. Una partita sola si prende tra le 4 e le 5 ore.
Pensavo che cambiasse poco con delle particolari scelte che si fanno all'inizio.
Ho provato la seconda run e... in pratica la ramificazione è totale, cambia tutto.
Mi mancano ancora tre altre scelte, quindi non posso confermare al momento (ma aggiornerò*), ma se così dovesse essere si tratterebbe di altre 10/15 ore aggiuntive.
Consigliato anche questo, dopo Cupid, per chi si vuole spaparanzare a distanza e leggere rilassandosi una bella storia.
A distanza perchè il gioco può essere eseguito con il pad (quindi ci si muove tra i menù con esso), anche se quando ci sono da fare le scelte osservo un problema in quando non mi fa scegliere tutte le voci con il controller e mi costringe a usare il mouse. Ma è l'unico difetto che gli posso imputare.

8/10, come Visual Novel

PS: qui non c'è proprio NULLA di NULLA di erotico, quindi lo sconsiglio ai porcelloni.

* In effetti ci sono 5 diramazioni principali: ogni diramazione è una storia a sé stante della durata di 4-5 ore ciascuna. A sua volta ciascuna diramazione prevede un bad ending o un good ending. In questo caso però le differenze sono poche per tutti i capitoli del gioco (10 capitoli) tranne l'ultimo che cambia totalmente a seconda che si sia arrivati al bad o al good ending. Solo nel caso dei good ending si arriva alla fine vera della storia con i titoli di coda. Nell'altro caso finisce male e si chiude senza molte spiegazioni su cosa succeda agli eventi...
Le 5 diramazioni non sono tutte disponibili all'inizio: solo 3 lo sono. Le ultime due si sbloccano finendo con il good ending le 3 già sbloccate. Se si vuole vedere tutto il gioco ha bisogno di molta dedica.

33598747.review:
1000/10, absolutely amazing, tears are guaranteed or your money back (oh wait it's FREEE) 

I haven't finished this game yet, but oh my dear sweet baby jesus it is sooooo good. There's a lot of content and beautiful art and both heart warming and heart wrenching endings, and I'm honestly in awe that this is a free game. I've paid $20 for games with stories less endearing than these and I've only completed 2 characters (I've gotten both endings for Karma and only the bad end for Rod). This game will make think everything is great and then BAM! turns out you've got the bad ending and your heart is broken [spoiler] just like the MC's [/spoiler] The bad endings hurt so good though, you'll want to experience them, if only to make the good endings better. 
My only problem is it can be a little difficult to get the good ending (or at least it was difficult for me) because some of the choices to get the good ending (at least in Karma's case) are opposite of what you might think. I got a bad ending three times in a row before I managed to finally figure it out, but don't let that stop you from playing the game. If you're not super dedicated to playing through the same route multiple times with minor tweaks, there are walkthroughs out there to guide you. Or if you're stubborn and prideful (me), the game does have an amazing fast forward feature to go ahead and get to the choices. The fast forward can be a bit slow or give you an error message if you skip too far ahead (i.e. if the next choice is all the way in the next chapter), but nothing game breaking as far as I've experienced. 
The MC actually has a personality aside from the usual ditzy/clueless/airhead/etc. usually found in these types of games, and over the course of the story, you actually get to see that personality change. Some of the love confessions can seem a bit abrupt but they're not nearly as sudden as in other games, and I personally didn't have a problem with them. 

Overall, amazing game and definitely worth a look at least. It's free, but worth at least $10, probably more.

33594859.review:
This is the first otome/visual novel that I played and is by far the best I've encountered. The beauty of the artwork and the concept of the fairytale-twist story drew me in. After playing for a while it's genuinely hard to believe Cinderella Phenomenon is free, Dicesuki could easily be charging for it. I hope we see more games from them soon!

The overall quality of CP is astonishing. The music is excellent, the characters (even the more minor ones) and the plot are well developed and the interface is nicely laid out. Each route is fairly long and distinct from the others, plus the heroine isn't a stereotypical damsel in distress (she's more 'tsundere') - all things which set this above many similar games out there.[spoiler]I also liked the use of the old, darker versions of the fairy tales for the curses.[/spoiler] It isn't always obvious what you should choose either. If you play with the right-choice indicator off it can be a bit of a challenge to get the ending you're looking for, but that's all part of the fun!

What are you waiting for? Try it! It is free, after all.

33492784.review:
So, the heroine starts out with options of pursuing a crossdresser, a sexpest, or her stepbrother. As I like to call them, the Widow Twankey, Simple Simon, and [i]her stepbrother[/i]. I chose the stepbrother, and it was worth it.

This is a brilliant Otome game, proving once again that psychology beats sex (that's why straight men play Otome games). The heroine is a developed, developing tough-as-nails adorable character with an immediate serious problem; she has lost her place as a princess and no one remembers who she is. Thankfully she has a great chemistry with all five of the chaps who stand ready to assist her. Widow Twankey's hidden depths deserve special mention, but I found each route better than the last; all deeply and excellently characterised, highly tense, but by no means uncompletable. The story is, to be fair, tied to the romantic visual novel route, as it were, compared to even more psycologically innovative stories like Cinders. The writing might also not quite convey so much torrid passion as Amnesia, but what is torrid passion worth without character and originality? And CP has far more of those than Amnesia and many, many other novels.

33472996.review:
I downloaded this a few months ago and just got around to playing it. I finished one route (Karma), loved it, went back to the Store page to see what other games the developers made, and absolutely could not believe this game was Free to Play. It's better than many other games I've paid for. 

The premise and story are creative and compelling. The main character is unique in that she's not entirely likeable for a great deal of the game, yet she manages to be strong and inspiring and you end up cheering for her. I love that the typical submissive or obvious choices are either missing, or they actually aren't received well by the character you're pursuing (I'm annoyed by games where you have to follow the idiot wilting flower choices in order to win the guy). The art and music are beautiful. And all around, it was an engaging game well deserving of its excellent reviews. 

I am so excited to play through the rest of the routes. I bought the art book just to support the studio; I would have had no problems paying for this game. We need more unique and intelligent otome games, and I can't wait to see what they come up with next.

33467755.review: Usually, I prefer a much more involved or active visual novel, like Long Live the Queen where there are many choices and the enedings are diverse and hard to achieve. I'm not usually drawn to those which follow a more traditional otome game format with clear routes and implications about choices, but the writing of this one is so good that I was completely enthralled with almost every route and even replayed some without skipping over everything I've already read like I normally do. I think the choices are also, while clear, still difficult to make and they allowed me to relate to the main character even though I felt very differently than her at the beginning of the game. Happily ever after isn't always perfect and while there will always be an aspect of fantasization to dating simulators like this, I feel it still showed the flaws in all the characters and their imperfect endings while leaving me satisfied with the story I got out of it all. I really enjoyed being in the realm of Angielle for a few days while I completed all the endings and learned all the character's backstories.

33455441.review:
Cinderella Phenomenon est un visuel novel qui vaut le détour!

Etant déjà une adepte des VN, je ne pouvais pas passer à côté de ce chef d'oeuvre, gratuit qui plus est, qui m'a offert plus de 30 heures de beauté en pleine figure! Ce jeu réunit à la fois une belle bande son (en particulier l'opening que j'écoute actuellement en boucle), un magnifique graphisme et surtout une histoire et des personnages interressants! Chaque personnage possède un background et un caractère bien à lui et ce, même pour la protagoniste! En effet notre petite Lucette a du caractère et elle est loin d'être gentille tout plein, au contraire, quand quelque chose lui déplait, elle le dit clairement, sans se soucier des sentiments des autres! (ça change des petites protagonistes plantes vertes qui se laissent faire lol) En plus de ça, elle a une vraie histoire, et toutes ses actions et toutes ses lacunes concernant les contes sont expliquées clairement, et avec des raisons plausibles en vu de son passé. Un autre point fort de ce jeu est également la réelle différence présente entre chaque route, qui permet à chaque fois de connaître une partie de l'histoire de la petite Lucette, et en donnant des révélations à chaque fois plus surprenante, et des histoires à la fois belles et tristes. 

En bref, pour toutes les personnes adeptes de VN, il n'y a pas à hésiter, ce jeu est pour vous!
(PS: Petit conseil, pour avoir une gradation ascendante de surprise avec les révélations je vous conseille de jouer les routes dans cet ordre: Ron, Karma, Rumpel, Fritz et Waltz)

I recommend this game for anyone that even slightly likes visual novels, fairytales, romances, or just good storytelling. 33410208.review:
I think that many before me wrote that already, but it's one of the best free vn I know.

Well, maybe, just maybe, someone is interested in reading this. So I want to review not only the positive, but the negative aspects. I do it first for the whole game, then for each story, so it is going to be pretty long.

The game:
+ grafics (i mean if you look at it as a free game. ofc games like Amnesia have asthonishing grafics, but then they are also very pricey)
+ music (i think the music was okay, but got a little bit annoying after a while, when playing different routes with the same bg music...)
+ idea (i think it's not a common idea to use fairy tales as plot for a visual novel. and the idea to reverse them was also really good.)
+ characters (for a free game the characters were unexpectigly deep. they had a personality - it was not like the  focus was on the romance, but also how the characters deal with the feelings, making it more like a story than a otome for me.)
+ plot (it was not really deep (my opinion) but they carried it really well out. the stories were connected and if you played it in the right order, then you also understood the idea at the end)
+ main character (she had a personality, not being a lifeless doll or a total damsel in distress. i liked it)

- main character (she had maybe even too much personality. often i couldn't really emphatize with her. In some routes like Fritz she was overly selfish and like a damsel in distress, but then in the routes of Rumpel or Waltz she was so selfless that I'd call her stupid.)
- characters (somehow, I still think that they had more potential than in the game. e.g. Waltz had really much potential, so that the plot could be much longer)
- plot (well, I'm sorry, but there are some things I don't like about this. The thing with the reversed fairy tales was great. Also the idea about her mother. But then in the plot... I think that the focus lied on the tragic story with the MCs mother, the fairy tale curses making just a shard of the story... I mean, the idea was new, it was great. There could be more done with it e.g. that they lived like in the story: there was peter pan, a child, who couldn't grew up. But he had a lot of friends and the MC became like Wendy for him. But then it was his curse to not leave Neverland and Wendy wanted to leave. So he wanted to stay with her, but he couldn't. MC wants to make a good deed, so she tries to convince him, but then there's captain hook ... and so on )
- choises (God, this really bothered me. I mean REALLY! You just can't get them right. I mean the text on the buttons and the things she said, often don't match. So you need to reload when doing most of the choises at least once every few choises. AND ITS SO FRUSTRATING! Like with Rod, i COULDNT GUESS ALMOST ANY OF THEM RIGHT ON MY FIRST TRY!? And, come on, I'm not so bad at otome games... most of them just didn't make sense for me... like e.g. biting Karmas hand (WHY WOULD U DO THIS?!??!?!?))

Well, I don't want to complain so much, so let's move on to the routes.

Rod:
I think it was the most understandable route of all, although I had a lot of problems with the choises. Rod has the spell of the little mermaid. And it's one of my favorite fairy tales. But well, he is like the mermaid himself. He doesn't want to bother anyone and is pretty shy, so I found him very adorable. There wasn't much of the main story in his route, but well, now we know, why Ophelia married the king (i still think that detail is pretty funny).

Karma:
Well, Karma is Karma. I love guys like him in vn because they are most of the times easy to deal with. Karma wants attention and he wants love. He has the curse... well you will know. But it's my second most beloved fairy tale. And the route itself was a little bit too short for me, but I kind of liked it. But well, the MC wasn't really good in this one I think. If you know, what I mean /coughts bad end /coughts. And that she would learn sword techniques was a little too much for me...

Rumpel:
Ahh, when I started this route, I thought it'd be the funniest one and I was right. This flirty idiot, whom I really wanted to slap a lot of times through the routes... well he had almost the best story (my third favorite). I really enjoyed, how he had grown in the story, realizing that sometimes you need to sacrifice in order to protect. And in this route the main was also really nice. I could almost every time agree with her choises.

Fritz:
Well, this, this is my FAVORITE!!! I ship them. I really do. I think the main and Fritz are meant to be together (and don't you dare to say that Waltz is canon with her DON'T CHA). Fritz has the curse of the tale I think everybody knows. And I think it was the best idea to make it reversed like this in the game. This was the only story, where I really cried. It was killing me, how he was adoring the princess the whole time, willing to do everything just for her to be safe. After ... well when the queen was there and passed away, Fritz always watched her. He wanted her to be happy, to protect her. He wanted to stay with her and he was restless until he found her. Fritz has the saddest curse of all of them I think (besides Rods bad end /coughts), but he still is willing to give up his life for her. He has such strong feelings for her that he could overcome his curse... well... I just loved this story. It's really sad but adorable at the same time.

Waltz:
Last but not least. My favorite character. My favorite fairy tale. And then came the route. It had so much potential, god, but it was too short. I know that it is difficult to write a romantic story, when the hero knows that he loves her and spoils her a lot accordingly. I know that it's not easy to write the conclusion of main story, when you have to mind all the story pieces you had written before. But P L E A S E, don't make a fairy tale curse WITHOUT ALMOST NOTHING BASED ON THE FAIRY TALE (i don't mean the mettaphors e.g. queen = hook). And the MC... I was so devastated at her change. She turned into a person... well she just wanted to sacrifice herself for everyone. And... well I don't like it. The story turned into something like The Maid of Orléans and it displeased me greatly because I'm not fond of people rushing into death. Simply choises like her trying to stab herself, only to save her father... it's just too much drama for me I'm sorry. Nevertheless I loved Waltz personality. So it was nice having at least him around in the route ;)

I was interested in Cinderella Phenomenon because the fairy tale theme intrigued me, had many good recommendations, and happened to be free. This was also my first time playing a visual novel.

The art and the story are so beautiful and I really appreciate the effort that went into making each of the characters unique. Each storyline, while different, also linked in with one another. I highly recommend following the story order recommended by the developers, as more layers were added to the story each time I played it through. I appreciated being able to change the princess' first name and liked doing so for each new character path I took. 

The only downside I experienced was that I lack the ability to choose every correct path on my own to get the good endings, which was necessary to unlock the paths of Fritz and Waltz. Thankfully some users have put together extemely helpful walkthough and achievement guides for this game, if you get stuck.

PROS
-FREE TO PLAY! You don’t have to pay a cent for this game! 
-Good art. I liked the character design and backgrounds as they were all well done and detailed. 
-Compelling characters and character development 
-15 plus hours of game play 
-Easy to achieve endings. The game has a good ending indicator after every choice and many save states, therefore it is easy to get the good endings. 
-Well written and entertaining 
-Positive take on cross dressing 
-Strong main character (not one of those ninny headed damsels)

CONS and Explanations 
-Somewhat similar story lines. Without giving anything away, a lot of the bigger plots are very similar, although the more detailed components are different

-This might be nitpicking, however, I wish there was more after story! I want more love! Each story had a kiss, but sometimes I just need a tiny bit more smut in my life. (Ah to be an old perverted man, but I digress)

33313017.review:
This review was written after completing every route and achievement in the game. Like others, I didn't expect much from this game because it's free to play. But don't let that fool you - I'd rate this game a 10/10!

You play as Lucette, a princess with a cold heart. This immediately caught my attention because the MC was flawed. She had her own issues to work with, and wasn't some spineless damsel in distress. While progressing through the game, you could feel the MC change and learn with you. This applies to not only the MC, but the five other love interests as well. Each of them have vastly different characters and storylines such that you won't feel like you're reading the same story five times. They don't appear as perfect men, but are guys with flaws that grow together with the MC.

Other positive notes about this game were the amazing art, appropriate music soundtracks and with the right dose of humor and seriousness. Even the side characters were not sidelined and each had a part to play in the story.

One minor flaw about this game is actually a spoiler, so read at your own risk. [spoiler] I wished that Varg would get some love as well. I know it's ultimately still Fritz's body, but the guy that we saw more of was Varg. He was interesting, unpredictable, and I would like to have seen more of him / the darker side of Fritz that Varg stemmed from. [/spoiler]

However, this game is definitely a lot better than some of the paid ones I've seen floating around, and this is just minor nitpicking from me.

I would recommend playing Waltz's route the last, as his story ties up all the loose ends from the other routes the best. My personal favourites are Karma and Waltz! I love them so much, please help me. This game is free to play, so I urge anyone who is considering to just dive in, and hopefully you had as much fun as I did.

33294283.review:

I'm glad I played this game, and I'm definitely going to check out anything that this devloping team has made as well.
