33064147.review:
[i]Cinderella Phenomenon[/i] takes place in the fantasy kingdom of Angielle. The story takes place four years after the Great War between fairies and witches. In this world, witches are generally hated by the populace due to the fact that they are often portrayed as being villainous in fairy tales. You play as Lucette, the crown princess of the kingdom, who is arrogant, cynical, and generally looks down on people. That is until one day she is cursed by a witch. Like others who have been cursed, she suffers a type of "fairy tale curse." Every curse is based on a well-known fairy tale. For Lucette, she suffers from the Cinderella curse. Her previous life of luxury as a member of royalty is gone. She now lives as a poor commoner and everyone, expect magical beings and other cursed individuals, has forgotten who she truly is. Now she must complete at least three good deeds in order to break the curse and return to her former life. Along the way, there is a colorful cast of characters to help her.

This game is a visual novel, a type of game that is entirely story-driven. In total, there are five major routes to choose from in this game, one for each romanceable man, each with his own curse to overcome. Each route has a good or bad ending, depending on the choices the player makes during the game, for a total of ten different endings.

The art in the game is very well done. This goes for all aspects with beautiful and detailed backgrounds and unique character designs. I also thought the music is pretty good, too, and it really helped with the atmosphere of the game.

The main attraction of any visual novel is the story. In this case, I found the game to be quite well-written. It would have been easy just to slap together a cheap romance plot for each guy, but the creators of this game really put in a lot more. To start, the world and lore presented is fairly interesting and as I kept playing I wondered what else I would learn about it. This also goes for the characters. Lucette is not some empty shell visual novel protagonist, but is written as a character  in her own right that fully develops throughout the story. Each of the characters in the game are written well, too, and you learn more about them as the game progresses. With five different routes to choose from, there is plenty of more story to experience on each play-through. You will never find out everything about the story line or the characters through a single route.

Overall, for a free visual novel, this is a fantastic experience. I found this game to have good art and a well written story and characters. I would recommend this to those that like visual novels.

33007781.review:
First off, let me start off by saying that I have played many MANY otome games. I started playing otome when I was about 16 (I am 20 now), and I just loved the fact that otome games are like novels/stories where you play the role of the protagonist. This otome, out of the many I have played (many of which I have payed for) is by far one of my favorites along with midnight cinderella (although Midnight Cinderella is mostly P2W). I just cannot wrap my head around how this one is free!? I AM SERIOUS. This otome is truly worth money, and yet here it is for free.. I'm not complaining or anything, I am okay with that since I got to enjoy this, but I wish that the person who created this game would get more for it, since you can truly see all the detail and effort put into every character, story, artwork, and music.

*Beyond this point might be slightly spoilerish as far as the MC goes; no spoilers on  the dateable characters however*

1. I have never been the kind of person to complain about an MC (the heroine) as usually they are written rather blandly so that you can instead project your own personality onto her, but this MC really hit home for me. She is a lot like myself, and it really made me re-evaluate how I see people and the world in general. I am often told that I am cold and should smile more, and I don't allow people into my life nor trust anyone (even family) as I have been shown from a young age that no one can be trusted. Not even family. I won't go into further detail of my past as that is no one's business, but I will say that she (the MC) reminded me so much of myself. I actually cried when I came to that realization, but I was filled with hope seeing as how she was able to change such a demeaner/ way of thinking. I will try to make a conscious effort to do the same as I was very inspired by this story.

2. Each character is so unique and different, all of them warmed my heart. The only route I was not excited about at first was Rumples, I just did not like him to begin with. After finishing his route, I actually liked and respected his character. Surprisingly, there was not a single route that I did not enjoy (which for me is a first... Especially since amnesia and mystic messenger -_-) 

3. The artwork is beautiful, and truly amazed me at how many CG's you get for EACH character! Not to mention all of the CG's actually look beautiful, AND IT'S FREE. Truly this game is amazing. I cannot digress how much I have enjoyed this game thus far.

4. The story is so engaging and captivating, and for me very relateable. Maybe not for others (I don't really care), but for me it was. I think that is why this game was quiet dear to me.. I have never related to a main character before, but this one was different. I also enjoy the fact that each route is so unique and different from the other while still maintaining a steady plot. (I love reading, and writing my own stories) and I must say that this one is very well made. 

5. The music is beautiful! I will not lie however, when I first heard the intro song, I loved the music until the voice appeared. I scoffed at the voice and thought his voice sounded rather whiney and annoying, but it grew on me. Now, I won't even open the game without letting the intro song play.

10/10 would reccomend. Even if it was not free, this game would most certainly be worth every penny. I hope that more games such as this will be released in the future. 

*On a sidenote* The moment I saw Waltz, I knew he would be my favorite character. That still holds true.

I wasn't really sure what to make of this game at first. With games, you get what you pay for, and with free games my expectations are very low. At first, playing through the prologue, I got a little discouraged as the build-up was a little slow. It gets so good though! The quality of this visual novel is incredible! I have only gotten half the endings so far, and it's taken me 14.4 hours! There have been visual novels I've played where the asking price is greater than $10, with not nearly as much content. However! Don't go thinking that this game sacrifices quality for quantity. Each route is unique, and has emotional weight that draws the player in. Every route feels like a fleshed out story, and the player wants to go back to the other routes to find out more about the world of the game. The protagonist is multifacted and has flaws, and she goes through an incredible journey of growth in every route. The characters are memorable and loveable, and not just the love interests. I am so taken by the storytelling of this game that I already know I'm going to go back to reach all the bad endings. (You know a game is good when you want to let it hurt you, lol)

32888143.review:
This is, by far, the best VN I've ever played. Heartwrecking and gentle, it explores such heavy yet familiar to us all topics such as loneliness, abandoment and trust, struggle to be understood and accepted as we are, yet grow and be a better person. 
There is really no cons here. The plot is simple, yet holds enough intrigue and depth to keep the reader engaged through all the routes, slowlly unravelling it's little detailes, the futher it goes. It also changes through the routes, so that you never really know what to expect from the next line, that appears on the screen. I also extremely enjoyed the writing itself. There is pretty much no mistakes, it is polished, smooth and pleasant, and you not even notice most of the time, how time flies by over reading. 
The Best part for me was the heroine herself. If you, as I am, hate those hollow dummies, that exist only to serv as projections for the reader to emagine the romance Otome provides - well, you will be indeed pleased. Because here princess IS actual main hero, she has clearly defined personality, strengh and weaknesess, history, reasonable reasons for being who and how she is. And not lesser reasons to change, to grow and learn. She is consistent, deep and very real. Here relationships are not the only thing there is to know about her, yet they remain indefinetly important, just as for us our famylies, friends and loved ones. 
About the latter... The guys are gorgeous, all of them. Really different from each other, and even though can be define by usual types as the genre intales, they surpass these stereotypes. Just as heroine, they have personality, there own demons (sometimes literally), there own path, which they follow with MC equally, not dragging her behind them as decoration and not dissapearing in her shadow. 
And on top of it all, like the cherry on top of a cake, is overall art. Weirdly, my favourite part of it is interface and the chapters pages, along with ends. It is intricate and elegant, perfectly in synch with the rest of the art and the story itself.  The backgrounds are also beautiful, especially the forest, I honestly tried to just hide the interface a few times, simply to enjoy the picture. 
Lastly, soundtrack is, as I think must be - is not annoying and not really notecable. As there is no voice acting, the tunes are there enough to not attract to much attention but highlight the story, and it is great. Also never noticed any breakes, music is perfectly looped. 
Overall, I think deves should definetely charge for this truly amasing work they've done. Would've paid for the game in a heartbit, and I strongly urge everyone to just try and read it, because that expirience is absolutely worth it.

32887553.review:
I've played it before downloading from Steam, seen all the routes except Rod's.

When I've played the demo I was impressed. I love retellings of fairytales, adding more moral ambiguity to them, a bit like in Cinders. Our heroine isn't usual nice and\or shy girl, she's always on guard, hurts others. And she's lonely, bitter. Despite that, she's likeable and I can relate to her.

What I loved modt in this game was plot, esecially its originality, but it was lost in the finished game. No shades of grey, white and black only. I agreed in some points with heroine (relationship with father!), but now the game tells me - she was bad girl, nothing she thought was right and she must change completly. The main conflict got the same treatment.

On the plus side it has nice music and art, backgrounds are just stunning. Still, I can't really recommend the game. It's not bad per se, but betrayed its potential. It should've been great, but it's average.

32835471.review:
I absolutely loved this game - which is something I wasn't expecting, based on how annoying I thought Lucette was within the first few minutes of playing (now she is my baby, and I love her); the writers did a really amazing job at developing her as a character, to have her go from someone so truly unlikeable to someone so endearing so quickly.  The stories were also much darker than I expected.  Lots of death and violence, and heartbreak.  I was near tears several times, even on the good routes.  I was surprised by how much I liked all of the male characters.  Routes I wasn't initially all that intrigued by ended up surprising me with their twists, and I loved how all of the different pieces fit together to form the overarching story.  Every time I played a new route I would learn something I hadn't in a previous one, and it made me giddy!

I would say to save frequently, because the game does crash sometimes when you skip forward.

I would absolutely LOVE a sequel, so I really hope that teaser at the end is something the gamemakers follow up on. (And if it is, I would really appreciate them bringing Varg back because I loved him and that made me sad). :D

32833362.review:
[b] Note: [/b]
Another member of this dev team has another free otome game available: https://sitraxis.itch.io/locked-heart

Compared to other visual novels on the market with cliche troped love interests and an unjustifiably ditzy MC, this game delivers a plot that explains and deals with the emotional struggles of the MC who can at least somewhat fend for herself. A lot of her actions feel mostly justified for her emotional state given her circumstances.

The added skip to next choice button is a nice add, but I feel like I lost immersion and some enjoyment of second playthroughs of a route by using it (I was too lazy to re-read though so reading the bad ends of each character first is a bad idea. Do not save the best ending for last unless it's Waltz's good ending.)

The cast is mostly likeable and the (at times humorous) interactions between the characters are entertaining and believable.  The love interests especially are almost all pleasing to me.  Except for [spoiler] Rumpel. His (at first funny, but later irritating) flirting didn't stop during the ending either. Also, screw him for using "ladies should be pure" logic that dissuaded the MC from killing Mythros before he killed Parfait... It makes sense though, since he's delusionally stupid. I felt good when he got what was coming during his bad end. [/spoiler] It would be most appropriate to play Waltz's route last, as his end has the most spoiler for other routes. 

The quality and the detail of the art are surprising for a free game... but the love interests aren't attractive. I genuinely thought this game was a yuri game for a time when I had seen the promotional art. Don't get me wrong, they look decently drawn, but a wider jawline and a little more body mass would've helped. Relievingly, the piano and other instruments used for the soundtrack fit the game's softer, ornate artstyle and I love the main menu theme. 

Overall, the quality of the story, art, music, and care given to the game make it worth your time regardless of price if you are a fan of otome games.

32687443.review:
I honestly can't believe this game is free. It was a pleasure to play and the art, writing, and gameplay are all done to a very high standard, so if you're wondering whether to check it out - do it! 

The character routes are all quite different from each other and took longer to complete than I was expecting; it's easy to see that a lot of effort has gone into every aspect of the game. The plot is well thought out and the love interests all have a distinctive design and personality - I especially liked the [spoiler]fairytale character twists.[/spoiler] I was also relieved to discover that they all lack that sort of overly rude or demeaning attitude that a lot of otome games seem to think manly men need in order to be attractive, and that their conflict came across clearly without resorting to blaming or insulting the protagonist. Sad that this seperates the game from many others in this day and age but there you go. If I had to put it into words, I'd say that the game as a whole was a very positive experience; you don't find yourself irritated or emotionally drained after playing - not too much anyway.

I found some of the character development particularly interesting, although (and I'm kind of nitpicking here) sometimes I felt it could have gone a bit deeper or focused on the dynamic of the relationship a little more. For example, sometimes it felt as if there was external conflict and then suddenly - they're in love! [spoiler]Karma's relationship was probably the only exception as he is the most conflicted about his feelings for the protagonist.[/spoiler] The plot is very politically dramatic, if that makes sense, and less so when it comes to the relationships. 

The art is very unique and beautiful, I especially love the eyes - they made the MC look fantastically cold and shrewd sometimes - I lived for her evil glare. On that note it was very fun seeing things from her perspective, she is one of the most interesting characters in the game. It would have been nice to see more recognition from the other characters regarding her [spoiler]childhood abuse and upbringing[/spoiler], as I think it's only briefly mentionned on the one route and I felt that really could have added to her developement or the ANGST. 

Overall though I made it through every route very easily and it was a joy to play - I can't wait to see what Dicesuki does next.

32673050.review: Absolutely wonderful! I adored the writing and the characters (what a great plot!) and every single route felt satisfying and engaging in different ways. I was reduced to tears at several points, which I was NOT expecting, but damn, the music and the dialogue really tug at your heartstrings sometimes! Plus the romances were SO cute. I really really recommend this game!

32666058.review:
I absolutely adored this visual novel. I believe it is amazingly well written and programmed that I am honestly astonished that it is free. There are many small details that I did not know one could incorporate into Ren'Py such as the partner selection screen. This smaller yet significant details add to the overall polished look of the game. The story of the game and the character development of the protagonist is astonishing. All the characters were well developed that I actually found myself crying over the deaths of some. I would 100% reccomend this game. 
This game is an absolute inspiration.

32653053.review:
[i]*залазит на табуреточку* Прошу прощения за отсутствие статистики. На данный момент Cтим почему-то упорно не верит, что я запускала игру, и отказывается показывать прогресс корректно. Но я честно-честно играла, и возможно, запущу еще пару раз, чтобы игре не было так одиноко. *спрыгивает с табуреточки*[/i]

Перво-наперво хочется сказать, что авторы этой новеллы молодцы, потому что визуально данное отоме выглядит скорее как крупноватый и розовощекий студийный проект, чем небольшая работа от независимых разработчиков. Даже сразу и не скажешь, что это движок RenPy с его несколько грубоватым обычно интерфейсом. И кусочки витражей, кусочки витражей everywhere, отдельная обнимашка за них авторам.

Даже если вас не заинтересует сюжет (а он тут очень наивный и детский, к примеру, в несколько похожем по изложению событий отоме The Second Reproduction куда больше драмы и печальки), все равно будет приятно полистать страницы новеллы.

ЗЫ. Также после данной бесплатной новеллы, наблюдается небольшой эффект маленькой драмы и чувства бомбалейо, если вспомнить, какую отомешную жизньболь на стиме можно встретить за деньги

32650086.review:
> เกมฟรี คุณภาพราคา 200-400<

เป็นเกมหนึ่งที่ไม่น่าเชื่อว่าเป็นเกมฟรี ระดับคุณภาพเรียกได้ว่าดีซะกว่า Visual novel ราคา 200+ หลายๆเกมส์
เนื้อเรื่องเราว่าเก๋ไก๋ใช้ได้ ความยาวของเกมส์เอาแบบเคลียร์ทุกรูท(แบบไม่สคิปtext) น่าจะถึง 15-20 ชม. ถือว่ายาวพอสมควร 
หรืออยากจะเก็บแอคชีฟเม้นท์ก็ง่ายมาก เพราะสคิปtextได้ตั้งแต่เริ่ม เก็บ full achievement จริงๆคงไม่ถึงครึ่งชม.

> ทำไมควรเล่น <

- ฟรี
- ภาพสวยกว่าเกมเสียตังหลายๆเกม ซาวด์ก็โอเค
- เนื้อเรื่องน่าสนใจ ขอบอกว่าเป็นเกมเน้นพล็อตมากกว่าไล่จีบผู้ชาย(แต่ผชก็เด็ด) เหมือนอ่านหนังสือนิยายดีๆเรื่องหนึ่งเลย แต่ละรูทจะมีข้อมูลใหม่ๆด้วย ทำให้ไม่เบื่อที่ต้องเล่นซ้ำทั้งที่รู้พล็อตโดยรวมหมดแล้วจากการเล่นรอบแรก คือเล่นรอบสอง/สาม/สี่ก็ยังมีลุ้น
- ตัวละครประกอบมีตื้นลึกหนาบาง มีความลับให้ค้นหา ไม่แบนราบ (จนอยากได้ฉากจบ Yuri)
- ทำเราร้องไห้ได้ ; __ ; (เกมฟรีทำน้ำตาล่วงเผาะๆ อาย 55+)
- (อันนี้ส่วนตัว) ปมของตัวเอกทำได้ดี เชื่อว่าหลายๆคนตอนเริ่มคงเกลียดนาง รู้สึกขัดๆหน่อยที่ต้องสวมบทเป็นลูเซ็ตต์ เพราะนิสัยแบบว่า "ใจดำ ขี้อิจฉา เชิ่ดหยิ่ง" มาแนวพี่สาวของนางซิน มากกว่าซินเดอเรลล่าซะเอง แต่เล่นไป.. ปมนางน่าเห็นใจนะ เราจะค่อยๆได้เห็นแฟลชแบล็คชีวิตวัยเด็กนางผ่านความฝัน
- พัฒนาการตัวเอกจาก "นางมารร้าย" ไปเป็น "นางเอก" ไม่ปุ๊ปปั๊ปข้ามคืนจนรู้สึกขัดใจ // ความสัมพันธ์กับหนุ่มๆในรูทก็เหมือนกัน ค่อยเป็นค่อยไป

> อื่นๆ <

- ในคาแรคเตอร์หนุ่มๆทั้งหมด มีลูกชังที่บทน้อยกว่าใครเพื่อนอยู่คนหนึ่ง ถ้าตกหลุมรักไปแล้ว ก็ซวยหน่อย ...โชคดีนะ 
- นอกจากหนุ่มๆที่เห็นแล้ว มีตัวละครลับอีกตัวที่มาแรงแซงทางโค้งคว้าหัวใจหลายๆคนไว้ แต่มิอาจจบแบบ Good End ด้วยได้ทำเอาหัวใจหลายๆคนสลาย ระวังจะเป็นหนึ่งในนั้น
- ในบรรดาหนุ่มๆมีอยู่หนึ่งคนที่ Good End ไม่ Good สมใจใครหลายๆคน
- เล่นเป็นคนเลวไม่ได้ (; __ ; อยากเป็น Dark Queen อะไรเงี้ยยย)
- สตอรี่ดี อาร์ตสวย แต่เรื่องเกมเพลย์ ถ้าไม่ใช่เกมฟรีก็คงต้องขอติว่า ช้อยส์น้อย ไม่มี impact กับเนื้อเรื่อง (ยกเว้นพาไป Bad/Good End)

32632488.review:
Kudos to the developers and designers, and everyone involved with the making of this game!

Top three things I loved of this game:

1. [b]The main character[/b]. It is quite refreshing to have a tsundere-kind of protagonist. I'm quite tired of the clichéd, crybaby, useless heroines.

2. [b]The characters and illustrations[/b]. Simply gorgeous! I really enjoyed each and every one of them. 

3. [b]The stories[/b]. I love that you, guys, kept the "reality" and "cruelty" of the original fairytales in the bad endings. People - specially new generations - tend to believe in 'Happily Ever Afters' from Disney's movies... but we - the old school - grew reading fariytales and realized not all of them had one. I enjoyed those fairytales the most - not because I'm cruel or sadist, but because I do believe "goodness" cannot always win; and because life, luck, and love not always smile upon good people. Anyway, I'm not gonna say anything more or I'll probably spoil things for those that haven't played.

The rest of this is ranting... no need to stick around. =)

** Thank you for not using the clichéd naïve, stupid, good-for-nothing heroine. It is quite refreshing to have a tsundere-kind of protagonist. Unlike the crybaby heroines I have seen in many otome and dating games, this Princess has the guts and the drive to try to fight her way out of her predicament... and fall in love along the way.

Now, for those that read my review (and played the game)... you may say that the girl is just as useless as the clichéd heroines - but at least she has the background to prove why she may not know how to do the simplest things. In other dating games (otome games) the girl usually lives alone and has to look for herself - I mean, anyone living like that should be self-suficient (and maybe proficient) for certain kind of things -, and yet those heroines cannot even boil water without setting the kitchen on fire (I wonder how they even lived as far as they did).

Ranting about other things, this is the list from "My most favorite" to "my least favorite" suitor: Waltz, Fritz, Rod, Karma, and Rumpel. Of course, since I couldn't play Walts and Fritz at the beginning, I played: Rod, Karma, and Rumpel.

Anyway, I hope to see more otome games like this in the future and keep up the good job! (Also, for the players: Enjoy!)

32620569.review:
Wow, just wow! Somebody recommended this game to me, and I was initially skeptical of how good it could be because it was free, but this is on the same level as some of the pricier visual novel games I've played before!
First, I adore the visuals. Such beautiful backgrounds and characters!
Second, the soundtrack is gorgeous! Music often makes or breaks games for me and I would happily play the sountrack in the background while doing things other than playing this game.
Third, I really enjoy the plot. I don't want to give much away but the player character is one of the best I've ever played. I think there is excellent characterisation and development as the game progresses. 
Plenty endings to find, and I very much appreciate the little indicator which lets you know if you made the right choice.
All around a fantastic game which I would have happily paid at least $25 for! If you enjoy romantic visual novel games you need to download this ASAP; it's free so you have practically nothing to lose!

32551555.review:
Recomiendo encarecidamente este juego. 
Para empezar, parte de una base muy interesante que es la reinterpretación de los cuentos de hadas clásicos. Por ello, si conocemos los cuentos originales (no sólo la versión tibia de Disney) podemos ir teorizando sobre qué va a pasar con cada personaje según vamos jugando.
Además, cada ruta está bien planteada y es interesante. La historia de cada chico está bien construida y al final todos tienen algo que hace que les cojas cariño. 
La extensión del juego me parece adecuada. Echo de menos un par de capítulos más por ruta, al final se hace corto, pero es mejor una historia breve pero bonita y bien cerrada que una que se alarga ad infinitum y termina resultando pesada. 
El dibujo es bueno para lo que suelen ser los otomes, y la música es maravillosa y pegadiza. ¡Llevo días tarareando el opening! 
Y lo mejor de todo es que es gratis. Es muy raro encontrar otomes de esta calidad que sean gratuitos. Es más, he jugado otros muy inferiores por los que he tenido que pagar. 

Extensión: 7/10
Dibujo: 7/10
Música: 9/10
Historia: 9/10
Personajes: 9/10

Nota global (basada en la sensación final que deja el juego): 9/10

32547006.review:
I'd like to recommend this game mainly because of the amount of work that was put into it. I have to admit that the quality is pretty high for a free game, so it was worth giving it a shot.

LOVE:
- Lovely graphics and backgroud music. i have to admit that the bg music was so relaxing that I listened it often at work.
- The story is pretty cool.
- I loved the evolution of the main character and the way her past unfolded while progressing in the game.
- I really like how different each character was from each other.

HATE:
- The intro music. It seriously bothered me for the long words, absence of rhythm and the out of tune singing.
- The introduction is too long.. it often made me bored and I stopped playing the game often. If I neednt' to kill time on a flight, I would have never given more than a chance to still play the game.
- Otome games are mainly about experiencing a love story with one of the characters in the game, right? Well, it takes ages to arrive at that point. And it takes so much time to understand who exactly you can date in the game.
- Too little choiches, most of the game was about reading. As a player, I felt often useless.
- Some endings felt too plain and (sadly) left me with a "meh" kind of feeling.

I'm really looking forward for more games from DiceSuki, and hope that there will be titles with some voice acting in the future! I find that it adds so much more interaction with the characters :))

32540721.review:
This game is pretty much everything I wish in an otome.
It has a main character that isn't necessarily an action girl, but still far from the helpless blank-slate maidens you'd normally see in this genre. Lucette is a breath of fresh air in the midst of boring otome heroines with little to no personality or personal goals.
It has a GREAT supporting cast, which consists of several lovely ladies that have huge roles in the story. Not something you'd normally see in many third-rate otomes, which mainly consists of hot guys and one faceless shell of a heroine.
Each love interest has a different storyline, and thanks to the protagonist having a backstory and personality, each of them has at least one thing the protagonist can relate to.

The artwork is beautiful. All the love interests are incredibly attractive. My only complaint is that some of the proportions seem off, but the coloring pretty much covers that.
The music is also delightful and well-suited to the story. The PV song is also quite pleasant and even managed to get stuck in my head for quite some time.

This is really high quality free stuff. I can't recommend it enough.

32494823.review:
This is my first visual novel that I've read on Steam at the least and I'm happy to say that this was fantastic. You may find this odd, but this will be coming from a guy (I'm assuming the Visual Novel is targeting girls so I just felt the need to point this out).

Story: I'm a fantasy man. I've read the first two books in A Song of Ice and Fire so far and I'm currently reading The Wheel of Time series. I enjoy a good fantasy story. When I saw that this story was set in a secondary world with a twist on traditional fairy tales, I had to see the novel for myself. I don't know if this helps anyone but if you like the Kingdom Hearts series and how they play Disney Princesses and old fairy tales, and a little bit of romance in genreral, you'd like this.

Characters: 

Let's start with the Main Character (I'll be calling her Lucette but the game allows you to name her whatever you want). Some may find her personality in the beginning of the novel annoying or irritating but it serves an obvious purpose since it stems from her past and how she was raised. She is a layered character with flaws and a somewhat dark past. I really enjoyed how the novel developed her. She's rather confident and vocal--a nice change of pace from what I usually recieve which are boring, tasteless, one-dimensional MCs who I honestly do not care for. For once, the MC isn't completely incompetent. I cared for Lucette and wanted to see this character go through this trial that she has to undertake. Also, her character design is absolutely gorgeous, and the novel does well to show her emotions and expressions.

Now, I've only played through Rumpel's route in the story, so I really am in no position to critique the other love interest's personalities, but from what interactions I've seen in my first playthrough, they've peaked my interest enough that I want to play through their route, except for Rod, and not because I don't like him or his character, but I saw the step-brother as something more platonic than romantic (That's just me). As stated previously, I've finished Rumpel's route, both good and bad ending, and I enjoyed it very much. I am curious to see the other gents!

Music -- The soundtrack did well to emphasize a moment in the story whenever it was appropriate. The Main Theme is very enjoyable as well!

Art -- The art style is different from what I'm used to but this wasn't bad in this case. I very much liked the art style, both the design of its characters and the background art too. The only criticism I have is when a character zooms in on the screen, they do look a little blurry and perhaps needs some adjusting. Now this is just me, but I would have liked to have seen some differences or variation in the five main love interests' design. Don't get me wrong, I'm all for pretty boys (I am a seme after all) but having some more 'masculine' or 'macho' looking gentlemen wouldn't have been a bad thing. This is probably my own criticism of Anime-style art and not just this Visual Novel specifically. Other than that, the visuals are beautiful.

Other Criticisms: This might be a major negative for some people, but this Visual Novel does not have voice acting in it. I found it to be no bother personally even though I've grown accustomed to hearing voiced characters. Though I would have liked to seen some voice acting in this, it's still great without it. I don't know any specifics, and I'm assuming, but since this is a free Visual Novel and the developers and creators aren't recieving money from a purchase, I can understand why they'd want to go without voice actors.


This was definitely the most enjoyable Visual Novel I've read in a long time. I hope to read more from these developers and creators!

If you want a quick answer from this review, here it is: give it a read and enjoy!

32492851.review:
Cinderella Phenomenon Mini review (No spoil)

เนื้อเรื่อง
กาลครั้งหนึ่งนานมาแล้ว ณ อาณาจักรอันแสนไกลโพ้น มีคริสตัล อยู่สองชิ้น ชิ้นแรก เป็นคริสตัล ลูซิส(แสงสว่าง) มีผู้ถือครองโดยผู้ปกครองของเหล่าภูติ
และ คริสตัล เทเนบรารัม (ความมืด) มีผู้ถือครองโดยผู้นำระดับสูงของเหล่าแม่มด คริสตัลลูซิสดำรงอยู่ได้ ด้วยความรัก ความสุข ความเบิกบาน ในขณะที่คริสตัล เทเนบารัม ดำรงอยู่ ด้วย ความโกรธ ความกลัวและความเกลียดชัง
ทั้งภูติและแม่มดต่างอยู่ด้วยกันอย่างสงบสุขไปด้วยกันในอาณาจักรของมนุษย์ และควบคุมพลังของคริสตัลทั้งสองให้อยู่ในสมดุลระหว่างแสงสว่างและความมืด 
อาณาจักรนั้นสงบสุขเรื่อยมา จนกระทั้งได้มีนักกวีคนหนึ่ง ได้แต่งเรื่องเล่าขึ้นมา เป็นเรื่องราวเกี่ยวกับตำนานของเวทย์มนตร์และเรื่องราวนั้นก็กระจายออกไปทั่วอาณาจักร นักกวีได้ตั้งชื่อเรื่องเล่านั้นว่า "เทพนิยาย"
ในเทพนิยาย "แสงสว่าง"มันจะเป็นผู้ชนะเสมอ เรื่องราวของเทพนิยายได้แพร่กระจายออกไปไวเกินกว่าที่คาดเอาไว้ มนุษย์ในอาณาจักรต่างเชื่อสนิทใจว่า เรื่องตำนานเทพนิยายนั้นเป็นเรื่องจริงและ เวทมนตร์ของแม่มดนั้น เป็นสิ่งชั่วร้าย มนุษย์เริ่มกลัวและเกลียดแม่มด
ในที่สุด แม่มดก็ถูกล่าเหมือนสัตว์ป่า จนเกิด"การล่าแม่มด" เกิดขึ้นมา ผู้นำระดับสูงของแม่มด โกรธมา จึงสร้างคำสาปเทพนิยายขึ้นมา เหล่าแม่มดใช้คำสาปเทพนิยายโจมตีมนุษย์และสร้างความวุ่นวายแก่อาณาจักรเป็นอย่างมาก ผู้ปกครองของเหล่าภูติ พยายามทำให้ความสงบสุขกลับมา
แต่เหล่าแม่มด ถูกความเกลียดชังเหล่ามนุษย์เข้าครองงำจนไม่สนใจอีกฝ่ายอีกต่อไปแล้ว จนสุดท้ายจะเกิดสงครามครั้งใหญ่ขึ้นมาและ ผลลัพย์คือ เหล่าแม่มดเป็นฝ่ายพ่ายแพ้ คริสตัล เทเนบราลัมหายไป แต่ถึงแม้ฝ่ายแม่มดจะพ่ายแพ้ไป แต่คำสาปเทพนิยาย นั้นบยังคงดำเนินต่อไป

4 ปีหลังจากสงครามครั้งใหญ่ มกุฎราชกุมารี ลูเซ็ท แห่งอาณาจักร แองเจล ผู้แสนจะเย็นชา จนได้รับฉายาว่า ราชีนีน้ำแข็ง ยังคงใช้ชีวิตในพระราชวังอย่างแสนลำบาก อันเนื่องมาจากนิสัยของลูเซ็ทที่แสนจะเย็นชาและไม่เป็นมิตรกับใครทั้งนั้น และแล้ว
โชคชะตา ก็ทำให้ชีวิตของลูเซ็ท เปลี่ยนจากหน้ามือและหลังมือ เมื่อลูเซ็ทถูกคำสาปเทพนิยายจากแม่มดคนหนึ่ง ทำให้ตัวลูเซ็ทกลายเป็นเพียงคนธรรมดาคนหนึ่ง ไม่ใช่เจ้าหญิงอีกต่อไป 

และคำสาปเทพนิยายที่ ลูเซ็ท โดนคือ "ซินเดอเรลล่า" และเรื่องราวของลูเซ็ท(ที่ไม่ใช่ มกุฎราชกุมารีอีกต่อไป ) ก็ได้เริ่มต้นขึ้น

ณ ปัจจุบัน ยังเล่นไม่จบ พึ่งขึ้นรูทแรก จะขอ Review เท่าที่เห็นล่ะกัน 

Cinderella Phenomenon เป็น Visual Novel สาย Otome ที่นำเรื่องราวจากเทพนิยายมาใช้ในเรื่อง และใส่เรื่องราวของคำสาป แม่มด ภูติ คริสตัล มนุษย์ ครบสูตรของตำนานเทพนิยายกันเลยทีเดียว ซึ่งก็ทำออกมาได้ดีด้วย
โดยเฉพาะคำสาปเทพนิยาย ทำออกมาได้น่าสนใจมาก ในส่วนการดำเนินเรื่อง ดำเนินเรื่องไปได้พอดีๆ ไม่ช้าเกินไป ไม่เร็วเกินไป สามารถทำความเข้าใจเลยในการเล่นรอบเดียว ส่วนตัวละครทำออกมาได้ดีเลย แต่โดยส่วนตัวไม่ค่อยชอบนางเอกนะ นางแบบว่าแทบจะไม่เป็นมิตรกับใครเลยจริงๆ แถมยังเย็นชาตัวละครตัวอื่นๆกันหมด ซะจนอยากให้นางได้รับบทเรียนอะไรสักอย่าง (ซึ่งตอนนี้นางคงโดนไปแล้วเรียบร้อย)
ด้าน ภาพ Spirte ตัวละครทำออกได้สวยมาก ดนตรีเข้ากับฉากแต่ละฉากได้เป็นอย่างดีเลยเดียว 

สรุป เป็น Visual novel สาย Otome ที่คุ้มค่าแก่การเล่นมาก 

Score 10/10

ป.ล ชอบฉาก เมนูที่เป็นคริสตัลคู่กับสัญลักษณ์เทพนิยายนะ มันสวยมาก จะมีใครเดาได้ไหมเอ่ยว่า สัญลักษณ์แต่ละอันนั้นมาจากเทพนิยายเรื่องอะไรกันบ้าง

32419730.review:
I love this Game! Ive gone through all the routes and I adore every one.  I highly recomend doing the character stories in the recomended order that is shown.  The background story builds onto itself if you do it in that order and as you go threough the characters so will slowly get more and more of the entire storyline. Waltz and Fritz are locked for a reason! They have the most story/background stuf and I highly suggest playing the three already unlock charcters first then Fritz's storyline then Waltz very last, believe me you will be glad you did. Im so glad I took a chance on this game and decided to dowlaod it.  I loved it so much I will most likely go through all my favorite routes again and again. I also intend to go through and get any/ all acheviments and gallery photos I might have missed as well. I cant wait too see other Otome VN stories from you guys <3 Thank you for this amazing game!

Character routes in order of my greatest to least favorite:

#1 Waltz
#2 Karma
#3 Fritz 
#4 Rod
#5 Rumple




SPOILERS BELOW!



Rods route:
I loved it. Rod is a doll and so sweet when you break the cold exterior he towards the M.C.. I love how it adresses that fact that they are step siblings. I picked up quickly on twist with how Rods curse would be broken and I loved the simple and sweet ending it had. My only complaint was that It seemed so much shorter then the other story lines for some reason and I wish that there had been just a little more affection between the two with how sweet Rod became. 

Karama's route: 
This Route was one of my favorites! I completely and utterly adore Klaude! This storyline made me laugh so much. I loved Klaudes fairytale curse it was also one of my favorites. Though he is a little vain he always said it in a joking manner that made me smile almost the entire story line. I figured out his curse pretty early in the game and when things started leaning that way I guessed instantly about the other side to it. Though I didnt know the spacifics the details of his curse were amazing.  I loved the heartfelt scene when his curse was broken it almost made me cry.  The only thing I would of liked to see was the story line continued just a little further to include the M.C. going with him to meet his family, Klaude asking the king for her had and a royal wedding would have been the best thing in the word for this line. The joining of the two kindoms <3 


Rumple's route:
This was my least favorite route. Rumple's personality just grated on my nerves a bit too much to the point where i was almost always rolling my eyes. Though there was slightly more closer at the end of this route then the previous two I didnt think it deserved it. 32379765.review:
This game simply blew me out of the water.  It was my first otome/visual novel of any kind.  I thought at first, that I enjoyed it so much simply because I didn't know any better.  So, FOR SIENCE!, I downloaded five other free games of the same type.  Let me just say that Cinderella Phenomenon blew each and every other game out of the water.  Now, I haven't played any of the upper tier, costly games of the same genre, so I cannot say how Cinderella stacks up against them, but as far as the free games go, Cinderella sits at the top.

What makes it better than other free games?

-The dialogue is always decent.  It isn't superb, but it never, ever made me want to fork my eyes out.

-The art is lovely and consistent.  I enjoyed each character's art, all of the backgrounds and all of the special scenes.

- The music is great.  Yes, tracks are repeated, but -none- of the tracks are annoying or ugly.

- Each bachelor presents a different take on the main story.  No two are the same once you have comitted to a love interest.  In fact, unlike most free games, the unfolding of the story via the bachelors makes you -want- to replay the game.  You learn something new about the world, the past, and the MC herself with each play through.  Nothing is repeated save for the beginning.

- My favorite thing:  The Main Character herself.  She's flawed and sometimes terrible.  But she's REAL.  She grows and changes, but stays recognizeably the same character.  I never once found myself saying, "Right... she would never actually do that."  

- The romances don't seem forced.  They grow and seem natural, with ups and downs.

I can't possibly imagine what this company might produce with the proper funding.

EDIT:  I have now played quite a few otome games, even a few costly ones!  And wow... Cinderella still holds a special place!  My absolute favorite thing is the MC.  She is never stupid, shy, stuttery or a doormat.  As opposed to 90% of every other otome lead female.

32293024.review:
Quite honestly, when getting into this game I didn’t have high hopes for it, since many of the free VNs I have encountered in the past, were disappointing, to say the least. Nonetheless, seeing how positive the games rating was and that it was indeed free (thus I wouldn’t be losing anything),  I thought I might as well check it out...I was not disappointed. 
 
Pros: 
+ The MC actually has a personality, which is not common among VNs and Otome games, where the MC is often a creature with no backbone or personality to speak of. Even if Lucette didn’t have the most ‘pleasing’ of personalities, I think it added to the charm. 
+ The story is actually interesting and there aren't much event overlaps between the individual character routes; even if they do follow a similar base (which is to be expected) each of them feels different thanks to the characters involved. 
+ Characters actually have *gasp* backgrounds and development through the routes, their actions (even if I personally wouldn’t agree with many) feel like they are true to them and don’t feel forced onto the story just for movement sake. 
+ Art in the game is lovely, the designs for each (main/named) character is memorable and clearly thought out, the art itself is clean and the environment designs are detailed. The CGs in the game are also well used, covering the majority of the important events. 
+ The music is fitting and doesn’t feel distracting or bothersome in the long run. 
+ The game is Free, really, just trying it won’t hurt you. 
 
Cons:
- As much as I love the story, I can’t help but feel that it lacks the freedom of choice in many instances. In order to obtain the good ending, you can’t afford to make even one bad choice. Which in itself isn’t something I frown upon, the issue with it on this particular game is that the difference between the right and wrong choice is a few lines of dialogue at most, that are not ever reflected upon again, therefore it feels odd and even bothersome to have to follow a set path of choices till the end.
- This is a completely biased point,[spoiler] but I feel like the bad endings were cut short and could have been carried out better/be a bit longer. Essentially the difference between the good and the bad was just one chapter and a dead character, which didn’t feel right and I would have loved to see Lucette’s actions after the death of her partner...especially in the case of Fritz's route, where I feel that it had a lot of potential that wasn’t used fully; in the good and bad.[/spoiler]
- [spoiler] Verg and Mythos are routes that I feel would have made sense in the form of ‘bad’ routes for Fritz and Waltz respectively. Additionally, it felt that Lucette being evil and actually joining her mother, in the end, would have been a lovely bad end.[/spoiler]   
- This game stole my free time, I ended up forfeiting my adult responsibilities and even sleep...you have been warned.

32234201.review:
Stunning game! Well made, more save slots than you'll ever need, and the character art and BG art are absolutely beautiful.  The game also had a rich storyline and characters who all felt like people you would want to get to know in real life. 

I particularly loved how the MC (Lucette) was a very flawed character. Often, otome games throw you into the action with little knowledge of who the character we are playing is and consequently, the MC tends to feel a little lacklustre sometimes. But this game spends a few chapters building on the characterisation and plot, so you really get to know the MC's personality, relationships, motivations and values before deciding on a route to pursue. I was also genuinely impressed by how the believably the game portrayed the MC and and her love interest help each other become better people.

Although we're only halfway through 2017, this is easily one of the best VNs you'll play this year. There is something for everyone whether you love fairytale tropes, angst, princely characters, action or are just looking for something new to the genre. 

Very much recommend it (and in the reccomended play order for maximum plot enjoyment: Rod > Karma > Rumpel > Fritz > Waltz)!

32218703.review:
So far after playing the first story, this is a solid Visual Novel story. The story is pretty interesting with fun side characters and music. The curses are actually a lot of fun comedically and for real meaningful moments. I like fairytales in general so having them become curses rather than having someone just plopped into the story is much more intriguing.

I also like the option of having to skip the tutorial and even to each of the prolouge choices that you have to make, if you've already had a run of the game previously. It helps especially when the prolouge is as long as it is which isn't a bad thing because it develops each of the characters' personalities. There's also a nice little tid bit at the end of each completeled Happy Ending which makes you feel acomplished everytime to come to the menu.

I think some of the things that could be improved on the game would be more music scores, fitting slapping/punching sound effects, character involvement and possibly more poses for specific events. There are moments in the game where there are long sincere speeches but instead of the music stopping for dramatic effect rather than having the same song loop for the time you're still reading the speech. There are also times when certain events where a character will hit another character and the game tries to replicate that feeling with the characters moving but it doesn't translate before there's only two hand/body positions. There's a section in one of the charcters does physical violence and the impact sounds like a grasshopper hitting a feather. 

There are so many different and interesting characters but since the story might not necessarily need them for a different story, they seem to lackluster when you have such intriguing backstories. It'd be nice to see them involved in a little more epic stuff other than the final battle. I'm not even suggesting the options for your love interest either, I'm talking about the side characters, like the main Witch Delora or the main Fairy Parfait (who's name still makes me hungry.) Both are intriguing characters that I wish would be more involved in your character's development other than as a guide in the beginning.

But overall for a game that's free to play, had so many backers, so much time, effort into the story, writing and programming? I'd give this one a solid 8.5, it still has some wiggle room but I really did enjoy every bit of this game.

*SPOILERS!!!!*
During the Karma ending, I was a little disappointed with the generic design of the beast. It would've been fun to design him as some kind of red rose thorn like creature. It didn't distract from the story at all just a little less than was expected.

32212388.review:
(The playtime is not accurate; frequently I left the game running to do other things.)

Dicesuki went above and beyond to deliver an amazing free product! I wish I could recommend it wholeheartedly, but my otherwise enjoyable experience was dampened by some glaring moral qualms (see Weaknesses).

Strengths

+Lucette is a complex protagonist who goes through compelling character growth [spoiler]and who, despite being conceived through r a p e, is loved by the victim[/spoiler]
+good story-telling that well presents and integrates romances, side character relationships, and overarching plot
+professional quality art and opening, detailed backgrounds
+challenging choices: [spoiler]e.g., the "be nice" options are not always the right ones[/spoiler]
+no adult content or tasteless costume designs

Weaknesses

-ethical reservations: 
some relationships follow the entertainment industry trend of "crossing a moral line but hey could be worse"
[list]
    [*]player can pursue Waltz, who looks like a child, though no explicit romance occurs until after he recovers his adult body
    [*]player can choose incest (Rod), though the sibling relationship is not by blood
    [*]scenes where the guy suddenly invades Lucette's personal space (e.g. surprise kiss) or she invades his privacy seem to be presented as appealing
    [*]at least a couple of the guys are 5+ years older than the almost 18-year-old protagonist
[/list]
-gameplay: 
Good endings allow only 2 wrong choices, and bad endings make sense only with a number of certain wrong choices, not any 3+ out of the 25. The VN's above strengths made this forgivable, but those who care more about gameplay should know that the bad ending is pretty much guaranteed without the right choice indicator.

Suggestions

[list]
    [*]I hope Dicesuki is open to future VNs that aren't exclusively otome. I would have loved to play friendship routes with some of the memorable side characters. Rod's route could've easily also been a great platonic one.
    [*]Again, not something I really minded, especially for a free game, but either the good endings should've been a little easier to achieve or there should've also been normal/neutral endings.
    [*]Personally, I would have preferred a locked route having [spoiler]provided a way to defeat Hildyr without killing her, leaving hope for her redemption, probably Fritz's, where Lucette expresses that hope and spends a long time with her.[/spoiler]
    [*]To new players: Dicesuki's recommended playing order follows plot revelations, but Fritz's route felt more like a climactic finish.
[/list]

32203162.review:
I wasn't expecting anything from this otome: how is it possible to find a true masterpiece in a free-play game? 

Ohhhh... I was so wrong and I am actually happy that Dicesuki made me reevaluate it. 

Ciinderella Phenomenon is one of the few otome game, that give us a badass and smart MC that doesn't acts as a doormat for the hot boys, indeed Lucette is bright, honest and knows what she wants, without following blindly others.
In this game the romance is built through genuine care between the MC and the chosen guy. Everything follows is logic from the curse to the very end, I have never felt that something was put forcibly just to make the couple fall in love or worse to end the game faster. 
I loved each route and how each characters as a well written backstory and how it is connected with their curse.

The CG are cute, but some characters were drawn with pointed angle for their facial features. 

Loved the music and definitely the button "Fast Forward" to go right to the next choice. In many otomes you  have the forward button, but you have to watch all the scenes until you reach the next point. 

I didn't write about the story, but trust you will fall in love with this game and for the first time in your life you would gladly have a curse to have the opportunity to join The Marchen and the hot boys.

32202838.review:
[h1][b]Начну с того, что ЭТА ИГРА БЕСПЛАТНАЯ. 
Ещё раз. Игра, за которую лично я рублей 500 запросто бы заплатила, вообще бесплатная. 
И она очень, очень классная![/b][/h1]
(Как вы уже поняли, ниже будет восторженный отзыв). 

Я уже писала о том, какие Otome игры считаю интересными. Сочетание завязки, общего сюжета, раскрытие главной героини и миленьких персонажей с «романтическим интересом». Если это есть, а ещё если в игре приятные звуки и хорошие картинки, игра вполне удаётся. 

[h1]В [b]Cinderella Phenomenon[/b] есть всё, что я люблю, а ещё много того, что игрушку делает вовсе замечательной. Тут не игра, тут сладкий вкусный пирожочек! [/h1]

Во-первых, у нас есть [b]Главная Героиня с Отлично Прописанным Характером[/b]. Это такая редкость для хороших и больших Otome! В начале наша героиня немного мороженная, и знаете, что? Это обусловлено сюжетом! Не просто так, не просто чтобы «игроки могли подставить себя на место героя», а именно что обусловлено. И героиня имеет развитие! Игра строится именно на этом «развитии». Это очень-очень здорово. 

У главной героини есть наставница (даже целых три!). Главные персонажи в игре женщины, в том числе и главная антагонистка. Они все с предысторией, характерами, хорошо прописанные и очень ощутимо влияющие на сюжет. 

В игре пять сладеньких [b]мальчиков-персонажей[/b]. Все очень милые, у каждого интересный характер и любопытное развитие. Каждого мужского персонажа игра раскрывает в процессе прохождения, при этом делается это довольно аккуратно, равномерно и при этом очень увлекательно.

Меня приятно поразило, что бесплатная игра имеет такой отличный набор полноценных и очень разных [b]роутов[/b], каждый со своим сюжетом и персонажем-мальчиком. При этом каждый роут раскрывает общий сюжет со своей стороны и без повторяющихся моментов. Весь сюжет сказочный и имеет много знакомых нам с детства моментов из любимых историй, слегка вывернутых на радость игроков.
Самые «полные» роуты тоже раскрываются не сразу, а только когда мы пройдём два из первоначально доступных, в лучших традициях лучших Otome-игр.

Мне понравились [b]арты[/b] персонажей  (даже не смотря на то, что подбородками героев можно резать арбузы С: ) и фоны. [b]Музыка[/b] милая и приятная, отлично передаёт момент, когда это нужно по сюжету. 
 
[b]Текст[/b] довольно лёгкий, в историю легко вникнуть. Тем, кто вообще не знает английского языка, будет сложновато из-за отсутствия локализации. Тем, кто английский язык понимает хотя бы даже неуверенно, игра может стать отличной практикой. 

[b]Cinderella Phenomenon[/b] захватывающая и крайне занимательная игрушка. Читать её было приятно примерно на уровне любимых лёгких фэнтези-новелл. Ещё раз замечу, что за игру такого хорошего уровня вполне можно просить деньгу. 

[h1][b]Однозначно рекомендую игру. Она обязательно понравится любителям жанра, а так же способна заинтересовать мимокрокодилов отличной завязкой и грамотно прописанным сюжетом.[/b] [/h1]

32156246.review:
[h1][b]Review: Cinderella Phenomenon - Otome/Visual Novel[/b][/h1]
Eigentlich bin kein Fan vom Visual Novel Genre, weil zu viele Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten bei denen die Antworten zu ähnlich klingen und keine Tendenzen ersichtlich sind schlichtweg aufreiben können. Auch sind aufgeblähte Novels bei denen dann für die alternativen Stories haufenweise geskipped werden muss ätzend. Es muss einen Mittelweg geben und interessanterweise scheint Cinderella Phenomenon genau diesen Grad zu erfüllen.

Persönlich habe ich einfach es mal aus Neugier probiert. Ich stellte fest das es einige Wörter in der Story gibt, bei denen ich auch mal nachschlagen musste - beim Gamen was lernen, das Argument hätte vielleicht meinen Englischlehrer überzeugt mich im Unterricht zocken zu lassen. "A: SIE ZOCKEN IM UNTERRICHT! Isch: Ne det is pädagogisch wertvolles Bildungsmaterial Herr Professor!" *haha* :D

Gut zurück zum Review. Die Zeichnungen sind von professioneller Natur und passen sehr gut zum Stil des Hintergrundes. Auch sind sämtliche Funktionen zum Speichern, Autoplay, Geschwindigkeitsregler und Skip-Funktion und sogar ein Indikator für die richtige Entscheidung vorhanden. Die Storyline ist wohl mehr auf das weibliche Publikum gerichtet, was aber nicht schlimm ist oder so - mag man eben oder nicht, wobei keine zwischenmenschliche Beziehungen homosexueller Natur vorkommen (sofern das für jemanden relevant ist). :-)

Wenn euch das Review gefallen hat, lasst es mich mit einem Daumen nach oben wissen, danke!

32150695.review:

I particularly love the heroine. She makes me laugh, and she makes my heart ache. She is as far from the traditional blank otome character as you could imagine. I found myself desperately wanting her to be happy, whichever route she took. (So far, I've only completed Karma.)

I look forward to ny future releases by Dicesuki, and will buy them in a heartbeat.

32115256.review: So i don't normally write reviews for anything but i have fallen head over heels for this game, I have played a lot of otome games before but this one has far surpassed any of the ones i have played, Of course it might be due to the fact that this is the first otome game i have played on the computer i normally play the mobile ones :P But any way let me get back on track, So the first thing that struck me about this game it the fact that it dosen't take a ridiculously long time to complete a play through, You finish one in a day or so, Witch i really like most of the otome game i have played in the past that are free take me weeks even moths to finish one play through, The other thing i like about this game is the soundtrack i am actually listening to it right now as i write this review :D I also like the character development, It's really amazing I think they pulled it off fantastically, I'm not really good at writing reveiws since i never write them so i don't what else to say about this game but i definitely recommend this to anyone out there who is looking for a good otome game to play, I'm definitely going to show this to my friends :)

32114018.review:
I typically avoid writing reviews unless a product gives me a truly good reason to do so. Cinderella Phenomenon has given me plenty to say. I have only read three visual novels and honestly was deeply disappointed in the previous two so I did not hold a lot of hope for this one. Add to that Cinderella Phenomenon was free made me even more skeptical however I was bored so I decided to give it a try. Frankly, it is an experience that deserves to be paid for. Although the concept at first seemed simple and would lack depth it quickly taught me how wrong I was. The character development is fantastic. The storyline morphs and becomes more complex and enjoyable as you continue through the various paths. Every character has their own "voice" if you will, making certain that you will never confuse any of them. They are well defined and interesting. The main character I despised at first but she quickly grew on me and by the end I absolutely adored her. She is not a meek litte mouse or a faceless no one that you care nothing for. In fact, you learn to care about everyone a great deal and the story ensures to bring on the feels. If you are looking for an active game then keep looking as this will not suit your tastes. However, if you are an avid reader and want a good story then I highly suggest picking this up. I do not believe you will be dissapointed. 

Note: The creators of this novel suggest going through the paths starting with Rod, then Karma, Rumpel, Fritz and ending with Waltz. There is a very good reason for this suggestion. I do not want to spoil anything but trying it in this order will give you the best experience in my opinion.

The game itself is beautiful, and outside of the odd typo, has more polish than a lot of VNs with a pricetag. Even if visual novels aren't your thing, give this game a try. It was a wonderful story, good characterization, stunning visuals, and a beautiful soundtrack. <3

32105497.review:
Just finished my first route, so I feel comfortable reviewing this. I'll be playing the others in a bit!

I've played my fair share of otome games, both commercial and free, and this one is one of the best ones I have played in a very long time. I'd happily have paid for it. Granted, I'm only one route in, but still: the art is beautifully done, there are several CGs to unlock, and the characters are all really well written. Even the protagonist. She's not very likeable at the start (which is sort of the point, since the story covers her character growth), but she is strong willed and has a personality I can relate to in some ways. I like all of the love interests, albiet some more than others, but I'm sure that I'll enjoy them all. The story is good, and it's quite well done.

As some others  have pointed out, there are a few things that could have been improved on, such as the lack of a female love interest or the lack of diversity in the characters (they are all rather pale), but that didn't detract from my experience much because all of the characters are all charming. Some of the animation isn't as smooth as I feel that it can be, like the shock (although that one didn't bother me as much) or the broom, but those are very minor complaints on my end.

This is turning out to be one of my favorite otome games, commercial or otherwise. I highly recommend it.

10/10 

The story is so interesting that I had to play this game alone so that I can do the voices for the characters, which by the way are so rich in background and personality.

The story is detailed and (at the beginning) unpredictable. When I first played the game I was so shocked to a certain revelation that I was staring at the screen for a complete minute shouting this word: what!?

Background and artwork is INCREDIBLE AND DAZZLING. Couple of typos in the dialouge but YOU WON'T CARE BECAUSE THE STORY JUST KEEPS YOU GLUED TO THE SCREEN. AND YOU WON'T EVEN REALIZE THAT YOU'RE PRESSING YOUR SPACEBAR OR MOUSE BUTTON AS YOU READ THE TEXT BECAUSE IT'S JUST... *SIGH*.

You get the point...

As you progress with the story, you'll get to feel more and more attached to our main character and that's awesome. Nothing beats a game wherein you feel as if you were the one in there looking at your lover's eyes and saying amazing dialouge whilst accomapnied by the serene music.

Oh, the music, man. The freaking background music is a STRONG FACTOR on why I recommend this game. LISTEN FOR YOURSELF, I SAY!

And finally the concept for this story is GOLD. As an aspiring writer, I am amazed at these creative minds for making such a heavenly treasure of a story. 

10/10 once more. 10 OUT OF GOLDEN 10.

Oh and the intro will give you last song syndrome. Beware!

"Cinderella, why don't you stay with me tonight?"

This is [b] absolutely [/b] one of my favorite otomes now and one of the best [strike] free [/strike] otomes I've played. It's a simple, straightforward otome, but it has an interesting story and characters. 

If this wasn't a free otome I'd say "buy it immediately without hesitation". But since it is free, I can just say "download it. There's nothing to lose except experiencing this interesting story."

The main character is strong and independant. She does a lot more than just ssort of sitting around like a dead fish until it's almost the end of the game and she has to have her "big moment of character development/acomplishment". 

Speaking of character development, the main character's development as well as that of other characters was clear throught the whole game. All the characters were interesting and had more than one side to them. 

I found that the other character's lives still went on even if you weren't in their route. They would still solve their own problems, but slower without your help. It's very small, but something it gave a more realistic feel to the story and I felt this aspect was something different from other otomes I'd played and wanted to point it out.

This game is amazing. Absolutely play it

32010730.review:
Why is this game free?

+Great Story- I especially enjoyed it because it was relatable, coming-of-age tale. 
+Great Characters- Each romantic interest is based on a Fairy Tale, my particular favourite is Waltz (he's hot!). All the characters have their own distinctive personalities and issues. 
+Character Development! - This is so important in VNs, and Lucette's development in each route was fantastic! [spoiler] There should've been a route where Lucette returns to her mother and rules alongside her! If she didn't complete any good deeds e.t.c[/spoiler]
+Music- The music fitted each scene, from romanctic, to sad, to silly! 
+Art- They had cutscenes, CGS of cute/memorable moments, and nice, clean character sprites! Some of the proportions were off, and when the characters were zoomed in they were a bit blurry, but overall it was pretty good. 

Cinderella Phenomenon is a great Visual Novel/Otome that's worthy to spend at least 15 hours on (estimated 30 hour completion time). That is, if you like Fairy Tale based stories!

31964598.review:
This would be an awesome game even if you had to pay money for it. The fact that it's free blows my mind. It's perhaps even a disservice to the game, as many people will assume that you get what you pay for. This game is so much more. The writing, story construction and characterisation easily rival games I've bought for $20 or more.

My favorite bits:
. The main character is not a bland & boring milquetoast or a pure-as-snow waif who bravely endures her traumatic past. She has a traumatic past. And it's made her the nastiest piece of work this side of a Grim fairytale. Cinderella? Riiiight, she'd give the evil step-sisters a run for their money. But her characterisation makes perfect sense, and her starting point gives her huge possibilities for growth and a character arc.

. Though sometimes random, it seems to me many of the choices are not "choose what will please your romance option" to get the good reaction, it's "choose what makes sense for the main character to say at this juncture" even if it's rude, or cruel, or aggressive. Which is a lot more satisfying and logical. Also, often more fun :)

. Characterisation for both heroes and most of the villains is well thought out and detailed. There are no black-and-white characters here, just people who make mistakes. The difference is that the good guys try to fix things, the bad guys double down.

. Once you get past the prologue and chapter 1 (and a good adaptive save system means you don't need to redo those, or you can skip them easily), each story is very different. You do NOT feel like you're reading the same book 5 times with slight variations. Each of the 5 paths concentrate on one or two other side characters to allow them to develop further. You really do have to play all the paths to get the full flavor of the story. More to the point, you'll really want to. 

My only quibbles is that some of the choices really do seem a bit random. Also, they do not impact the story. This is not a story where your choices will influence the end game in any significant way. There are a few key choices, usually near the end and easily reversed if you've saved, that will shunt you into a Bad Ending, but other than that, most of them are for flavor or to underline how the main character has evolved.  This is not really a quibble, since that's just the kind of game it is, but it's good to be aware of.

31962885.review:

31962554.review:
Don't be fooled by the price. This is an incredibly well-made game. I played the routes as recommended by Dicesuki and boy was I impressed. I absolutely love how the world is fleshed out more between each playthrough, so it's definitely worth it to play in order (Although I'm guilty of skipping Rumple because I didn't have enough time). If you love fairy tales, play this now.

Overall, the writing was exquisite. I loved the pacing considering the length, but this is definitely a game you'll need to set some time aside for. This isn't some quickie otome. I can tell a lot of passion went into it. The music was also beautiful. I could listen to it for hours. And the CGs? God...Some of the best I've seen on a free game. Waltz definitely has my favorite gallery set of CGs...

Here are some brief reviews on the routes. I'll try not to spoil

[b]Rod[/b]: Rod's route was first for me. I was actually pleased with how the story handled the step-siblings trope. It didn't come off too heavy handed and I kinda enjoyed Lucette and Rod gradually learning to tolerate each other. Still, I didn't feel invested in their relationship that much. Rod's route is better suited for getting a feel for game as well as the setting and understanding the fairy tale curses. Good introductory route. 

[b]Karma[/b]: I was surprised at how much I liked him. Usually I'm not a fan of the "vain" type of characters, but Karma came off mysterious and humorous enough for me to stay invested in his story. I'm glad I did, because his route is actually where I started to tear up in certain moments. I was more emotionally invested in Karma than Rod, but still not "sold" as my number one route. It was nice to see Lucette more involved and show more initiative in this route, though. 

[b]Rumple[/b]: yeah...skipped him for now. I'll do his soon...sorry

[b]Fritz[/b]: ....Why you do dis, Dicesuki? In all seriousness, if you want to cry ugly tears, play this route. In all the previous routes, Fritz goes "missing". You'll finally be able to find out what happened and how your loyal knight is involved in the plot. This one is by far the most heart-wrenching, but still utterly sweet. Both Fritz's and Waltz's route were beautifully written, but if I had to compare them...this one wins in feeling empathetic with a character. I feel like the further down we go, the more emotional I get. Fritz's route sheds a ton more light on the world of Angielle, as well as the other side-characters in the game. Prepare the tissues, folks. [spoiler]I desperately wish Varg had a happy ending, but I understand from a writer's standpoint why it had to end the way it did.[/spoiler]

[b]Waltz[/b]: Although Dicesuki remains silent on their FAQ page, I consider this the "canon" route. Where to begin...I fell in love with Waltz way before I got to his route, and when I finally got there...I don't think I can go back. Waltz's story is incredibly endearing, but I'm struggling on how to describe it without spoiling. I think Lucette shows the most character development in this route and I found myself eagerly cheering her on through my tears lol. Definitely my favorite route despite my inability to write much about it. It simply has to be experienced. 

I'm definitely buying the fandisc when it comes out <3

31894387.review:
Cinderella Phenomenom is one of those Visual Novels who ain't afraid to get "unusual characters" and bet on them.
The main character is not someone most of us would relate at first, and if we would, I don't think we would be proud of, but still, the way the game guides you through makes it pretty enjoyable and not only that, but pretty optmist.
Obviously, it is mostly heartbreaking, not only did the Bad Endings drove me to tears, but some of the Good Endings had me crying just as much, but I may be just too jelly-hearted.

The game offers you five different guys to guide you through your gameplay (and I'll list them in the order suggested by Dicesuki on the Steam store page, just to keep it fresh on your mind):

Rod, who is the not-so-friendly son of the new women of your father. Nope, you guys are not blood related, and you guys have know each other for barely three years or so, if I remember corectly.
Karma, who is an incredibly beautiful red-haired man who dresses like a woman for unknown reasons (but he looks better than you doing it).
Rumple, who doesn't even know his name, but apparently can't keep his d*ck inside his pants and got to complemment every girl he sees.
Fritz, your loyal knight, best man, right arm, always by your side even when your not in your best mood and he isn't being himself.
Waltz, who seems to get you better then yourself and he just looks amazing doing it, I mean, c'mon, just look at him. He is a magician, how sexy is that?

But, jokes aside, the storylines really complement one another and it really is worth playing all of them to really get a hold on the story, not only to get the achivements. I really reccomend it.

31814266.review:
Twisted, in a good way. I believe this game has twisted fairytales to another level. Going through all the routes and discovering every bit of the plot was fun and captivating to the point that i could consider it real in a way. It's free to dream after all, so why not have a tiny bit of hope that magic is indeed, or have been at one time, real.

Good replay value for me. Each route held its own set of secrets. I started out just rooting for the characters i preferred but in the end, i played them all due to pure curiousity. There's a sense of joy in unraveling the mysteries. Wanting to know just how a certain fairytale was twisted into a curse fit for a character's life and how they're supposed to change from it. What lesson they're supposed to be taught. 

The game also shows that in looking through different perspectives, you can end up with a different impression or opinion. Something that may seem bad, isn't really. Something done out of kindness, might not be. I had this urge to look deeper into the backstory. Hence, ended up looking through every route i could from good and bad endings to right and wrong choices. I like how some wrong choices don't always end at a bad ending. There seems to only be major choices that require a right one to trigger the good ending.

Graphics: 
Lovely. The art is well-drawn and the colors are easy on the eyes.

Music:
The soundtrack really syncs with the flow of the story. I like the song at the opening.

Cinematics:
The opening video is fun to watch. I don't seem to tire of watching it every time i start the game to play.

Story:
Rich, satisfying and urges you to look into it deeper and at different perspectives. 

Controls:
Easy point and click. The usual for majority of VNs. The fast forward to the next choice button tends to get buggy time to time but when you choose to ignore the bug message, you can easily continue with your play. I use the skip previously read dialogue instead cause the bug somewhat annoys me a bit.

31814175.review: That fact that this otome is FREE astonishes me! I absolutely love the story line and the artwork is beyond gorgeous. If they decided to make a second game that's purchasable, sign me the fck up.

31813094.review:
Hermoso juego con una trama muy bien desarrollada, destaco la profundidad de los personajes, no solo los principales sino también los secundarios. El apartado visual también, uno de los mas detallados y prolijos que he visto. Algo que quiero destacar es la personalidad de la protagonista. No es la típica prota inocente y despistada. Cada ruta se desarrolla de una manera particular y aporta mas información acerca de la trama central y la vida de la Princesa. La música también muy bonita y variada. I really enjoyed playing through this game. The art is lovely for the most part, though perhaps a little generic in some areas. Playing through each storyline presents a different story each time, aside from the intro. I was very pleasantly surprised by this being a free game and the amount of detail put into each storyline and character. I highly recommend a play through and I'll probably even donate to the creator's to support more of their games in the future.



*Possible spoilers past this point*

There are five routes to take each with a good and bad ending, of course, I always get the bad ending the first time through. I had a problem with two of the storylines, Rod, and Rumpel. Rod because he is the main character's step-brother, and Rumpel because he is simply repulsive.

There are other characters that could have been romantic interests so there was no reason to have that kind of relationship with Rod. I don't understand why it had to be romantic, the main character treated her step family horribly it easily could have been a route about finding peace with things you have no control over, and healing past wrongs. Which is the essence of the game anyway. Garlan could have made a good alternative.

The storyline with Rumpel was my least favorite, he was such an ingenuine character that I couldn't even empathize or care about him at all. I was literally just clicking through to get the different endings.

31770928.review:
Typical fan-art style of the characters, with their heads looking a bit detached from their bodies. Most of the graphics looks like it's done as a Flash animation, or at least done using some cheap vector graphics software. Interestingly enough, the female characters looked more well-made than the male characters, which is interesting because you're playing a female falling in love with a random male character, that's right, this is a reverse-harem bishounen game.

The premise of the plot is actually quite interesting. You've got humans, witches, and fairies. You've got magic, sword fighting, and household chores. And each plotline is actually unique, which is not common for visual novels.

No sexual content, not even any nudity. At the most, a kiss here and there.

Horrible music. After about 4hrs you will want to turn it off.

I actually can't believe that this game is free. Like, seriously, there are commercial games out there with way worse... well, everything. The graphics in this one are very nice, the sprites and CGs are actually really well-drawn and the animations, when there are some, are really good. The story may seem a little cliché at times, but that's to be expected given that it's inspired by traditional fairy tales - and even then, it manages to give them an original twist, which is hard to do these days. As for the characters, I quite like most of them, though some can really get annoying at times; the only real complaint I can think of is how it's hard to root for the protagonist when she's an incredible b*tch at the beginning, and even that is refreshing to see. It's a nice change of pace to find an otome protagonist you're actually supposed to hate (at first).

The only flaw that strikes me as serious is that the endings feel a little bit rushed, but given the overall quality of the game, I'm more than willing to forgive that! As far as otomes go, this is a very good one; perhaps not the best, but it's *very* good, and free to boot. Go give it a shot.

31696943.review:
Do not let 'free' colour your perceptions of how good a game this can be. While Steam is a sea of shoddy free to play games, this is one of the ones that floats above the rest.

Each character has their own personality, with each route featuring unique scenarios while following key plot points - each of which can and do change depending upon which route you choose. This makes each route interesting in its own right, despite the overarching goal being the same. The game does not shy away from being hard on characters. Background characters have their own stories, and even some 'faceless' characters have reasonable personality and worth here. Not everyone adores the Princess, and it's easy to see why from the start. She has a personality that is deeper than what's on the surface, but is believeably unlikeable for honest and realistic reasons.

Change is not instant. It's gradual and commented upon. She never starts out with the goal of falling in love, rather the emotion develops naturally over the course of the characters' time spent with one another. Two-dimensional it is not, which is quite a lot to say compared to many games that cost money.

The writing is good. Solid, in my opinion and I feel didn't ever feel particularly awkward. The choice of music is excellent and often fit the moods of the scenes. Just as a free game can be good, the choices made from royalty-free music was also very well done.

The game's artwork is beautiful, though some of the CGs suffered from some awkward and sometimes stiff poses. The sprites themselves were top-notch and the colours were all wonderful.

I enjoyed much of the story and many of the routes - both good and bad. I preferred some over others, and even while I admit to not liking one or two of the stories, that isn't to say that they were poorly-done. They simply didn't appeal to me. Overall, however, I really enjoyed every one in some form or other, at least in part. 

All in all this is one of the games I shove at people who are looking to try out an otome VN on their own. It's a solid play and very enjoyable.
