Coming from someone who usually dislikes VNs (mainly the plotlines are all blah) I absolutely fell in love with the game and all the characters. 

TL;DR just go play the free game I promise you will not regret it.

Music: 10/10.  I usually mute background noise, but the tinkling of the soundtrack is just lovely to listen to and really amps up the mood without being irritating. There isn't much voice acting, but none of it made me feel uncomfortable like other VNs.

Plot: 1000/10.  There's character building.  So much character building, and so many lines, but NONE of the lines were uselessly there.  Every line either adds to character, plot, humor, romance, or hints at other storylines / the premise.  Take my word for it.


Characters: 9/10.  Each character is loveable in their own way.  Even the ones I initally found annoying later grew on me, and in fact the one I hated most may have the most depressing bad end. Knocking off a point here purely so I don't give everything a 10/10.

MC: 9/10.  Usually the MC is super blank or annoying, but the MC is well, an ice princess.  She's true to her character, grows believably, but isn't annoying in her characterization.  Knocking off a point for her being difficult sometimes.

31672779.review:
I don't even know where to start. My cousin drags me into these things as a joke, and she's so damned cute I can't say no, and I end up sighing over my wasted hours as she maniacally giggles at my over-the-top sarcastic wishing some of the characters would just DIE already...

And then there is this game, which is as comprehensively designed as Hakuoki in terms of story. I only mention Hakuoki because it's basically the only "good" otome that's well-known here. In fact, it's a bit better, in my opinion, since you don't have to trudge through four chapters of common route every time you want to get a new story. What the hell? I'm sorry Kenjiiro Tsuda but your sexy voice is the only thing that is missing from this game. 

This visual novel features [b]romance that happens [i]because[/i] of the story[/b], NOT [b]story that happens because of the romance.[/b]

And that, my friends, is what sells it for me. Well that and the lack of quirky fan-fic writing styles that are rampant in indie games. I didn't have to lynch my inner English hypocrite in order to enjoy it, nor did I have to suffer extensive truncated sentences and redundant word choices that basically kicked me in the teeth until I was too concussed to be bothered by them anymore. Yeah. 

The music is awesome too! I never tired of it.

Download this. Give me another one Dicesuki. I am a new fan(?) which is terrible, because I was forced to eat my pride and admit I had no major issues with this. Ok enough with the backhanded complements, I get it already. I'm just shocked that I was forced to compliment it with any handed direction...

31669497.review:
Would I recommend this game? In a heartbeat.

I was skeptical about this game initially because it was free to play, but the saying "Don't judge a book by it's cover" definitely rings true with this game. I honestly didn't know what to expect at the beginning, but I quickly became enraptured with the storyline, but this was mostly due to the characters in the game. What I'm probably most thrilled with is the main character's development, really well done there. I've partnered with almost all of the characters in the game, and I'm amazed each time at how different the story plays out for each character path. The endings are completely different for each person you choose to be with, and that's what makes each playthrough exciting and leaves me wanting more. Each potential mate has their own unique personalities and has a little bit of something for everyone, depending on your taste. I would suggest playing through each character, as each story reveals more about the lore of the world and the characters in it (Fritz' and Waltz' stories REALLY dig deep, you will not be disappointed).

Overall, this game has replay value for me because I will want to experience the stories again and the characters within them. (Plus there's a handy-dandy fast-forward button to fly through the boring parts if you've already played through the scene once before.)

Favorite partners in descending order (so far): Waltz > Karma > Fritz > Rod > Rumple

31669182.review:
Для бесплатной эта игра просто отличная. Хотя бы тем, что её прохождение займёт гораздо больше часа, заставляя вас проникнуться этой игрой целиком и полностью. 
Что мне в ней понравилось, так это возможность пройти несколько историй с разными героями (хотя я не очень поняла логику хорошей/плохой концовки). Приятная рисовка, ненавязчивая и не надоедливая музыка, а также довольно интересно обыгранные сказки, нестандартная и совсем не типичная "милашка"-героиня, страдающая излишней добротой - всё это составляет эту игру, делая её одной из лучших среди пройденных мной новелл. Что-то в ней затягивает, заставляя проходить снова и снова, чтобы посмотреть под разными углами на отношения героини с парнями.
Особо глубоких познаний в английском игра не требует, поэтому отсутствия русского интерфейса бояться не стоит. Если вы любите сказки и нестандартных героинь, то вам скорее всего понравится эта игра. Лично я от неё в восторге.

31660600.review:
So I'm not the type to post review's on game's ever. I just had to do it on this one had to. This game is so good im shocked I didn't pay for it! There were of course as in all games some con's but all games have some sort of con's, and most of the cons are really just more my Personal option then problems with the game. So take my review with a grain of salt.

Pro's:
First off the Picture's in the game were Beautiful! I loved them and it was obvious alot of effort went into this game just by the picture's alone. I loved when the face's started to appear after you Finished a guy's route it was really a nice touch! of course there were some picture's that were more Lackluster then other's but I can accept that as not every picture can come out perfect!

The Music was very nice and I liked listening to them they fit very well with the story! The intro's a little eh but even it grew on me after a while.

The routes. I bravo you for actually changing the plot for every route rather then using the same route for every character and just changing some scenes like some paid games I know *cough cough* Animal Lover *Cough cough* . But as with saying that one of the plot's Just felt Ehh to me In Fritz route and ill get to that in a minute but all in all the story was very Griping!  

The main character, I must say you did an amazing job on her! I grew from hating the main character to falling in love with her and wanting her to succeed! And which is funny because i actually expected to hate her. She's not super weak (Which is actually what I pefer in an otome game believe it or not) but she's not super strong either. She's a character I could actually relate to and understand where she was coming from as the game progressed. She wasn't as dramatic as i expected her to be and not as mean either. (Though i didn't play the bad routes..) 

 Now Let's review the con's and to be honest I only have one
[spoiler]  WARNING SPOILERS AHEAD: [/spoiler]

Fritz route.

Now as I said before some of them were amazingly done (My favorite was Karma) however I will explain why i think Fritz route was really completly lack luster.

Oh lord where do I begin? First off I'd like to say there were barely ANY scenes with Fritz. Most of them were with Varg, and we got a couple of sweet scenes with Fritz in the begining but then that's it, he's basically gone after that and dosen't come back FOR A WHILE. So no character development should come in at that time right?  So You would assume romance dosen't either correct?!  Well for some odd and unexplainable reason the Main character is STILL falling for Fritz even when he is not in the picture. We see more of Varg then we see of Fritz in the whole damn game and whats more when we DID get a scene with Varg it wasn't even a nice or good scene but towards the end I STILL wanted to root for Varg  at least he had better charater development then Fritz did. Friz was a Goody two shoe's the whole damn time. Nothing was wrong with him at least with Varg you saw him CHANGING for the main character but no the main character only cares about Fritz. "Where's Fritz," "Give him back to me." Girl What has Fritz done to earn your love?! Yeah Fritz didn't want to kill you but towards the end Varg didn't either!!! The "Happy" ending with Fritz didn't really feel happy at all to me it just felt very lackluster and I really wish you had done something else with it, like I dont know Make Varg a secert charater you can pursue and with the power of magic gets his own personailty I dont care Just give Varg the happy ending HE DESERVES.What i'm saying is Fritz had it good from the start besides Hildyr he had no obstacles, No personality besides wanting to protect the main character and as the chapters neared the end I realized that's all Fritz was going to be and became extremely disapointed because I looked forward to playing him the most. Varg did more for the main character like try to change and try to overcome thing's like his master and treating her more gentle (HE STAYED WITH HER THE WHOLE DAMN WEEK WHEN SHE WAS SICK FOR CHRIST SAKE WHERE WAS FRITZ HMM HMM?!)  but she hates/Fears him!  Fritz dose practically nothing but, Avoid the Main character, Protect her only when in dire need, and come back because of dire need. and the main charater is hopelessly in love with him. The charcter should not have loved Fritz is the point im trying to make she really should have loved Varg if anyone and this route was really to me a real con of the whole game.

(Just don't expect to much from his route if your like me.) and honestly as disspointed as I was with Fritz I do like Varg so his route was completly awful. anyway thanks for reading and I hope you enjoy the game

31641675.review:
[h1] A musthave for every beginning and Veteran Otome player! AND ITS FREE!!![/h1]

I will definately say that I have enjoyed this Otome! Athough, I have goteen all the bad endings first (Some of which are so sad that I cried myself) I have thouroughly enjoyed the twists and turns of this storytelling of Fairytales that come into one place. And My heartstirngs have been pulled into so many directions that I couldn't help but love the entire cast!

I will give my top Favorite Romantic routes in order:

Karma: Flaymboyant? Yup. Slightly Narcisstic? Yeah, a bit of a flaw, Handsome beyond all compare? Definately. His rout and his Good Ending are definately something that I have come to enjoy. [spoiler]His Beauty and The Beast Curse was definately intriging, and Given the fact that his route plays after my Favorite Fairytale, I couldn't help but go to him first of all. It was defimnately all worth it, but watch out for his bad ending, You will come to tears.[/spoiler] Otherwise, He is my favorite of all the boys. Oh, and being a long-haired redhead was a plus, and his crossdressing is something that I have to say make me laugh and giggle all the way through. 

Rumple: Oh gosh, his dramatic, over the top, and flirty attitude was something that I couldn't help but be annoyed by him. But Along with breaking his curse and going along his route, he became very endearing to me and showed me that he was very much more than just his flirty attidtude. Don't be too intimidated by his route, His route will grab and take you along for the ride. But if you want his good ending, here's a hint: [spoiler]Stay being the Ice Princess, and Rumple likes tsunderes, just throughint that out there for you if you are curious[/spoiler]

Rod: At first, being a bit conservitive in my veiws, I thought ar omance between siblings would be very much taboo, stepsiblings or no, I was a bit hesitant to try this route, BUT! I was plesently surprised of how the creators treated this kind of relationship. Due to his curse, that I will not mention because spoliers! BUT he is a very intreiging choice from the start. But thoughout his route, it was shown that due to the fact that they were not related by blood is possibly the only thing that saves this kind of relationship, taboo or no, I did enjoy this very very much. It was a bit bittersweet in his good ending, but i think that It was possibly the point. He still a cutie overall. 

Waltz and Fritz: I honestly believ that their routes were the longest I have played, which I didn't mind, but a bit too long for my tastes, but I still enjoyed their routes. They were wrapped in intrigue and passion, and amazing romantic tension in their routes, more so than the previous ones, but I have to admit that They also stole my heart as well. Their curses were practically and amazing twist of their fairytales and I enjoyed the twists and turns of how they turned out. But Beware! Their Bad endings are just as heartbreaking as the Others, but will strike you in the heart and pull you apart. Both have their looks and their wits, and I enjoyed their CG pics and I will still enjoy them. 

[b]Overall[/b]: I would definately say this is for very much the young woman and girl who want their fairytale romance with a twist. [strike] And the occasional male who wants to be romanced by hot men, I don't blame them![/strike] It is great for those who are starting out as beginners in looking for visual novels and other such otomes. The achievments are tricky to get and you have to really figure out if you made the right choice or not. Otherwise, just keep trying until you figure out which ones are correct. :)

I really have enjoyed this game and will keep playing it to have the experiance all over again, and I hope that you guys have a chance to play it too. It may not be for everyone, but I think thatfor a free game like Cinderella Phenomanon, I'd say you have a damn good deal on this game. 

Happy Playing!

31613293.review:
The Otome genre is one of those genres that is very tedious to work with. You could find a true masterpiece, a diamond in the rough, or a glorified choose your own adventure textwall. Cinderella Phenomenon is somewhere between the second and third. The ideas behind it, of a world brought into suffering by Grimms Fairytales via a curse that affects them in the way of the fairytale, is very clever. The characters are also very promising, with a temperous princess, a mute prince, a amnesiac playboy, and so on and so forth. 

Problem is, this game can't be bothered to do anything with that. 

To start, this game hates you. Remember that. You are the bad person. Cinderella Phenomenon has this very odd, repeated habit of establishing its protagonist as 'like, the worst ever, you guys' yet in the end I felt more sorry for her than anyone else in the game. And there is no way to counter this. You either accept that you are 100% in the wrong and become a cloying sweetie who hugs her sister and dances in the woods, or bad end. Problem is that this takes away from player's ability to actually PLAY anything. You stop exploring a world and start saving at every question to ensure you get ALL of them right. It becomes less of an exploring experience and more like the game is yanking you from location to location. Now, this has been done right in other games -- just look to the Ace Attorney series if you want an example -- so why is it so bad here? 

Because the choice is so LIMITED. Because what you say ultimately ends up having no damn effect aside from if you get even one question wrong, the ending chapter is different. But everything else is exactly the same. You still go here, go there, and ultimately only small chunks of dialogue are added if you pick the 'right' answer. This game just grabs you by the collar and takes you along for the ride. Because make no mistake, you are NOT in charge here -- the game is. Instead of the player playing the game, the game is playing the player. And its just boring, stupid, and infuriating. What if I WANT to argue with this idiot who is inarguably treating me like crap? Well, you can't, because you'll get a bad end if you slip up as much as once. 

So positives are that this game has a great setting with a fun IDEA. But that's all it is: an idea. It's heavily dragged down by some of the most boring, annoying gameplay you'll ever find. You could go ahead and download this game, because its not like you're having to pay anything, or you could just save yourself the trouble and go read a book. It's practically the same experience anyways.

31611909.review: This is the virst visual novel I read since CUPID to capture my attention this much. I honestly cried so much, I loved it. I really am a sucker for fairytails and romance.

31609958.review:
Великолепная визуальная новелла. Долго обходила её стороной из-за отсутствия русского языка, но в конечном итоге взяв в руки телефон с гугл-переводчиком, принялась за прохождение. К слову, даже со знаниями языка ниже среднего, понять хотя бы о чем речь идет в диалоге вполне можно.
Прошла пока что четыре рута из пяти. Каждая история цепляет по-своему, каждый персонаж уникален и сам сюжет может удивить своими поворотами событий. 
Музыкальное сопровождение не успело надоесть за все мои часы прохождения, а сам OST меня очень и очень порадовал. Видно, что разработчики старались сделать все качественно. Удвительно, что эта новелла бесплатна, когда другие, явно хуже по всем параметрам, сдирают с тебя по 300 рублей, а то и больше.
Новелла стоит Вашего внимания, однозначно.

This game is really cute. Otome games are usually sterotypical with the storylines but I really have enjoyed this game's storyline. I love the take on the Grimm Fairytales along with it's own unique backstory for the world. The visuals are great as well and the character designs are great.

The only downside is that the choices are not clear enough to know what is the "right" choice. I ended up playing my first runthrough and received the bad ending. Found a player's walkthrough and I really only seemed to miss a few key points. There are also not enough choices within the game. I think there could've been at least more multiple choices or at least more frequent choices in the game for a more interative feel. It feels more like a beautifully written interactive novel than a game.

I hope they create another one focusing on the heroine's own strengths and the storyline involving the Crystals. I feel that they have something unique and could be something even more than an otome game.

31577602.review:
I don't do reviews often, but man-- an otome of this quality and caliber NEEDS to be popularized.

This otome is unbeliablely amazing. Completely exceeded my expectations and better. This game's quality is tantamount to any Japanese made otome like Amnesia and OZMAFIA!!-- and dare I say, better? It's essentially like Mystic Messenger in that there's a deeper overarching story and secrets in the game are slowly revealed as you progress through each route and they all connect together. 

Pros:

+ Heroine's name can be changed
+ Heroine isn't some generic otome lead, she's a real person with real backstory
+ character development galore
+ 5 different routes (2 are locked for being plot heavy)
+ soundtrack so good I have a playlist on YouTube for this OST
+ fluff and cute scenes
+ lots of tragedy (I cried so much) regardless of good or bad ending

Con:

- Yes, just one con-- and it's the fact that it's pretty difficult to get a good ending. So it's not like you can "just be yourself" and choose what choices you would choose because chances are you likely got the bad ending. 

[b] TL;DR It's great. Play it. Cry. Be glad it's free and not $30. [/b]

31538539.review:
Oh gosh, I don't know where to start. This game is absolutely wonderful, [i] especially [/i] since it's 100% free. The story focuses on changing oneself for the better, and boy, they do one h*ll of an amazing job at it. The character development is so frickin' smooth and makes sense. It's not like one of those times where the protagonist (or any character really) suddenly has a drastic change of attitude (such as someone who is incredibly greedy suddenly becomes very generous because something happened due to their greed). This development is gradual and each major event has some sort of significance to the development of not only the plot, but the characters' personalities.

   The protagonist, Lucette (name can be changed), is very well written and conceptualized. Her backstory fits the entire setting and plot as a whole. Her personality is fits her character role and backstory seemlessly and is most definitely [i]not[/i] cliche whatsoever. She's spoiled, cold, blunt, logical, and is quite a cynic (for a very good reason, poor girl) for a very good reason. Although she may be very cruel, she is still to some degree relatable and true to real life. Her dark (no, not [i]that[/i] kind of dark) past fits together with her attitude and disposition like puzzle pieces. And to be honest, she's one of, if not the best female leads I've seen in video games and written fiction. [strike] she's also savage af lol [/strike]

   The love interests themselves also share the same relatability and realisticness, and also undergo the same character development [spoiler] Maybe except for Waltz? I don't remember seeing much development in his route it was mostly Lucette [/spoiler]. Their personalities, appearances and backstories are also very unique to each other.

   The actual plot is very interesting and engaging, and also has a [spoiler] f*ck [/spoiler] ton of plot twists and reveals. Don't be fooled by the title either. Yes, it involves fairy tales but no, not in the way you think.

  Out of the many otome games I've played (and I've played at [i] least [/i] 30 now), CInderella Phenomenon is one of the best so far.

TL:DR
 Best otome game ever, you should try it
  Pros
   - Amazing visuals
   - Amazing characters and character development
   - The character depth is so real
   - Unique plot and setting
   - ITS FREE

  Possible Cons
   - No female love interest (I don't this tbh)
   - Nothing else really, this game is amazing.

31513318.review:
Cinderella Phenomenon was definitely ones of those fairytale game that should not be judge by its cover, I knew dicesuki from previous work but I was rather relutant to play due to the fairytale theme "Cinderella" which didn't interest me as much. After beating the game, I can fully say that I'm glad I didn't brush this game off as another one of cliche meet romantic interest then happily ever after without character depth.

Minor highlights: 
-great details to theme (i.e. bad end screen is different each route)
-hidden cameo reference to previous game
-background art is visually stunning
-music and timing for the mood is great
-FOR FREE!

Main highlights:
1) One thing that took me by surprise is the main character is not your typical sweet girl or blank slate, initially not likable at all. she does not go through a sudden change of character easily throughout the story, the change is rather on the perspective, she keeps her character intact. Unlike some other otome games, where there is sudden massive shift in character's personality just because you are on a different route like its a different writter for the script.

2) Not just the main character, but the rest of the cast all have their own flaws and motives which are essentially explored in througout different routes. There isn't a fairytale perfect prince/romantic interest, and the imperfection really builds the character to be more believable. These imperfections are also not cut-paste stereotypes and sometimes diverge from fairytale. Thus, the few seconds of meeting the characters really don't give away how the romance will turn out or how they may react.  

3) Each route is interaction and focus theme is different so it never felt like you are redoing the same story. It's more finding more pieces of the puzzle to understand the world, how it works and the characters in the story.

4) Although the endings (good & bad) may not have been unique to many other otome games but it really fitted the world. I do enjoy how there is a short narritive to tie everything together once the game is complete that ties everything, It makes the player feel fulfilled rather than here is an acheivement unlock with say "congratualation"or "thanks for playing" picture exhibited in other games. The extra gesture is nice but I always find this emptiness or the lack of connection or meaning to the actual game. 


Minor criticism:
-by utilizing the mouse to interact with the menu screen, load screen was too similiar to the save screeen. So I often save over my saves when I wanted to load previous screen instead. Maybe a different colour background could help seperate the two easier.
-the romance in some routes may not be as furfilling as others due to the pace of events that happens in the game not allow enough time to give more character interaction. Also the emotional impact point may be stolen by other side characters (well developed ones) that the deep romanctic connection at the end lacked impact. This probably would be remedy in the upcoming fandisc.

I enjoyed playing Cinderella Phenomenon more than I thought I would. It definitely has one of the more memoriable main character leads in otome games I've played (on par with "Second Reproduction"'s Christina). Frankly every character in their is quite memorable in itself making the story more enjoyable. Dicesuki is definitely one of the visual novel group that I look forward to seeing more works from.(Although I maybe biased from "Locked Hearts" which I recommend for an enjoyable  short cute otome with teddy bears). Their dedication and attentiveness to the player and the love for their creations really shows! 

Please do check the game out =)

31507911.review:
This is my first otome game and to be honest I wasn't sure what I was going to expect. After playing mid way in my first round ( I chose Karma's route), I fell in love with the story line and I couldn't stop until I completed all the stories. It's not the typical game I would play but I am so glad I did. And it has a really good plot. I love how it delves into real situations of emotional abuse by someone close, not knowing what to do and learning how to overcome difficulties through opening up to the right people. The heroine, Lucette, is thrown into a life she cannot imagine which is a reverse Cinderella, riches to rags, after being cursed by a witch and has to overcome her situation by trusting people who are luckily kind  to help even though the rest of the town hates her for who she is. The story explains why the heroine is the way she is and why people misunderstood her.  In the end , she breaks her curse and lives happily ever after.
Each story line you choose covers the plot holes and I do recommend playing each character twice to understand the full story.  My favourite routes  would be Karma, Walltz, Rod, Fritz and Rumpel. Though Waltz 's story wins hands down. (lol) Each story is so touching, has adequate humour and enough sadness to make your tears fall like nothing. Every ending is different and I loved the Bad endings as much as the Good endings. The choices you make are limited but they play an important role for what happens next. 

Overall, it was an exciting game to play and I'm glad it was Free to play as well. Soundtrack is also amazing. Wished I could download it. You won't regret playing this game :) Looking forward to Dicesuki's next game <3

31503669.review:
I went into this game with few expectations. I was in for a pleasant surprise.

First, I usually cannot stomach otome VNs because the main characters are often too insipid for my taste. It's not about them being damsels in distress. It's that they always seem too eager to please, or they have such shining personalities that every passing pair of pants falls in love with them. 

The MC in this game is a delightfully poisonous antidote to that, at least at the start. One great contributing factor is that, unlike most otome VNs, the dialogue here is more... rewarding if the MC stays true to self. She doesn't need to pander, which keeps her behaviour consistent and believable, and the developing lovelines realistic.  

It also helps that the plot isn't didactic beyond reason. There's still the standard trope of good vs evil, but it's delivered through storylines that recognise moral greyness to some extent, more so on some routes than others. I can get why some reviewers commented on the skintone/morality thing, but I personally liked those morally grey characters more, heh.

The prose is descriptive without being purple, properly QCed, and the music and art are both lovely. Nice SFX, too.

I'll happily back these guys if they produce another game.

31500197.review:
While this is a free visual novel, it is excellent. I would have gladly paid money for it. 

Pros:

- The protagonist is quite different from the usual otome main character. She has a strong personality and she's strong-willed. She isn't a one-dimensional, boring character like so many otome VNs have. 

- The romantic options (5 men) aren't abusive or problematic. Several otome games feature men who take away the female protagonist's agency or treat her like a child. There are also certain otome games (which I'm not a fan of) that feature men who are r/a/p/e/y as f*ck (yes, Steam censors the word r/a/p/e). All of the men in this game treat the protagonist very well and don't interfere with her agency. 

- The game elicited many romantic feelings (butterflies), which is pretty important for me when I play otome games.

- The story is very interesting and well-written. 

- Every romance path is VERY different from each other. When you read one character's path, there is no skipping read text when you go to the next character (except for the common route). The paths to the good and bad endings of each character are similar, but the endings themselves are very different

- While the artwork can be slightly awkward a few times, overall, it's quite good. Beautiful illustrations of romantic scenes.

Cons:

- Lack of diversity. Only two of the romance options aren't pale as f*ck, but even then, they're not particularly dark-skinned. Just a shade darker. Everyone else in the ENTIRE game is pale as f*ck. And this time, no one can argue "Well, it's supposed to be Japan" because this story takes place in an entirely fictional world, so there isn't any excuse for lack of people of color.

- No female romance options. 

- A couple of typos; no big deal.

- There's an effect that's slightly annoying. The scene shakes around whenever there's a shocking response from someone with exclamation points. It isn't too big a deal, but I thought it was unnecessary.

Overall, this was a great otome VN and I highly recommend it to those who enjoy VNs.

31495117.review:
Cinderella Phenomenon es una sorpresa grata para todos aquellos amantes del romance y buenas historias de fantasía. Una excelente opción entre el mar de Otomes existentes, muchos de los cuales llegan a costar más de lo que valen.

Para comenzar, al ser un juego gratuito, se esperaría que la calidad de Cinderella Phenomenon sea baja, pero el juego es sólido, con un arte bonito, que a pesar de no ser perfecto es bastante único. Además de ello, la música es hermosa y emotiva, cautivadora desde el menú de inicio.

La duración del juego es bastante respetable (alrededor de 3 horas cada ruta) y los finales no son difíciles de conseguir, mientras que la historia está bien planteada: narrada de forma simple pero llena de misterios que se van develando a lo largo de las cinco rutas existentes. Todos los personajes principales me parecen bien estructurados, específicamente los prospectos amorosos, cada uno con un pasado y una historia interesante y un romance fluido, no forzado como en algunas otras novelas visuales.

Otro punto fuerte en este juego es la protagonista, a mi parecer una de las mejores protagonistas que he visto en novelas visuales. Es fuerte y tiene una personalidad que cambia para bien con el paso del juego, una chica inteligente con la que es fácil empatizar y tomarle cariño.

Al final de cuentas, Cinderella Phenomenon tiene sus pequeños detalles como cualquier juego, pero se pasan por alto con una historia tan original que involucra cuentos de hadas, unos personajes entrañables y una calidad tan alta en todos los aspectos, que es difícil de creer que es un juego gratuito.

Recomendaría el siguiente orden al momento de hacer las rutas, para revelar poco a poco los secretos en la historia: Karma - Rod - Rumpel - Fritz - Waltz.

Tal vez para algunos jugadores sea difícil entender el inglés, pero les aseguro que la narración simple de la historia hace fácil la comprensión del lenguaje. Seguramente se llevarán una gran sorpresa aquellos que le den una oportunidad al juego.

31479236.review:
This otome has a simple elegance to it--rather than playing with a myriad of dating sim mechanics, it aims to tell a story that unwinds with progressive depth as each characer path is explored. Its creative and refreshing twist on the fairytale genre is sure to inspire fanfiction galore, which will undoubtedly be further inspired by the personal charm of each romancable character of Cinderella Phenomenon (not to mention the protagonist herself, a graceful and straightforward protagonist that is absurdly refreshing for her genre). 

One look at the opening menu says  a lot about the colorful, detailed, and charming visuals throughout the game, whose story progression is helped along by an extremely user-friendly interface. Given the polished writing, gorgeous backgrounds, and smooth story progression, it's a surprise this game is free. With such a fun and heartwarming otome availible, why keep reading this when you could be downloading it and experiencing it for yourself?

31476707.review:
Jeu très interessant. 

J'aime énormément les visuals Novel et Cinderella Phenomenon se place parmis l'un de mes préféré. L'histoire et originale, reprendre les conte d'Andersen pour les revoirs sous forme de malediction "inversé" est une très bonne idée, les personnages sont attachant. Pour une fois le protagoniste n'es pas une jeune fille naïve, mais une princesse antipathique qui ne fait confiance à personne et surtout qui n'es pas gentille pour un sous. Je crois que c'est ce qui m'as plus, trop souvent le personnage que l'on incarne n'as pas vraiment de background interessant, ce qui le rend plat ou agaçant, mais là le fait d'avoir à jouer un personnage aussi "mauvais" m'as donné envie de savoir pourquoi il était comme ça, cela donne aussi de la consistance au personnage, bref j'ai beaucoup apprecié!
Les CG sont très joli et le graphisme générale magnifique. On vois que ce jeu à été très travaillé et bien bichonné, même les musiques du jeu son bien... Je mettrais peut être une petite réserve sur le générique, je trouve que l'opening est en dessous du niveau du reste du jeu, mais celma reste un avis personnel basé sur mes goût musicaux (donc pas très pbjectif).
Ce jeu est vraiment d'une grande qualité et il est gratuit! Je le conseil vraiment à toute les personnes qui aime les visual novel ainsi que les contes d'andersen.

31473286.review:
It is good, I enjoyed playing it, my first ending I refused to accept but it is a good story. I have issues with the main protagonist because she is shallow, I feel she could still have more depth behind her. Personally I still think Rumpel has more depth behind her than the protagonist. This is a big concern for me, granted if you go with the Rumpel Story (I havent tried the others yet) you find just as much behind her over time. I also feel the story after the second deed falls flat on it's face, and the ending almost felt like my decisions had no impact on the ending besides from the character I picked. So 

+Soundtrack
+Partners
+Side Characters

- Plot line could use work (plotholes, witches and fairies overcomplicated things including the ending)
- Main Protagonist is shallow
- Decisions felt non impactful / meaningless

All in all I give it a 7/10 it can use work, ironing out the story, adding more depth to the protagonist and giving more weight to your decisions, and one thing I ABSOLUTELY did not enjoy was being a damsel in distress, it only makes the user feel powerless which if you do right is great, but in most cases you should never do, at least in my opinion, since especially for this game, it made me feel like my decisions were even less impactful than before, and my golly were they non impactful, more decisions, let me impact the story loads more than what I was able to! less reading more acting! let me be in the shoes of the character, not just read through her eyes. Its good but can use loads more improvements especially since a story is so impactful on a game like this.

31463122.review:
Y yo que creía que se me habían acabado las recomendaciones de otomes... ¡PERO LO ENCONTRÉ!

Dibujo & Cg's: buenos, he pagado hasta 30€ por juegos que no le llegan a este ni a los créditos. Los personajes bien diseñados y fondos bonitos. Además es importante que así sea, porque los escenarios los estás viendo en todo momento. Muchos juegos tienden a pasarlos por alto, este no. Así que creo que el balance del apartado artístico es, cuanto menos, bueno. 

Interfaz: en la parte inferior  derecha, vemos a nuestra prota (en un tamaño considerable) cuando habla y sino aparece un lirio blanco estilo vidriera/rosetón. ¿Por qué menciono esto? Porque en algunos juegos, cuando la protagonista habla para sí misma o piensa, la pantalla se queda vacia, a veces con una interfaz donde el personaje es tan pequeñito que ni lo ves. Deja una mala sensación que suele ir a más cuando esos momentos son largos. Pues bien, aquí nos ahorramos pasar por ello. Otro punto positivo.

Historia: unas tres horas por ruta (o yo que me lo tomo con calma). La trama es muy buena. No es una estupidez de principio a fin, que de estas hay muchas. Poco a poco te vas dando cuenta de que las cosas no son lo que parecen, y de los pequeños matices. Mucho más profundo y bien estructurado que la mayoría de lo que me he encontrado hasta ahora.

Elecciones: aquí siempre me pierdo un poco porque hay diferentes modos de plantearlo. Por lo general hay dos respuestas posibles (una con la que suena una música y la otra con la que no), y creo que en general tienen bastante sentido el identificar cuál es. No creo que sea aventurado decir que sigue cierta coherencia, que si bien es lo deseable, no siempre se encuentra. No necesitas una guía para jugar si no te apetece seguir ninguna, no se trata de un rompecabezas donde o te dan la pista alguien que lo haya jugado, o tú no llegas a la respuesta. En este sentido está muy bien hecho.
Respecto a lo que podemos decidir y lo que no, aquí la gente siempre entra en discusiones sobre si es suficiente o el personaje queda plano. No me gusta entrar en esto si no es muy evidente. Las opciones son las que son, creo que están bastante bien cubiertas y no fuerza demasiado. No he sentido que estuviese jugando con un personaje principal que de no haber estado, todo habría sido más o menos igual. Cierto que al principio, quizás se hace un poco lento de empezar. Pero merece la pena insistir, es un buen juego.

¿A qué esperas? Por si la reseña no fuese lo suficiente clara sobre que es bueno, además es gratuito. Lo cual no entiendo, pero bien: dos veces bueno. Si no lo has jugado, no sé a qué esperas.

31450388.review:
I have to admit that I've played a lot of otomes with fairytale themes, but this one really shines. For a free game, I didn't expect much, but I'm on the third route so far and I'm very, very impressed. While each route is relatively short (for a quick reader), they're very detailed stories with very good storylines. Apart from the prologue, none have shared plots or scenes, so it's unique with each playthrough, the stories are interesting, well-written, and engrossing, and the characters are interesting, too. Each route is long enough that I can actually see the characters coming to care about one another/learn about themselves, it's not just a sudden "one day I'm in love with this person," which always feels hacked. The writers did a very good job of fitting each story to the fairytale from which it stems without making them obvious, and none feel too forced. The art is really good, too, and I love the character sprites.

15/10, would highly recommend. Will be interested in seeing more games from these guys!

31421409.review:
No estaba muy convencida de jugar un Otome gratuito porque en general, suelen ser muy decepcionantes, pero sin duda, eso no pasa con Cinderella Phenomenom.
Intuitivo gracias a la interfaz de RenPy donde puedes tener las imágenes favoritas de tu husbando junto a Lucette (MC), que son una maravilla.
Narrativamente está muy bien estructurado, cada personaje es sólido por si mismo y cuando te crees que lo sabes todo sobre él, te sorprende (a veces para bien, otras para que tu patata se parta en dos Dx). Cada historia por separado es maravillosa, y los diferentes pasos del tiempo dan pie a que las relaciones sean más creíbles y fuertes que en otros juegos cuyo tiempo in-game son... ¿Días? ¿Cómo te vas a enamorar en una semana?
Las directrices que apuntan para seguir el orden de personajes es la mejor sin duda, porque se va desvelando todo el entresijo de la trama poco a poco, con diferentes matices muy interesantes.
En fin, a mi me ha encantado, ha hecho que me conmueva, que deteste a algunos personajes, que adore a los husbandos (especialmente a Fritz y a Waltz, que tienen las Deep History que además, son mucho más duras que el resto), y que me encante el concepto del juego en general.
¡Por cierto! Aunque esté en inglés, con un nivel básico del mismo, se entiende perfectamente todo (algunas cosas por contexto, por palabras muy específicas). Con una velocidad de texto adecuada, da tiempo a leer y traducir mentalmente lo que están hablando y al menos yo en ese aspecto, no he perdido el hilo en ningún momento.
¡Un saludo!

Edit: Añado que además hay un apartado de música del juego, donde reproducir las canciones las veces que quieras y que es magnífico. Y ya dejo de escribir, me ha gustado demasiado. <3

31421156.review:
[h1]Play it![/h1]

[b]This is good bad game.[/b]  It has interesting fable and hooks player to mouse.  One simply wants to find out what would be next and how it ends. I do reccomend playing through all possible action paths, because each path shows new aspects of the story.  "Fast Forward" makes exploration of different paths fast and easy.
Second major plus is the music.  I keep the soundtrack on all the time, and it sounds right.  That is really good, considering that in over 90% indie games I switch off soundtracks after 10 minutes.  
Graphics is decent too, although it can show Rumpel standing normally when text says that he throws arms upwards.

On the flip side, choices forking action are in strange places and unclear in terms of semantics of natural language (example: [spoiler]how can one forsee results of buying first gift vs. buying first groceries?[/spoiler]). I also miss choices which seems natural to me (example: [spoiler]Rod's bad end is based on idea that no one of people knowing his curse and princess' abilities would postpone certain wedding by one day[/spoiler]).

One warning: the save files are not downloaded to new computer, so if you change your machine in the middle of game, you would have to start from scratch.

31412433.review:
It's obvious that a lot of love was put in this game, and it has immense amounts of potential.
Overall, I'm very impressed, and from the amount of time I put into it and the enjoyment I got in return, I feel like it being free to play is doing the developers a disservice.

"Cinderella Phenomenon" deals with the grim subject of emotional child abuse in a surprisingly clever and sensitive way (dare I say, much better than I had expected, and much more openly than many big budget AAA games) that is so subtle, that if you were only to play one route, one could easily blink and miss it. On the surface it's rather lighthearted, reminiscent of classic, good-vs-evil stories, but it is precisely that simplicity that invites further exploration, which then unfolds a surprisingly complex and well-thought out story throughout the different routes.

Cloaking such a heavy story in something as benign as a fantasy fairytale provides a very stark, very striking contrast as well, which, while not exactly a unique idea with how many fairytale adaptations have been popping up lately, is a refreshing take on an old subject. The art is quite beautiful, the characters are mostly all very charming (you know, different strokes), and the game as a whole is very well-done.

I would also like to mention that after a while I found it a touch uncomfortable that almost all (not all, but enough for it to be noticeable) the characters of color in the end turned out to be either morally grey, or antagonists in some way, while the protagonists (or those wearing the facade of positivity) were almost all white. It's most noticeable in the discrepancy between the skintone of the protagonist and the mother (that was a bit of a "yikes" moment for me) or in the battles when multiple characters appear on screen at the same time, and while I'm almost sure it wasn't conscious, I would recommend keeping this in mind for future endeavors.

It definitely has some ways to go (maybe a skilled beta reader could have helped tie it all together a bit more tightly, remove or tweak some extra lines of dialogue that make some parts feel a bit clunky, and clean up something that is so full of ideas and obvious passion from the team), but overall, it is definitely worth your time.

31398780.review:
I am so impressed with this game. I'm currently running an otome/visual novel review site, so I play a lot of them. I downloaded this completely blind with zero expectations and I was blown out of the water. 

This game is so user friendly, with great graphics, easy save/load tools, and even a skip feature (which is nice if you've already completed one ending and want to see the other). The art is stunning and has very high quality CG's. The background music does such a great job setting the scene without distracting from the story.

The characters are super lovable, especially the dateable ones. I appreciate how this game steers clear from the stereotypical "I'm a teenage girl lost in love lalala life's great" main character. The authors did a fantastic job creating a main character that is easily hated, but you also find yourself rooting for her the whole time.

Story is full of creativity and I'm always a sucker for a good fairytale. They did a great job sticking to the storyline and leaving very few plotholes. Both the good endings and bad endings will make you cry (fair warning). This game is fantastic and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a new visual novel to play. (10/10 recommend Karma's route. I'm in love.)

31290738.review:
This is a beautiful game. I must admit I am sometimes amazed how some of the free-to-play games outshine some of the games priced at $30 or more. This one definitely fits that description. You play a Princess cursed with the Cinderella curse, a curse that can only be broken if you do three good deeds. The Fairytale Curse itself is the creation of her mother (though she is unaware of that at first), for when the Grimm tales first appeared it caused a Witch Hunt that nearly killed the Witches, of which the former queen was the chief.

That behind us, there are five choices for you to pursue, other cursed individuals. At first, you only have the ability to choose three of them, but after completing two of those three, the other two will unlock. The suggested path is Rod, Karma, Rumpel, Fritz and Waltz; the first three of which are the original choices. Through your choices and actions, you can end up with either the bad or good ending for said individual.

It is a fun game, and twists some of the fairy tales involved.

31257907.review:
Hands down one of the best free games on Steam. If you enjoy visual novels, that is. In fact, the quality of Cinderella Phenomenon is higher than many games I've paid a pretty penny for.

This game is extremely well written. You can see my play time and not once did I ever tire of the story. There are also very few typos and for the amount of dialog there is, that's almost unbelievable. Music is excellent - also something I never tired of. Actually, I can't think of anything negative about Cinderella Phenomenon. Considering it's free, the only reason to not give it a try is if you're not at all interested in fairytale romances.

There are five love stories to pursue here that follow five different fairytales. All the characters are connected by the same plot but, still, each of the five paths are very different from each other. Five unique and gripping stories. You will have many choices throughout and though they don't really affect the immediate plot, they definitely have an impact on the ending. Also, just so you know, there are no half-naked women or explicit dialogs/scenes. A good love story doesn't need those.

I actually debated quite awhile about writing this review because, as good as I (sometimes) am with words, I feel I just can't do this game justice. It's that good. I laughed and cried and gasped - all many times. Each story tugged at my heart. Then, on top of an amazing game, you add in Steam achievements, gorgeous gallery pictures, and access to all musical scores. How is this game free???? The way I play games: I download, play, and then uninstall. But if I uninstall Cinderella Phenomenon, it will disappear and I'll be sad. So this game will be an exception to the rule. I know I will play it again because it's better than most books I read for my book group. :p

Please give Cinderella Phenomenon a try and resist the urge to rush through it just to 100% it. That would be depriving yourself of an amazing experience.

31242905.review:
A non-typical otome heroine in a fairy tale world who goes from Princess to peasant with a curse. She pairs up with someone else who's been cursed so they can try to help each other break their curses. 

I honestly really loved this game. The characters are endearing and well-developed. I especially love the MC, Lucette. She starts out as cold and untrusting, but it's very clear that she's been conditioned this way. Lucette is nicknamed the "Ice Princess" at the start and throughout each route that persona thaws as she is given new perspective and her worldview is changed. It makes for a very believable story of personal growth. 

You cannot go wrong with this game. It's free, gorgeous, funny, and heartbreaking. Every route at me tearing up at some point, and that was before I even got to the Bad Ends. (My husband actually asked me, "Why do you put yourself through this heartache??" Because the stories are SO GOOD!)

31227185.review:
For everyone that enjoys visual/otome novels you can't really lose with this one. Bad case scenario you try, don't like it, erase it and no problem. It was free to play anyway. Worse case scenario, you don't try it and potentially miss out on a game that might have been a pleasantly surprising. So, try it. 

Anyway, my take on the game:

--- Visually appealing. I have seen/played visual novels on Steam that are NOT free with "way" less appeal than the artwork of this game. Visually, I think, it competes with the bigger game titles easily. 

--- Plenty of depth and story. It is not a quick game you can skim through and finish with little time and effort. I tend to enjoy reading a lot and this was a plus to me. 

--- A decent amount of music backgrounds to compliment the story as you read. 

--- Plenty of dialogue options and choices. I also tend to like experimenting with those details. The only thing I will mention is that some of the choices you can make do not seem like terrible choices and too many will lead you to a bad end. Just saying. I had a difficult time figuring out Karma's personality, but in hindsight, I guess some of the choices that were not "ideal" made sense after you figure out his curse and why some of the choices might not be ideal. 

--- Many endings, two for each of the five main characters you pursue. 

--- I really enjoyed the fairy tale curses. One thing the story plot did was keep you on your toes with the main questions. 1. What is their curse? 2. Why did they get it? 3. In what way does that particular curse affect those characters. 4. and how do they end up breaking it? The fact that I kept these questions in my mind throughout the visual novel illustrates the depth of this story.

--- The MC is not necessarily likable in the beginning, but she is not (by any means) a flat character because overtime she grows and changes. 

--- You may not like all the male characters. I didn't. I found it difficult to like Karma whatsoever simply because I could not shake the "girly" image from my mind after all that. I guess it makes sense after the fact as to why he dresses like a girl. I get it. BUT STILL. He was also a bit too arrogant for me. 

--- I am going to go out on a limb here and say [spoiler] Waltz [/spoiler] is the main male character. Why? Major spoilers ahead...[spoiler] It had the happiest ending (in some ways), he apparently loved the MC the longest (ever since the MC and him were kids), and unlike the other routes his story seem to wrap the end and felt more complete. Everyone gathered together to say their final farewells which they did not really do in the other routes. [/spoiler] I would recommend to do this route last. I also happened to have liked his route the most. 

--- I don't know. What I didn't like about this game? I did not care for Karma or Grumple and although I laughed a few times in both, I just didn't care for them a whole lot. The others were okay to play. I happen to like that broom character. It is a shame they only made it poke its character out from the corner of the screen once, but meh. There is such a thing as overdoing it. There were also other characters that brought life to the story and helped set the atmosphere well. I just do not feel like going into detail. Oh yeah. Varg's name is terrible. And also, [spoiler] he was a NEAT character and, in my opinion, a better character than his counterpart. Damn, I was sad to see him go =/ [/spoiler]

--- There is zero voice audio. I technically don't mind a WHOLE lot. It is a nice extra feature, but I am a reader foremost and as long as it is a good story, audio takes second place. (Damn after playing a bunch of visual novels I do really like Japanese.) Oh well =D

FREE!!!

31192655.review:
This free to play otome visual novel from Dicesuki feature a female protagonist Lucette Riella Britton, the crown princess to the throne of Angielle, a kingdom ruled by her father King Genaro Britton III which was recovering after a Great War between fairies, humans and witches where the balance between light and darkness was disrupted and Fairytale Curses were frequently applied by witches on people. Bitter and detached from years of neglect by her father and from her mother's constant warnings to her to avoid people, Lucette has a reputation for being the Ice Princess where most people she saw avoided her and feared her for unknown reasons. Despite attempts by King Genaro, stepmother Ophelia Widdensov and stepsister Emelaigne Widdensov to get closer to Lucette and convince Lucette to open up to them, Lucette remained distant to them. One day, one of the dolls Lucette has turned into a witch Delora who applied a Cinderella curse where Lucette is reduced to a peasant girl and her father and the guards at the palace somehow failed to recognize her.

With nowhere to go, Lucette ended up at the Marchen Tavern, where all people who were cursed go to and can try to find some way to undo their curse. At the tavern, Lucette is introduced to the fairy Parfait and Delora who told Lucette that the only way to break her curse was to complete 3 good deeds where her glass shoe necklace will eventually form a pair of glass shoes. At the tavern, Lucette is introduced to four people with a Fairytale Curse: Miss Karma/Klaude A.R.M. Almonte, a cross-dressing lost prince from the neighbouring kingdom of Brugantia with the Beauty and the Beast curse, Waltz Creswell, a street performer with the Neverland curse, Lucette's stepbrother Rod Widdensov with the Mermaid curse and Rumpel/Chevalier Du Mont a bespectacled man with a blank notebook and no memory of his name or past with the Rumpelstiltskin curse along with Annice Willowe, a former maid at the palace, Julien Valiente and Garlan Belrott, former knights at the Order of Caldira who help out at the Marchen and are non-cursed as additional supporting characters.

At the advice of Parfait and Delora, Lucette decides to partner with Karma, Rumpel or Rod to undo her curse and also help to undo her partner's curse over 10 chapters which can lead to a good or bad ending. Upon reaching a good ending, the title screen will have the character's portrait replacing a different coloured crystal icon. [spoiler]In subsequent playthroughs after reaching at least 2 different good endings, Lucette will also have additional unlocked routes with Sir Fritzgerald Leverton, her former knight and personal bodyguard at the palace with the Big Bad Wolf curse or with Waltz Creswell which can also lead to a good or bad ending. At least one achievement is reported and found to be buggy, it is recommended to save at least one good ending for the final playthrough and final ending achievement to be able to unlock the Happily Ever After and Never Ever After achievements correctly.[/spoiler]

The game has plenty of save slots to allow different gameplay and dialogue choices to be made during the game, with a red/purple/green/grey crystal popup icon to help players reach the good/bad endings of each route and the option to skip and fast-forward any part of the game. Each route requires approximately 2-3 hours to finish. Soundtracks, CGs and overall game presentation are great. Highly recommended as a free to play game.

I have nominated this game for Most enjoyable free-to-play game for 2017(Additional category award) in November 2017 Autumn Sale.

31148185.review:
If you're a fan of otome or VNs then there is no excuse for you to not at least try Cinderella Phenomenon. From it's non-existent price tag, wonderful characters, beautiful art and excellent story telling, this game is everything a good VN should be. 

CP takes those familiar fairy tales that we all know and love and gives them a little twist, making them the curses that plague the Lucette and the romanceable men. It's not done in a gimmicky way and never feels forced, it makes CP a breath of fresh air in a market when it still seems like a lot of otome/VNs are focused on slice-of-life, which isn't bad it just isn't new.  

The biggest thing that stands out to me in the this game and makes it memorable though is the MC herself. I was fully prepared to either spend the entire game hating Lucette or just uninstalling it and forgetting it after spending a few moments with her in the beginning. She isn't a person I would like to even be in the same room with. Lucette is rude, selfish, tactless, untrusting, and doesn't have a kind bone in her body, but as you slowly find out why she is this way, it makes sense. I quickly grew to love her and cheer for her as she went on her Cinderella journey to accomplish three good deeds. Lucette is flawed, and that's what makes her perfect. She grows throughout the whole story on every single route, and it's made even more believable since the game takes place over months instead of days. The relationships and character growth actually have a time line that make sense. 

The romance options are all different and wonderful as well. They all have the same basic conflict at their core, but each story is diverse so you never feel as though you're playing the same route over and over again. My only complaint lies with Fritz's route as it almost felt as though he was....forgotten? I don't know if it was just me but I felt like we saw less of his story and more of another character, however it was still a well-written route.  

All the side characters are excellent as well, both the heroes and the villians. Everyone has a motivation for what they are doing, revenge, loyalty, love, greed, and all the characters feel full of life. I can easily say I loved all of them, even the villians. 

Now, the only problem I had with the game itself might have been a RenPy issues more than anything. There were a few times that the game would simply crash on me or it would freeze while transitioning to the next scene. I also had a few times where I couldn't use the skip feature despite having just finished that route, and also could not use the fast forward button in the prologue of the game. They were quick issues to fix and I was able to avoid some of them once I found what they were. 

That aside Cinderella Phenomenon is certainly a game that I will still love years from now and I look forward to anything else that Dicesuke produces. Like I said before, if you are a fan of this genre, there is no reason for you to at least not give this game a chance.

31121002.review:
This is a well-written and beautiful game. I kid you not if I say that it can beat most of the commercial games out there despite being freeware! Either way, it's something you should add in your game library and play.

The art is pleasing to the eye. Music suits the atmosphere of the novel, and the timing is good too.

But I think the main attraction is the heroine, Lucette. You witness her development into a strong character in every route and it's admirable how she manages to carry herself despite all she has been through. The girl will take no shit from anyone [spoiler] except her mom maybe but you can change that with the right choices [/spoiler]; expect her to make you voluntarily bow your head down to her.

I really commend the writing, though some things could be a little more fleshed out, With that said, even the minor characters are memorable enough. [spoiler] I like how they incorporated a True End that tied the other routes together quite nicely [/spoiler]

All in all, this is a good game. I hope more otome games with this quality (or better) come out in the future

Lucette é uma princesa cujo coração é praticamente de gelo - amarga, rebelde, fria e infeliz - que, um dia, amaldiçoada por uma bruxa, perde riquezas, títulos, trono e até mesmo sua família - que não se lembra mais dela.

Has all the look, feel, and heart of a commercial visual novel without the price tag (though if you have cash to spare, it's pay as you want on itch.io) 

Pros: [list]
[*]Has all the settings you'd want and expect. Skip, fastforward, text speed, etc.
[*]Has a music room and, although it's royalty-free, the selection fits the story's atomsphere.
[*]Simplistic and charming artstyle. Plenty of CGs (12 for each romance, but many more for other scenes), good sprite variety, lots of detailed backgrounds... it's hard to find a fault in the art!
[*]LIKEABLE CHARACTERS. If you're tired of jerk boys who treat the MC like trash yet she inexplicably falls in love with them... then this is for you. Maybe not such a good choice if you're only into sadistic yanderes.
[*]MC has a personality. And a damn good one at that. 
[*]The storylines are all well executed, and I could feel there was a lot of thought and effort put into each one. 
[/list]

Cons: [list]
[*]It isn't focused [i]too much[/i] on romance, but they've already got a fandisk in the works so that's kinda covered... 
[*]Um... that's it? I didn't experience any bugs, but Dicesuki seem dedicated to fixing errors as they crop up anyway.
[/list]

31051101.review:
I... don't really know what to say or where to start. Of the otome I've played, this might actually be my favourite. Every storyline is different, no cutscenes are identical once you actually get started on a route even though some events happen in all five storylines, all five of the men are interesting and unique in their own ways but I found none of them distasteful, and the protagonist's journey to obtain three good deeds is constructed in a way so her character development is believable. It's like a really good book you just can't put down, but I don't think that description does it justice.

I will say though, Peter Pan isn't a fairy tale in the way the other four are (that is, it's not a short story, it's a full-on book AND a play), but frankly I don't mind since I'm a huge fan of Peter Pan and Waltz's story might have been my favourite of the five. Also that's not really a complaint, it's a logic flaw.

I went in the recommended order (Rod, Karma, Rumpel, Fritz, Waltz) by sheer coincidence, and it's the order I think it works best in having cleared all five of them. You could switch Fritz and Waltz, if you're concerned about being spoiled on how to break Waltz's curse, though, because how it's done is spoiled in Fritz's storyline, but Waltz's storyline also spoils Fritz's curse and Waltz tells you pretty early on how to break his, so either way you're going to have one of them spoiled.

I'm struggling to understand why this one's free when it's so good- I've paid money for a few otome and not enjoyed them this much. I mean, I'm not complaining but wow, this one's really good, and I'd absolutely be interested to see more games from the people who made it. The act of not copy-pasting identical events between storylines might seem a small thing, but I appreciate that though this scene happens in all five stories, it's different in all five of them. I really enjoyed the concept itself. I just want more, I suppose, and I'm kind of disappointed I finished all five storylines already, haha.

31048362.review:
Mommie Dearest...is actually Mommie Dearest


I've never been one to really play Otome/Visual Novel games but I found this one was free and decided it might be a nice way to explore a different kind of gaming. 

I will start off with the art style, which is the first thing that I noticed immediately. The art is gorgeous from the splash screen, to the sprites, and finally all the way to the backgrounds and the closeups. You can tell how much work the devs put into this and it definitely shows. The art style is what I would call a typical anime style, but that doesn't make it bad. 

Next, the music was beautiful. It wasn't super over the top and in your face, but it was exactly where it needed to be. It added the perfect amount of ambiance to set the mood for each scene. My only complaint would be that it could get repetitive, but really it's to be expected when you're trying to read through scenes over and over. It's a miniscule complaint really.

The storyline was well done. I enjoyed how every Fairytale curse has a slight twist, making the story more interesting while remaining similar to actual fairytales. This  would seem predictable,  but it allows the player to piece things together while still remaining in the dark, while simultaneously having an idea of what might possibly happen. I especially enjoyed each of the endings (for good endings) where there was still an almost bittersweetness to it all. 
(Here comes the fortune cookie bit) After all, life isn't 100% happy ending, there's going to be some sour with the good. 

I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys some good fluff and good graphics. Even better, this game is free, so really there's nothing to lose.

31030522.review:
Normally, I don't play otome/visual games because I see the usual tropes and very overused stereotypes that makes the characters seem like cardboard cut-outs of each other. This game I came on a chance when I watched a YouTuber play it. And I'm glad to say that this is one of the rare visiual/otome games I genuinely liked.

First, I was instantly intrigued by the MC. She wasn't anything I've seen in a visual novel, where usually the MC is dense to a point where she lacks any character development at all. The MC was the oposite of what I expected from the usual. Her flaws were the best part about her, and it made her relatable. An unlikeable character, in my opinion, is better than some Mary-Sue. That being said,  my absolute FAVORITE parts of the game was the character development and writing style. It was realistic. Lucette didn't change overnight. She slowly became a better person through her actions and choices.

Most importantly, she stood up for herself. She didn't let herself get mistreated or pushed around by anyone, even if they were the love interests. The MC helped herself and others become a better person. Yes, the game did use stereotypes, but it was well-done. It gave distinct traits that made characters unique and a three-dimensional person. I'm also very impressed that, while the game was fairly low-budget, the developers managed to weave a well-written story with depth and intrigue. The graphics weren't the highest of quality, but, again, even otome games with beautiful animation can have the crappiest plot and characters. 

Very long rant, but there was just much to say about the game!

The game art and composition are stunningly gorgeous considering it is a free game. I played the demo and couldn't bring myself not to pay something for it when I downloaded it on itch.io and I'm glad I did, the creators deserve it! The art is very vibrant, colorful and aesthetically pleasing all around. The music is beautiful and definitely helps to set the tone and mood of each scene (although I have to agree with a prior review stating the opening was a bit pitchy). The characters are all so multi-dimensional and interesting it's one of the rare times I actually looked forward to playing each route (I usually just go for the guy I'm most attracted to tbh). I played by the recommended order and I am glad I did, everything unfolded perfectly that way. 

I greatly enjoyed the way the mc grew and changed, it felt very natural, unforced, and realistic. The writing was very well worded and constructed, it made me feel emotionally invested in the story and the characters in it (even the side characters). I laughed, cried, cheered and felt proud for the mc, just as I imagine she did as the story unfolded. Some of the routes just swept me away and others broke my heart (especially Karma, Fritz, and Waltz). Karma and Waltz are definitely my favorites, I have an awful weakness for TDH (tall dark and handsome) and pretty boys.

I don't know if I can bring myself to play the bad routes yet even though I am curious as to how they go. Great job Dicesuki and I will look forward to your work in the future!

30979185.review:
TL;DR - gorgeous graphics, wonderful story, immersive world, engaging characters, no major problems or shortcomings, and I can't believe IT'S FREE so go ahead and play it already!

At time of writing I've only finished the first route, Rod's, so this will be based on that.

First off, that intro video swept me away! I wasn't expecting vocals so when those kicked in it became 10x more interesting! And the video itself was really well put together. The title screen looks lovely, in fact all of the art and UI look incredible - so much so that I can't believe this game is free! Now when I started playing all I could do was groan at the MC's awful attitude and horrible people skills. She's an awful person to start out with, and I could not sympathize with her in the least. This made me worried for how well the story was going to go and how much I'd enjoy it, but surprisingly (or maybe not? seems a little tropish) she does get better and eventually learns her lesson. In fact, watching her grow as a person was one of the most interesting parts of the game. I wasn't able to relate to her, but I enjoy her as a character.

I was surprised to find out that you choose your route as an explicit option. No guessing the right responses to the right people to get the route you wanted; they are presented in a pretty list and you simply select one. You still have to get all of the right responses to get the good ending for that route, but that was to be expected. Speaking of that, the right choice indicator didn't work how I expected at all. If it's your first time through a route it'll make a small sound at some point after you made your choice (if it's right). If you've gotten the bad ending, it unlocks the fast forward feature which skips to the next choice, and the right choice indicator becomes a sound and a purple crystal in the top right. I think it would be nicer to have it indicate the right choice BEFORE you make it, not after, but it's not a big deal. Saving and loading is incredibly fast.

The story is incredible. Once I got to about Chapter 2 or 3 (can't remember), when things really start picking up as the MC meets some new people and is taken to a new place, I got sucked in. The characters are all interesting, and I was immediately curious as to everyone's backstories and why they act the way they do. After choosing Rod's route (I've decided to follow the recommended order), things pick up again and I started to really care about him and his problems. The partnership between him and the MC is a rocky road, but it seems to bring out the best in both of them and I loved that! A lot of plot points were fairly obvious and easy to figure out, but I still teared up at that bad end and felt the love with the good end :3 Now I'm eager to do the other routes to find out what thier issues are and how to resolve them. I'm not so much interested in dating them anymore, because Rod is best boy <3

Oh and there's cool visual treats like a simple bowing animation (yeah the portraits just bob up and down but it looks like bowing/curtseying!) or a special effect when magic is casted. I also like the inclusion of the MC's portrait in the corner when she's talking, and the super fancy font for names - so pretty! The game is unbelievable gorgeous and for that alone I wouldn't mind paying something for it, not to mention the incredible story is worth more on top of that!

I only have a few nitpicks: there's a couple of typos and grammar errors, not many so far though so it's not a big deal. In fact, again, it is very well written! And I also wish there was a borderless window feature, as I was trying to talk to a friend while playing it and it was kind of frustrating, even with a second monitor. That's about all I can think of..

I would definitely recommend this if you like visual novels/otome, fairy tales, and the subversion of fairy tale tropes!

PS: I'd love an instrumental version of that theme song ;)

30976599.review:
全线已通关，有新意的地方是活用了几个童话的梗，女主的性格也并不是常规乙女游戏里的圣母性格。看了一些中文的评价，大部分人大概打通两三条线就撑不住了，说实话我觉得很遗憾，这个游戏的五个可攻略角色里，有两个是必须通关了其他三条线才能解锁的。而这两条线恰恰是整个游戏里最能直观看见故事全貌，而且故事设定也最不突兀的两条线，所以没有撑到后面两条线的玩家，我只能说为他们感到可惜了。
当然这个游戏也存在它的缺陷，一方面是游戏各个线路的设定略长，而且大部分线路的故事都只讲了人物的一部分性格，要看透彻整个故事必须打完五条线，这对那些打一两条线就已经开始感到疲惫的玩家而言很不友好。另一方面是有些线路的感情发展略牵强，让人打的有点蛋疼[spoiler] 比如某位红发美人的BE线	[/spoiler]。最后就是硬件质量问题，音乐方面质量还是非常好的，然而CG就有一点不尽人意了，不少CG都有人物走形的问题，不过考虑到这是个免费游戏，还是可以忽略的。
最后希望制作组在保证质量的前提下继续出游戏，只要他们乐意出，我一定会掏钱支持的。

30974415.review:
Let me start off by saying- Wow. just..wow~!
I remember playing Dicesuki's first game,Locked heart,right after it came out and i loved it.
upon hearing they were creating another game,i was ecstatic and couldn't wait to get my hands on it~
i downloaded the non-steam version as soon as it was released and moved my playthrough here as soon as i could.
and i'll admit,i stayed up far too late last night eagerly playing through the routes.
now that i've finished all of them,i absolutely have to leave a review.

i'll begin with the story.
i found it to be a very interesting plot,and loved learning bits about it as i finished route after route- i love the fairytale theme,and found its betrayal very creative~ the idea behind 'fairytale curses' based off of stories,but twisted into something a little different feels very unique to me.
and i may say this a lot in my reviews,but i mean it every time- i adore the characters~ by the time i was through,i was very attached to all of them~ (though i will admit to having some favorites [strike] *coughs* Karma and Waltz [/strike])
The art is very cute and enjoyable,and i love the colors and character designs involved.
the music in this game is also very good,and i very much enjoy the original music in the opening~
another thing i do want to mention is that i liked having the choice indicator option~ Personally for me,who sometimes prefers to know before hand if i'm making the right choices,it was nice to not need a walkthrough to know if i was doing well or not. though i also appreciate that you can turn it off,for anyone who prefers to play totally blind or just doesn't feel like its necessary.

i feel sort of proud having finished- watching the main character come so far,as well- watching her grow and learn and form bonds with those around her.
this game made me very emotional at the end of it all,and i loved it.
Cinderella Phenomenon is- well,Phenomenal~ ;) hehe
Jokes aside,i really do highly  recommend this game.
